description:
I guess I was living under a rock before I started exploring SF and heard about this place. They're the (overflow?) sister restaurant to the original which is just next door and which got its start as a neighborhood restaurant before getting its place on the map with its famed chicken wings. 

We rushed over after work on a Friday night worrying about how long the line would be. We'd walked by a couple of times only to see lines that were at least an hour long. We got there at 6.30pm, wrote our name and party size on the wall and... got lucky!

San Tung next door had closed for renovations so maybe the large parties figured they didn't want to deal with the crushing lines when there was only one place to get their fried chicken fix. 

There were a few groups in front of us but we were the only party of 2 and didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes! By the time we left an hour later, the wait looked like it would take an hour too. Bring on the fried chicken. 

This is definitely a no frills restaurant. The tables weren't particularly clean when we sat down and there was still a piece of fried rice on my chair. 

We got an order of wings and some spicy black bean noodles to share. The black bean noodles appeared in two minutes and had clearly just been tossed in the pre-prepped sauce but they were fine. Could have used more meat but a really large portion and decently textured noodles. My gripe here is that the noodles were too long and needed to be cut in half to be served or at least give us more serving utensils than two spoons!

The wings were big. An order comes with about 12 pieces of either drumlets or the wing itself - all loaded with meat, deep fried (possibly double fried from the crispiness they got on that skin) and tossed in a sweet Asian sauce. 

The only way to describe the wings is that it went all out for flavor on every dimension. It hit you on the head with how crisp the skin was, how juicy the meat was with every bite, and how over sweet the Asian sauce was that they were drenched in. 

If you want subtle flavors and refined service, go somewhere else. If you want some top notch wings that'll make your doctor cry, go to San Tung II
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Since the original San Tung is closed for renovation I had to go into #2. I was there at just about 5:15 PM (15 minutes after opening) and the place was already filled with a line out the door. 

Their seating method isn't necessarily the best but the food was well worth the wait. You have to write down your name and number of people at your party and just wait for them to call you. They do not have estimate times and don't like to be asked.

I came here for one thing and one thing only - fried chicken. It was sticky, sweet, spicy, and straight up delicious.
author: Inci A.

description:
Rating - 3.5/5; would be down to go back, but would not seek this place out

Heads up: San Tung original location is closed for remodeling right now, so the wait is extra long for the time being. Came in on Sunday night around 8pm and we waited about 40 min, even with half the people before us having left.

So overall solid food, but I don't think anything really wowed me. We tried the green bean, the original crispy chicken and the black bean noodles. The chicken was probably the best thing, which was fried very well and came out crispy and piping hot. The sauce was good, but quickly tired out my palate with its sweetness and tanginess. Not really very spicy at all. I felt like I could only eat two before I needed something else for a bit of contrast. Unfortunately though, the sauce on the green beans had a very similar taste profile and black bean noodles, while different, definitely still had a significant sweetness component to the taste. Everything on its own was solid, but nothing made me think "I would want to order this again". 3.5 for overall experience, rounded up to 4 because we mightttt have somewhat brought that on ourselves with sub-optimal meal composition choices.
author: Edward R.

description:
As much as I wish this place was overrated - so I don't have to venture out to Inner Sunset for a 2 hour wait - ... San Tung #2 (and #1) is anything but. 

Before the wings...
- Put our table of 4 on the whiteboard, and there were probably 8-10 parties before us. We were hopeful.
- 45 minutes later, barely any names before us got crossed off. Why is everyone eating so slowly??
- We went to walk around. There's nothing to see. No bars for a drink to pass the time either. 
- 1.5 hours later, we're getting pretty hangry and so are the others in line.
- They tell us there's only 10 orders of wings left (!). This is at 7:30pm on a Saturday night. I don't understand. We discuss our order strategy and secretly hope the 2 parties before us are not Hooters Wing Eating Champions. 
- As a result of boredom and hangriness, we scrutinized their table operations. Much space is wasted and you're definitely at an advantage if you're a 2-person party.
- We finally got called! We sit down and order right away. The food came out REALLY fast.

After the wings...
- The wings were just the right amount of crisp, spice, and sweet. Definitely a lot of sugar but so delicious and worth the wait. Happy gal right here.
- The black bean noodles (portion was HUGE) and string beans were really good as well. I'll definitely get these again when I come back. The mongolian beef was average.
- Apparently they never freeze their wings and want to make sure their wings are fresh everyday. 
- Must go to bathroom to wash sticky hands but there's only 1 bathroom again. All I want to do is wash my hands.

Aggghhhh. Btw, these wings were so good even when I devoured them cold and soggy straight out of the fridge. Not sure what was in them, but I'm addicted to San Tung crack wings.
author: Sally L.

description:
Being a Bay Area native and living in SF for years, I admit I always heard about San Tung and their infamous wings, but never really had a chance to try it out. So finally, I decided it's a sin for me to live here any longer, and not know what the hype is about. 

Let's start with the good stuff, and what people are probably snooping review after review for. THE WINGS. Keep in mind there are two types of wings, the wet and dry fried. I've heard the dry fried is the way to go. To be honest, they were good, but it didn't blow my pants off like it did for some people. Would I order them again? Yes I would. Would I go out of my way for them? no. We also ordered the black bean noodles (meh, 2/5,) honey walnut prawns (good! 4/5,) and the garlic green beans, which were okay as well. Overall the food was okay. but to be really honest, it doesn't stand out from the hundreds of Chinese restaurants all over the city.
author: Maggie L.

description:
** Extension of the extremely popular restaurant in SF with long lines that can get very backed up. If you are going to eat here, definitely go only if you want the wings!

San Tung has two resturants next to each other, and this is the smaller of the two resturants. San Tung 2 offers basically the same food, except one item in which I can't quite remember (dumplings?), and is mostly used as a spill over for the main one since the restaurant is so popular and lines are always piling up. If you need to get something quick or are really hungry, this is probably not the move since you are going to have to expect a decent wait. Definitely go either really early or close to closing to avoid a wait. I went close to closing on a Sunday night and waited maybe 30-40 minutes. 

WINGS - by far the best thing they offer here. If you aren't coming for the wings, I'd say you probably shouldn't eat here since this is what they are known for and is by far their best item. Don't see the point in waiting for fried rice or other more generic dishes that you could get at other Chinese resturants without enduring such long lines. Eaten fresh, these are amazing. Great crispy texture with a sweet glazey touch that offers a unique twist and flavor. The wings are also slightly spicy, but I don't remember them being too hot. Make sure you enjoy these while they're piping hot.

STRING BEANS - Crunchy texture that offers are good veggie dish to complement the wings. This would definitely be my go-to veggie option every time I come here. 

BLACK BEAN NOODLE - Not too much to say on this one, I guess it was decent and what you expect from zha jian mian, but perhaps the noodles were a bit mushy. Still decent overall, but nowhere near as good as the wings. I think partially I enjoyed these more as well because I was so hungry after waiting a long time and this was the first thing that came out the kitchen.

Come on a day when you aren't rushed and patiently wait it out a least once for the wings!
author: Derek Y.

description:
Just as good as the original but a lot smaller for seating. San Tung was closed due to vacation but looked like for remodeling. So decided to go next door but the wait was 12 tables for 9 people. Luckily, a lot of people left and the list went down fast. 

It's a lot smaller for tables so the biggest table was for 7. But they combined some tables and accommodated us. 

All you really need to order is the dry chicken wings that aren't really dry. The black bean noodles are decent. Green beans are good. 

Service was a bit better than next door. Good option to beat the crowds next door.
author: James H.

description:
We smoked.
At Hippy Hill.
For 420.
ThenOfCourseGotHungry.
We walked.
Walked!
To San Tung.
So close.
As if they knew to open a second location there.
Near Hippy Hill.
For days like this.
420 and the munchies.
Oh deng, San Tung?
The same one I've had bookmarked for years now?
And have yet to mark off my list?
Yes.
That one. That. ONE!
Steaming hot, crispy yet sticky and utterly mouthwatering chicken wings.
Mmmm.
Mmmmmmm.
San Tung.
author: Vi T.

description:
Our friends told us about this place about 2ish years ago. This weekend was the time to try this place! No kidding this place legit. Their wings are amazing but not only that, their chowmein and broccoli beef are great as well. Just come to this place and experience the glory of the wings and the food! 
If I just had a bigger stomach and not trying to fit into a a dress I would have eaten all the food !
author: Zynette C.

description:
I really want to experience the original San Tung, but the line is always sooooooo long whenever we've tried to visit at dinner time. I'm not sure when is the best time to go for a reasonable wait time, so if anyone has any pro tips, please holla!

The line was super long for San Tung 2 as well, so we actually left to have dinner at Ushi Taro...had dessert...and then wandered our way back to San Tung 2 around 9PM for some wings. By then, the wait time was less than 20 minutes. 

We were pretty full, so we only got an order of the wings. We'd hoped to get boneless, but they were out. I guess this is one of the reasons to come by earlier...we also contemplated ordering the fried rice, but decided we'd done enough indulging for the day.

The wings were sticky and oh-so-delicious. They're deep fried to perfection and then tossed in a sweet and slightly spicy sauce. They were quite messy to eat and I could have used more napkins/ wet wipes, but they were definitely worth the mess!!

The table next to us ordered peanut noodles, which looked super delicious! I definitely cannot wait to be back to try out more dishes and get the boneless chicken wings!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Was trying to call in for pickup, but yelp didn't post their number, so here you go guys!! 

BEST WINGS EVER!!
author: Anita C.

description:
The chicken wings ($14.50) from this place are legendary. They are really crunchy with sweet and slightly spicy sauce. The sauce drenched the chicken pieces and somehow, the chicken remained crispy even after 15 minutes. The string beans ($12.50) were really tasty as well. They were also crunchy and long. 

My general advice is don't bring any party above 2 people aka don't invite your friends if you have any. 
A group of 4 arrived a little after 5 pm, which was when they opened. My party of 2 was able to sit down and order at around 6 pm. We were the 17th group on the waiting list. When we finished eating at around 7 pm, we still saw them waiting outside. 
A party of 11 waited so long that the moment their name was called, people clapped for them and said, "we are so proud of you! You waited so long." If you like to be awarded for your patience, feel free to bring as many people as you like...

Will probably come back with a party of 2 or by myself.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Before tonight I've only ever had take out from this place (and it's sister location right next door). Got the chance to eat here tonight and the food is just as good for takeout as it is for dining in. Nothing special about the ambiance or restaurant, but the fry fried chicken is definitely something to rave about.  The green beans are also yum. 

We tried other "dry fried" dishes and it's basically the same flavors with just a switch on what the protein is. So stick with the chicken and I would recommend that you definitely don't order multiple dry fried dishes and nothing else. 

5 star chicken 3 Star everything else. 

Note - if you go to this location you can't order the dumplings and potstickers that are available next door.
author: Joanne T.

description:
For me this place was not bad but not amazing. My friends recommended this place saying it was the best wings ever,  but they were ok. 

Why I was here // wanted to give this place a try after our run at Golden Gate Park 

Atmosphere // not overly busy, it's really funny because next door "San Tung" is crazy busy and it might be because they do the pot stickers and San Tung 2 doesn't.

Food // 
-peanut noodles // probably my favorite thing here out of all the things we got. The noodles are super super long and sauce is well balanced 
-original fried wings // I think my expectations were a bit too high for this one. They were ok. 
-rice // we ordered this but had to remind them to bring it out. 

Overall // I didn't see the hype and since it's on the other side of town I probably wouldn't go out if my way for it. Nonetheless I'm glad I tried it.
author: Emily T.

description:
The original San Tung was closed for vacation when I went, but good thing there's a second restaurant right next door! The wait wasn't actually too bad for me and my friends, maybe like 30 minutes or so.

Ordering was quick, and our food came out super fast as well. We ordered the Black Bean Sauce Noodles and the Chicken Wings. The handmade noodles were great, but the black bean sauce was just eh to me. I wish I'd gotten something with more of a kick instead, but there's always next time! The chicken wings were so fresh, hot, and crispy! They're my favorite thing on the menu besides the string beans. They've got a little spice to it, perfect if you'd like something with a kick.

You have to get the chicken wings if you're here!
author: Kathryn T.

description: Dry fried chicken wings, noodles with peanut sauce, and black bean noodles are the main things you need to order. The famous chicken wings you cannot pass up whenever you go to San Tung. They give you a lot per order. This place isn't too expensive for what you get. The food is pretty good. If you don't believe me, just you wait and see for yourself when you go. They almost always have a line of people waiting to be seated. You won't regret getting any of the dishes I recommended. They're my favorites for sure.
author: Allyson L.

description: The dried fried chicken was pretty good nice and crispy but the fried rice wasn't good rice was really mushy definitely not worth the price seafood noodle soups was okay definitely would recommend chicken wings that's about it .
author: Khadijah F.

description:
Best chicken wings! My friends from LA still do a pit stop here every time they visit. 

String beans and Black bean noodles are also the best I've had!

Worth the wait! Or, better yet order for pick up to avoid the crowds.
author: Miranda N.

description:
San Tung #2. A blessing for those that yearn for San Tung goodies but can handle passing on the dumplings and potstickers. If the latter is the goal, then #2 is definitely not for you. But after seeing a sign up sheet of 20 parties ahead of you, those dumplings may look less enticing.

When we went during a Saturday noon, #1 was popping but #2 was peaceful and had plenty of space. We got the chicken wings and spicy black bean noodles. The chicken reminded me of Korean fried chicken (think Bonchon/Kyochon) but less battered since it didn't have that double battered process. However, it made up for it with extra meat on the bones and drenched in it's tangy sweet sauce. The noodles were delicious and flavorful and comes with a ton of food. Could use some more eggs and meats, but definitely enough black bean sauce. 


Overall, a great place to get a ton of food for a good price and no wait.
author: Will X.

description:
Skip the wait.

What I tried: 
*Dry fried chicken wings
*Peanut noodles 
*Dry fried fish 

Overall thoughts: 

*Pretty much the same food as the main restaurant next door but with no dumplings 

*Food comes out quick and is less busy so it's easier to get a server to check on you. Was seated right away too

*Food lives up to the hype!
author: Sarah W.

description:
If there was ever a place that I was thinking "Why Haven't I eaten here yet?" It would be this place. I realize my boyfriend ALWAYS talked about this place but it never really stuck in my mind. 

Friend suggested we grab some dinner here since he was craving some chicken wings. Went and ran in while they went to park the car, the host told me I had to wait for my party to get here. I was little irked but 20 minutes later I understood the looks on my bf & friend's face when they were like "Nooo, let's hurry up" 

Apparently, this place gets jam packed - we came a little bit before 5pm on a Sunday and by 6pm the restaurant went from 2-3 tables to full occupancy. There is a waitlist dry erase board where you can write your name and party size and they will call you when you're next. I was stupefied. 

The food was great. It's thursday right now, we went last Sunday and I'm reminiscing about the dry fried mushrooms and the chicken. Those were so tasty. The noodles we had were a little too saucy but I liked the noodle type that we had. I would definitely come here again and I told my boyfriend we're bringing people here when they visit from out of town.
author: Misty M.

description:
I really want to give San Tung 5 stars but I just can't. On vacation, I was taken here by friends and was told San Tung is a must try restaurant while in San Fran, famous for their chicken wings. We ordered 3 servings of the wings, the three deluxe noodles, and the string beans. Everything tasted average-good, but not amazing. 

The wings were good but they were way too sweet for my tasting. I'm a huge eater but I only managed to eat 4 wings. Some people enjoy a sweeter flavor but if you're like me a prefer a spicier flavor, these wings are just too sweet. The noodles were too salty and the string beans were just bland. I'm only giving it a 4/5 instead of 3/5 because my girlfriend LOVES San Tung. If you like sweet foods you'll enjoy San Tung, if you don't like sweet flavors you won't enjoy San Tung.
author: David H.

description:
The chicken wings live up to their reputation! Came here on a Saturday for lunch - the original San Tung was super busy, but San Tung 2 next door was no wait at all. 

I'm not sure what they don't serve here...but they do serve the highly acclaimed wings, and to me that is all that mattered. 

For 12 wings, we spent probably $15 and and it was super filling for 2 people. We also tried their fried rice, which complemented the wings nicely. 

Metered parking can be found at the front, but you're lucky if you actually get a spot. You can also park a few blocks down in the neighborhoods! 

This is also a short distance from golden gate park, so you can make it one of your stops!
author: Melanie B.

description: Really appreciate having a second location right next to the first one. They offer all the popular dishes that San Tung has -- so I love coming here since I only get those items anyways and it can be a shorter wait.
author: Emily C.

description:
How many calories is one chicken wang? I don't know, but it's definitely not low cal. But, is it worth it? Yes.

I'm so used to basic af wings at BWW or Wing Stop. These are the equivalent of the fast food-ish style wings. They're sweet and spicy and the excessive amount of calories. I love it. I would recommend.

The OG San Tung is closed for a few more days, but I came here last Sunday during OSL around 1:30PM and waited no more than 10 minutes for a table of two. I lucked out, because everyone before me was more than 3 people and they fill tables as they empty so we took the first empty table for 2. Downside is they close at 2:30PM and also that they're not 10 calories a wing.
author: Gillaine V.

description:
Came here the other day instead of waiting in line for the original San Tung, and 5/5 would recommend that you skip out on the HUGE line for the original unless you're really craving one of the few dishes they only have at the original location or someone is coming in from out of town and want to give them the whole experience.

Giving this place a 4/5 star because I truly believe there are over a dozen places in SF that have similar, if not better, chicken that you don't have to wait hours in line for.

Get the chicken(I prefer dry) and the black bean noodles. I'd stay away from the string beans because they taste a little sweet for my taste and cost too much
author: Andrew T.

description:
Skip the line from San Tung and go directly to San Tung 2.  Almost the same menu and without the crazy at least 1 hour wait. Get the original dry chicken wings and pork with hot pepper noodles. The best dishes in the house. The chicken wings at the 2 is much better than the original location next door. It's more gingery and peppery, instead of just sweet. They are so addictive that each person will want their own order. 

They have the hot pepper noodles here and not in the other location. It's spicy and saucy, just done right. They don't have dumplings at this location, so if you really want dumplings, you will have to wait next door.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Paid $53.80 for a to-go order. I asked about the hot and sour soup to see if it was good...they said it was...so I THOUGHT I ORDERED IT. When we got home and dug into our food...no soup. I called the number and let it ring until the very end 5 times. No answer.  Drove back 30 minutes across city and they said they didn't receive a phone call and told me I didn't actually order the soup. Both a Male and female employee argued with me about it and said I said no to the soup when I distinctly remember I said yes. 

So I spent all this time trying to call to save myself a drive. Then I get argued with on what I said. Then I showed them my phone so they saw how many times I called. Then I called in front of them..phone didn't ring. Then I verified the phone number and it's the same printed on the menu. 

They give ZERO F*CKS and come at you with attitude. Awesome.

Never eating at this establishment again. I'm used to poor service Asian restaurants...never have I felt so wronged at a restaurant before.
author: heather l.

description:
The OG San Tung restaurant was closed when we came, but luckily they're so popular that they opened up a second restaurant next door! 

We got here early afternoon on a Sunday after museum hopping and waited about half an hour for a party of 2, but the wait can definitely go a lot longer than that especially during dinner peak hours. After we sat down, we immediately ordered the black bean noodles and the original chicken wings. The black bean noodles were so good, and I loved that the flavor wasn't super overwhelming and salty like some of the other black bean noodles I've had. I've heard sooo much about the chicken wings and they did not disappoint. They're served with a lot of sauce, so another rice/noodle dish is needed to balance out the flavor. I definitely could have eaten the entire plate of wings because they're so freakin good! Glad I finally got to try this place out and see what all the hype was about.
author: Lydia S.

description:
I know...I'm super late on the San Tung hype. But the wings here are truly delicious! We came in on a Friday night. Looked at wait at the original San Tung and was like "heckkkkk naw." So we went in to 2 and we were third on the list and we got seated within 10 min! 

We ordered the Dry Wings, Green Beans, and Black Bean Noodles. All dishes were great. I love how the Wings were soo crispy, even with the sauce on top! The sauce was the perfect balance of sweet, salty, and spicy. I love how the seafood and beef in the black bean noodle dish were tender. The green beans were a perfect addition to lighten up the meal.

I would DEFINITELY recommend coming to San Tung 2 opposed to waiting in line next door for so long (if you don't mind that they don't serve the dumplings). I haven't been to the original, but my friend said the food is just as good!
author: Mary R.

description:
Delicious AF!!!! Best wings I've ever had! Portions were huge and service was quick! I also had the chicken soup noodles- very filling and hit the spot on a chilly SF evening, be sure to add plenty of Sriracha! 

We didn't have much of a wait for a table, (6ish on a Thursday), but as we were seated the line really started to form. 

Make sure your party is willing to pay cash or Venmo each other as they only accept 1 debit/credit card per table.

Will definitely visit again when I'm back in SF!
author: Keziah G.

description:
Even though they are known for their chicken wings, the sauce is extremely sticky and will get your hands dirty. I recommend getting the fish instead because it uses the same sauce, there are no bones, and it might be slightly healthier. (As healthy as fried food can get at least).

Their meat is extremely flavorful, so it can't be eaten alone. You have to balance it out with a side of rice. It's so flavorful and 'yeet hay' that it's good to have your second order be something more bland like vegetables or soup.

They have generous portions, so expect to take home leftovers!
author: Andrea T.

description:
Every time I have come here I've literally never strayed from the ol' reliable two punch combo of the green beans and wings. Only get the green beans because with all that fried chicken you need some veggie to balance it out.

The green beans are deliciously garlicy, sweet, and salty. Usually cooked to the perfect wellness where it still has that snap.

Anyways onto the wings, the star of the show. There are a few places I'd wait an hour plus for and this is one of them for these wings. I even heard the service is not good but I mean you can diss me and my family while throwing the wings onto the table. I wouldn't even hear you over the sweet symphony of flavors going on in my brain. The sauce that they use has the perfect amount of sweetness and savoryness with the meat still wonderfully juicy. The exterior is also very pleasantly crunchy. Maybe the best wings I've ever hadz

P.S. Flats are better than drums! :)
author: Joshua H.

description: This place is so popular it had to open up a second place next door to the original one!! The only difference is that the 2nd one doesn't have dumplings or potstickers, but the rest of the menu is the same! The fried chicken was so damn good, best I've ever had!!! If you're in the Bay Area, this is a must
author: Steven Z.

description:
My friends and I came here because we did not want to wait in line at San Tung. They basically have the same menu, with the exception of potstickers and dumplings. Since we came for dinner, we decided we weren't going to have dumplings anyway, so this would be an ok alternative. 

We tried the original dry fried chicken wings, spinach with garlic, and pork chow mein. The chicken wings were ok. I feel like they used to be better. I think there was too much sauce for my liking. The spinach was great, but the chow mein was flat. 

The service and ambience are better at San Tung 2, though.
author: Rachel H.

description: Rude rude rude rude service. I get that you're busy but that definitely isn't an excuse to be an ahole to a guest. I'm sure your food is good, good job, but not a good impression in my book. B y e
author: Alice A.

description: Everything was sooooo good here. Originally was going to eat at San Tung but the line was crazy busy. Came next door, sat right away, ordered right away and was able to have all of our food within 15 minutes. MUST try the wings here and their honey walnut shrimp is so good. It melts in your mouth. Total our bill was $68 but so worth it after a long day out & about. Would come here again.
author: Tiara P.

description: Along with The original San Tung next door, San Tung 2 is extremely popular and usually attracts a pretty long line even before they open their doors at 5pm. Normal wait time can range from as little as 15 minutes to as long an hour for larger parties. Although San Tung 2 has a shorter wait time than the original, it's menu is simpler, but still includes the essentials such as the dry fries wings, black bean noodles, string beans, etc. My only complaint besides the wait is the service. Don't get me wrong, some of the workers are very nice but my last trip there I ran into some attitude (which I understand because it can get very crowded). Other than that, the wings are the in my top 2 wings I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who's never had it before.
author: Derson G.

description: I don't understand why people like to wait at the first location when they share the kitchen and it's the same chef. This place was half empty when we came during lunch on a Saturday. While the other place had people hanging out outside waiting for a table. One difference from this place and the other is they don't serve dumplings at this location. Other than that if you want to stop by to get their famous wings and black bean noodles, just come here. No line. Same food. Why wait?
author: Ellen V.

description: Spent $30 on a Lyft, I got to the restaurant at exactly 7pm, and they said that they were closed, and weren't taking down anymore names to be seated. I don't understand why you're going to advertise that your restaurant closes at 9pm when you stop taking customers at 7. horrible customer service, VERY unprofessional at the way we were approached.
author: Alyna S.

description:
San Tung 2: now just as good as San Tung 1! Hint, hint: put your name down on both waitlists, but if you have a party of 2-4, you're way more likely to get a seat at San Tung 2.

Walking through the entirety of SFMOMA left me with a hankering for those syrupy-sweet chicken wings. I was so thankful that it only took us 15 minutes to get seated -- on a Saturday, no less. The service was snappy, within a few minutes of sitting down, our host came over and took our orders. I apparently get the same thing every time: a plate of beef chow mein and their signature dry fried wings to split. At $20, this is a steal for a filling and meaty dinner in the city.

FYI, you will burn your fingertips and tongue on that juicy, freshly fried chicken. And no, waiting doesn't help. Not when the plump drumettes and wings they use are insulated by a glorious waterfall of slightly spicy sauce. You'll do yourself well to just bite into it and live with the pain. Remember, pain is beauty, and beauty is San Tung's wings. Keep your eye on the bathroom door in the back, though, and make a run for it when it's empty so you can wash your blistered hands. There's only one, so a line forms quickly.

Beef chow mein is your average deal, wet and chock full of minced garlic. They use larger slices of beef than I'm used to seeing, along with a medley of zucchini, celery, cabbage, bean sprouts, and carrots. It's a good way to get someone to eat their vegetables.

I wouldn't say I come to San Tung 1 or 2 for a bountiful medley of Chinese food, but I would say I come here because I know the dishes I eat here are reliable and tasty. They haven't failed me yet, and I hope they never will.
author: Gwen W.

description:
VEGAN REVIEW:

I came here with my family one night after finding out that San Tung (the original) had closed for a family emergency. San Tung 2 seemingly has a smaller menu than the original ST. I tried to order the veggie mu shu and veganizing it like I usually do at ST, but the waiter was not having it. He literally was like "no, we can't do that", so I had to find something else to eat. They also ran out of veggie potstickers, so that was pretty disappointing.

I ended up getting the mixed veggies and doubled checked that it didn't have any animal products used, including oyster/fish sauces.The sauce was garlicky deliciousness. I really enjoyed the veggies and how *healthy* I felt after eating a whole plate of them. I would recommend this dish to people who want to feel like you just ate a salad without actually eating a salad. For something more substantial, you might have to do some veganizing of the menu!
author: Erin K.

description:
This review is solely for their takeout wings. At the time of visit, nearly an hour before their actual closing time, they stopped seating because their wait list was getting very long. We had no choice but to order their wings to-go, and wings were the only option for taking out at the time.

We were curious about what all the hype is about for their fried wings and when we got to try it, we can see why. The wings were flipping delicious. The wings were fried to perfection and the sauce that coated it was deliciously sweet and savory. Hot and fresh, the outside was sauce-y and crunchy and the inside was hot and tender. You would definitely have to try it yourself to understand how tasty and delicious it is.

Review #0293
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Their fried chicken wings! 

Came here on a Monday night and the line was pretty long for both restaurants. We put our names down for both, and were actually called to go to the original one first, but we weren't there so this one worked perfectly. 

San Tung 2 doesn't have all the dishes that the original restaurant has, but it has what matters - the chicken wings. 

We were lucky enough to get 2 orders...then they were fully out of wings. 

I loved the chicken wings! They were crunchy and had a good amount of both flat tops and drumsticks. They were very filling and 2 orders for 4 people was perfect. Sauce was sweet and spicy!

Pork Fried rice was good. Complimented the wings perfectly. 

Jiajiangmung? Was really fishy. The sauce was just okay, would recommend getting this somewhere else. 

Overall, would come back!
author: Berna T.

description: San Tung 1's mine was too long, but it only took a mere 5 minutes wait for 2. The service was very fast and the food was equally amazing. The dried fried chicken was to die for and the chow mien was made just right. However, the sautéed bean was a little on the less delicious side but all in all, the food was pretty good.
author: Sabrina H.

description:
Same quality as the original San Tung, but with shorter wait times! Not sure why this place gets a smaller crowd compared to its neighboring parent, but I ain't mad about it. The relaxed and cozy vibe here is definitely a nice contrast to the original place and is better-suited for smaller parties of 2-4. Staff is also more attentive!

The Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings are always bomb. Each order comes with 12 meaty wings with a crisp exterior and covered in the most perfectly sweet, savory, and spicy sauce. So obsessed! Also love their Dried Sauteed String Beans and Black Bean Sauce Noodles - both compliment the wings so well. Overall, solid food and a better alternative to the original place!
author: Winnie N.

description:
NOTE: San Tung 2 is the SAME as San Tung. Both dishes come out of the same kitchen, but San Tung 2 has more seating.

This was not my first time coming to San Tung, and this is because these wings never disappoint. Getting to the restaurant is a bit of a trek, and if you're not local to SF, then you will have to transfer to the Muni after you get off of Bart in order to make your way to the Sunset District (where the restaurant is located).

I highly recommend coming here right when it opens so you can avoid the line. I've came here before when the sign in sheet was filled with names, and I had to wait at least an hour to get seated.

My go-to's are the dry fried chicken wings and the stir fry green beans. When I first came here, we ordered the beans out of the blue just so we could have a veggie in our meal, and at that moment, my life was changed forever. The beans come in a big portion (ideal for 2 people), and they are amazing: they're cooked down so that they're soft and the garlic flavor is spot on. Our wings came next, and I was so ready for it. The sauce is very very sticky, but the flavor of it is dynamite. Also, the wings come in 12 pieces (ideal for 2 people).

Overall, the meal was filling and satisfying. The service here was also pretty good, but if you come during a peak hour, then just be prepared for a wait. Hands down, this is one of my favorite places to eat in the city!
author: Randall O.

description:
I'm so glad I finally got to try this pace out during my mini day trip to SF. My friends raved about the chicken and I would say, how can chicken wings be THAT good? 

Located next to the original San Tung, we decided to go to the one next door because less wait. Parking can be difficult around the area as it is pretty busy, but eventually you'll find parking. We were immediately seated and ordered the honey garlic chicken wings, fried rice, black bean noodles and a side of the green beans in sauce. 

--FOOD--
Black Bean Noodles- came out in a big bowl where you mix the noodles! Do this ASAP. Very tasty and pipping hot (fresh). Noodles were perfect consistency. 

Honey Garlic Chicken - BOOOOOY were these good. I am not much of a fan of wings, but these got me singing and eating more than I ever thought I could of wings. They were beautifully glazed and perfectly seasoned. I couldn't get enough of it! 

Green Beans in Sauce - very good, fresh and the sauce wasn't overwhelming, perfect to go with the rice. 

Fried Rice - typical fried rice, big portion though! 

The service here was pretty good despite how busy they were. Overall, if you're looking for some good family style Chinese food in SF, stop by!! I can imagine how busy this place would be!! The chicken is unique and to die for!!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Well folks..The chicken wings, the chicken wings, the chicken wings. The reviewers have this spot on. The dry fried chicken wings here are killer. Normally at a Chinese restaurant they have 100+ things on the menu, lol. You're hoping that at least a few of the entrees are spectacular. The fried chicken wings meet that criteria. The other entree that looks quite interesting is the black bean noodle dish with shrimp and calamari. I didn't order it this time around, but I could see it was a popular dish. All I can say is I'm glad I've found a couple of Chinese restaurants that do some things extremely well. "Dumpling Kitchen" with their Shanghai fried dumplings and now "San Tung" with their Dry wings. 

If you haven't tried their wings, you need to make the effort. Again, this is one on those restaurants where the best time to come is during the weekday in the afternoon, if you can. Otherwise, you'll be waiting in a long line.

As a side note, there was something about the restaurant that generated some good vibes. They have a lot of staff, making sure the customers are happy. I just really liked the place. I don't often get that feeling in a restaurant.
author: Anthony W.

description: We had two orders of the original chicken + string beans + rice, and it was delicious! The sauce/seasoning is everything. Amongst my group of three, we nearly finished everything - will definitely be returning and recommending. Also, San Tung 2 is much less busy than the other side, with pretty much the same menu, friendly and fast servers, etc.
author: Nikki R.

description:
We came here to go to town. 

San Tung (as usual) had an insane line. I put our names down at both places and played the waiting game. So as luck would have it, those in front of us here were tired of waiting and left. We were bumped up 3 parties and were seated almost immediately.

They usually list what they are out of, and if you are ok with that you'll have a great meal here. We didn't care they were out of dumplings. Ok, I kinda did but I was more here for the wings.

Chicken fried rice, hot and sour soup, salt and pepper wings, sticky wings, green beans, tea, and another order of chicken fried rice later the four of us threw in the towel with pajamas in the near future.

We all had crazy big food babies and left happy.
author: Shereen A.

description: Yes, this is the same as next door, no, you don't have to wait.  They just don't have dumplings.  The wings were amazing.  We ate them nonstop.  Hot, crispy, and saucey, yum!
author: Kimberly C.

description: Came here because we didn't want to wait in line for the original location, and because it just opened we were seated right away. Chicken wings were just as good, though I wish there were more flat pieces than drumsticks. Hot and sour soup was good. Fried rice was really bland, would not recommend.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Honestly there isn't much to say that others haven't already said. We ordered the Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings and had close to a religious experience (it was a Sunday, after all). My boyfriend, a self-proclaimed chicken wing fanatic, agreed with me that we've never have anything quite like these wings. We both thought they would taste like Korean fried chicken (a la Kyochan), but these were a uniquely exquisite blend of tartness, sweetness, and savoriness with just a hint of spice. 

We also got the black bean sauce noodles, which had sliced beef, calamari, and shrimp inside. This dish was also pretty good, but honestly we both only had eyes and stomachs for the wings after our first bite. Next time we want to try the flash fried green beans (my personal favorite Chinese food dish) or the beef noodle soup.

Logistically, we almost made the mistake of waiting at the original San Tung next door, but luckily my attentive meal partner saw that San Tung 2 was next door. We only had to wait 15 minutes, compared to the potential 1 hour or more that the original would have been.

I will definitely be back here to San Tung 2 again and again as long as people make the mistake of waiting hours for the original San Tung.
author: Jenny D.

description:
Always a great alternative when next door is busy. Went here recently with a big group and they seated us quickly.

The wings taste exactly the same so come here if you ever see a long line at the "main".
author: Rod M.

description:
Thank god I was able to come here and taste what the hype was all about. I wasn't actually able to go to the original San Tung, but I've heard reports that they're practically the same in taste quality (and how could they be any different? They're literally adjacent restaurants receiving the same shipped ingredients and prepared in presumably identical ways). 

To appreciate this place, one must appreciate good chicken wings. If you've been eating pizza hut chicken wings and have been content with your life up until now, you're in for a surprise. Order the original dry fried chicken wings; everything from the size of piece of chicken (the chicken wings themselves can be so big and juicy) to the sauce and marination is prepared so that every flavor comes out explosively through a combination of sweetness and savoriness. 

We also ordered the black bean noodles when we came here and man these were the best black bean noodles we've had throughout the city, south bay included. Coming from LA, I was thinking to myself: "how is it so hard to serve a bowl of black bean noodles that taste half-decent and isn't ridiculously priced?" Despite it being on the pricier side of how much I'm usually willing to pay for a bowl of these, I'm glad the taste exists here in san francisco.
author: David Y.

description:
Pros: Get the dry chicken wings!!!! This wings are sticky sweet and crispy. We each got our own order because it's just too good share. FYI they still taste good as leftovers. For some reason this location has no wait compared to the original next store. Better for us since we came for just the wings.

Cons: Condensed menu compared to the original location. Parking is a pain.

Ordered: Obviously the chicken wings ($12.50).The peanut butter noodles ($9.50) is great as well.

Would I recommend: Yes! Definitely come to this location if you don't mind the smaller menu.
author: Terry N.

description:
It was a pain in the butt looking for a parking spot as San Tung is located within a neighborhood...but it's worth the walk I'm tellin ya. 

Would've been a solid 5 stars if our server Erika introduced herself starting with her name, so I had to ask. Literally all of our water glasses were at the bottom of the glass so i did the *hand wave* to get her attention.. she came by with the pitcher only to refill mine and darted off. What about everyone else's waters? My cousin just ate the ice pieces instead of bothering to call her over again. Why not smile instead of looking like a grump? Why not be optimistic instead of a pessimistic to get the day going by faster? As someone who has 5+yrs in hospitality I know when a server cares about how much tips they get in the end of the night. It was probably b/c GRATUITY of 18% was included for my party of 6, so why bother right? Meh. 

Original deep Fried chicken wings 5/5 
$12.50 (12pcs) 
We ordered two plates, my cousin being a resident really obsessed on how good these wings were so I was really excited. He was totally right about the sauce, (sweet and spicy)it was a mixture of garlic, roasted red peppers, and ginger with a hint of white pepper. Yummy!! 

Black bean sauce noodles 5/5 
Almost similar to those Korean jangjangmyung noods but slightly different. It had chewy noodles with cut up squid, a nice sauce that sticked to the noodles... what's more to ask? Probably some vegetables but I guess the green beans we also ordered balanced it out. Def. worth getting 

Dry stir fried green beans 5/5 $10.50
Probably flash fried then stirred b/c these green beans were def. prepared the right way! It had a refreshing crunch. The garlic and Chinese pickles were such a great addition for intensive flavor. My favorite dish out of the four! 

If you want to beat the long lines or wait list, come on down town around 2-3ish. When we went, there were barely 3-5 tables with two servers, handling the front which is about 1,500 sqft (not big at all). 

Stop by if you're ever in the area, try it out!
author: Trinity P.

description:
I had been craving this chicken for two years before I came again and it definitely didn't disappoint. Got and order of each the go-tos: the dry fried chicken and the string beans and got an order of the chicken to go as well! Luckily we came right before the big Friday dinner crowd hit so we probably waited around 20-30 minutes but it was well worth the wait. 

The chicken was crunchy and saucy and went perfectly paired with a bowl of rice. The string beans were really good too and I'm usually very picky about string beans so that's saying something. 

Table turnover is pretty fast but it isn't that big of a space so it'll definitely be a wait if you don't come early, especially like on the day I went when the OG San Tung was closed. Definitely will be back again sometime because it's so good!!
author: Isabelle N.

description:
My SF/BA fam considers me the lost uncle - living in a smoggy (supposed) traffic hell hole. I think BA traffic is worse. Dunno how these traffic studies get it all twisted. Anyhow on those semi annual trips to home base, I drop in to see San Tung... I mean my brother. The restaurant is 5-10 minutes away from his place. During my last trip - he knowledge dropped "There's a second location next door!" 

So we cruise by Sunday and the line is short. Perhaps people exhausted from weekend grid lock and over-enjoyed the unusually sunny warm weather. Heard people got tanned in SF - rly! So no wait at the new location. The rooks were still waiting in the original location's line; completely ignoring the empty tables at #2. Seeing the discrepancy my sis-in-law wailed "Oh haaaaaaaaaaail no!" and we sat down here immediately.

We pretty much ordered the standard favorites. While not every dish is amazing, it's just bliss. Don't over critique it - blah blah city has the best Chinese food. Don't be insufferable. Just come and get yo' fried chicken on. Srsly - if San Tung came to LA it would destroy the Howling Ray's line. ST could extinct chicken like blue fin tuna.
author: Jeff H.

description: The wait here was crazy! We put our name on the wait list next door as well but we were 40 spots away from a seat compared to being 7th in line. When we finally got sat the server was quick to take out order and the chicken came out in less than 3 minutes of placing our order. Since it was busy the server wasn't very attentive and forgot the beer order. We ordered the salt and pepper chicken, original chicken, and three deluxe seafood combo house noodles. The chicken was amazing! Crispy, hot, and full of flavor- however the noodles were a complete miss. The seafood tasted like it was straight out of the freezer and the sauce on the noodles was very bland- no Siracha or soy sauce could've helped it. Overall the place was pretty good and recommend getting here early! Make sure you don't leave the area because they call your name out for seating.
author: Donna K.

description:
Drove all the way from LA for these  Jk jk but 4 stars for service and 4 stars for food. 

We came in less than an hour before closing, which is really annoying I know, but the male server happily took us in and was very nice and patient. We ordered the Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings (duh), the combination chow mein, honey walnut prawn, and the stir fries green beans. The Dry chicken wings were actually just okay to me. Yes, they were delicious, but nothing out of the ordinary for me so I don't get the hype. The combination chow mein had to be my favorite out of the four. Not too salty and not too oily either so I enjoyed it. The stir fried green beans were still uncooked on the inside....so it was very flavorful on the outside, but just MEH overall because the sautéed didn't reach the inside. The honey walnut prawns were a complete miss for me. Too sweet, too much of the mayo sauce, but too little prawns for the price that it was. Not worth it. 

All in all, it was delicious for sure, but just about average Chinese food for me. I would return if I was ever in the area, and would recommend to family and friends.
author: Thu T.

description:
NOT OPEN ON TUESDAYS

Drove out here from SJ because all their postings said they would be open 5-9pm
author: Meileen C.

description:
One of the more cleaner and less authentic "Chinese" restaurants. In fact, doesn't seem like a Chinese restaurant to me, but it's still one of my favorite places to eat. They have 2 restaurants - one next to the other. I usually prefer San Tung 2 because there's generally a shorter wait time.

My go-to dishes are: Original Dry Fried Chicken (of course), Dried Sauteed String Beans, Black Bean Sauce Noodles, Shrimp and Leek Dumplings.

However, on this night, we ordered:
1. Black Bean Sauce Noodles
No complaints! It's like jajangmyeon with a savory and garlic-filled taste. 

2. Original Dry Fried Chicken
Delicious! One of my all-time favorite chicken dishes. It has the perfect crisp and crunch. 

3. Original Dry Fried Flounder Fillet
Same sauce as the dry fried chicken. Love that the fillet isn't too oily/greasy. I really enjoyed this dish and would definitely get this again.

4. Chicken Chow Mein
Is it chow mein or garlic noodles? It was really overwhelming - too much garlic, too salty, and too greasy. A huge disappointment. 

Our table of 4 came on a Sunday night and we waited for about 15-20 minutes. Standard wait time and food prep. Prices are pretty standard, but tend to range slightly higher than typical Chinese restaurants. I definitely prefer this restaurant more than the original because the service is better and you don't feel as rushed.

Tips:
- San Tung tends to get crowded. Go early to put your name down or go to San Tung 2 to expedite the wait time. Yes, it's a smaller menu, but it has most of the popular dishes.
- Come early or during prime dinner hours if you want chicken. It tends to "sell out" later into the night.
- Just wanted to highlight that it's CLOSED on Wednesdays. 
- Parking is difficult to find, especially during prime dinner hours. I suggest you park on Lincoln Way or you'll find yourself circling around for an open spot.
author: Michelle L.

description:
When it comes to San Tung's chicken wings, BELIEVE THE HYPE!

These chicken wings are bomb as f***. Excuse my language but if you come to San Tung, this is a must have. Deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger, and red pepper! They serve it fresh and hot right from the kitchen to your table. The sticky, crunchy, and dry fried chicken wings will leave you licking your fingers and wanting more. And for 12 wings it's only $12.50. Worth every penny! 

San Tung 2 is literally next door to the OG San Tung. It still surprises me why people continue to wait in that long line when the owner is the same for both locations. If you don't have 2 hours to wait to eat, go next door. They have a smaller menu but they offer all the popular dishes: dry fried chicken wings, dumplings, etc. And because not a lot of people like to go next door, the wait for a table is not as bad. I came with my boyfriend yesterday for lunch. We decided to check the wait for the OG. The wait was about 45 min. We went next door and to our surprise it was empty. We were seated immediately and in and out the door in less than an hour. Fast service, delicious food! Will definitely be back!
author: Tina M.

description:
Pretty much if you have 1 restaurant and then another next door with the same name saying San Tung 2, it should be a good indicator that those places are probably great places to eat. Noticed that San Tung was closed Monday thru Wednesday the week we went. This is why we went to San Tung 2. I thought this was smart on their part. Just leave 1 restaurant open for the slow week then reopen both for the busy weekend. Came here with family and we were just looking for a quick bite, so glad my cousin bragged about taking us here. 

Inside its nothing flashy, lots of room for each table. Staff is fast and efficient. Noticed how the staff were joking and kicking back during the 5pm opening, nice to know you're eating in a friendly environment. 1 waitress was very cute, yoga pants long black hair, cute face..... So the food!!! Right after opening people quickly filled the tables. Again another clue to let you know you're in a good spot.

Food**
Dry-fried wings- (5/5) please do yourself a favor and order this item if nothing else. Sweet sticky slightly spicy sauce. My wife was even playing with her chopstick with the left over sauce and kept eating the sauce saying how it's a nice lollipop. For you non spicy eaters don't be turned off from the chili icon, trust me it wouldn't be as good without that tiny spiciness. 
Honey Walnut Shrimp- (5/5) tasted a lot of versions of this in other restaurants, this took the basics and just did them perfectly. Honey glazed walnuts were not to hard, not sticking to your teeth when chomping down on them. Shrimp coating was still slightly crunchy not soggy. Mayonnaise sauce had the right amount of sweetness. 

Overall, if you don't want the hassle of Chinatown parking; and actually if you just want good Americanized Chinese food, come here. But be warned after eating here your local Chinese restaurant around the corner from home is gonna look feel like a McDonald's $1 hamburger compared to a In-N-Out double double. 

Keep up the good work San Tung.
author: Adel O.

description:
This place is the most slept on place ever. San Tung is a very very very very very very very popular spot. There is always a good crowd waiting for a seat, and the sign-up white board is always full.

Let's be honest. You heard about their chicken. You came here for the chicken. You're waiting in the line for the chicken? Hahahaha. Don't! The San Tung 2 that is immediately to the right of San Tung is owned by the same owner, and serves the same exact chicken!!!!!!! Talking to the staff, they only mention that it's a smaller menu: but like I said, you came here for the chicken. It's on the menu. Get your dry fried chicken wings and go about your day.

Now let's talk about the chicken. I love you. You'll love it. Just get it! The sauce is soooooo thick and sticky to the point where touching my chopsticks after the 3rd or 4th wing feels a little gross. The thick sauce is what really makes the wing, but the crisp skin mixed with the sauce makes me want to give this place 6 stars. I had many wings in my life, and nothing compares to this. You need these! I promise
author: Michael C.

description:
They opened a second restaurant next door to the original San Tung and we had a group of 4 of us. I put our name down at San Tung and my bf put our name down for San Tung 2. Not surprisingly, we got seated at San Tung 2 first. The crazy part was that after we finished our dinner, walked 1.2 miles roundtrip to get boba and back to our car, San Tung called my name. This was about 1.5 hour wait. 

Food: 5/5 - As for the food at San Tung 2, they ran out of potstickers & thankfully we ordered the original spicy chicken wings before they ran out as well. The hot and sour soup size was perfect for 4 of us. The tofu with veggies wasn't a clear hit for our group, but we still ate it. It didn't have too much flavor. The peanut noodles were bomb! It wasn't spicy though.

Service: 5/5 - The food came our so fast! We didn't even finish our soup and our 3 other dishes came out.
author: Anna C.

description:
I don't know why people wait in line for the OG San Tung's restaurant when another of the same restaurant is right next door. It's the same restaurant with the same fried chicken. I would say the wait time for San Tung 2 is still decently long however, it is still a shorter wait compared to the OG restaurant. Also, the wait time is significant shorter the smaller your party is. If you're coming with a large party, expect a long wait time. San Tung 2 is also much smaller in spacing compared to the OG restaurant. It also has a much more modernized look, feel, and environment compared to the traditional look of OG San Tung. San Tung 2 is a lot more hip and vibrantly colored which attracts a lot more of the younger generations in to enjoy their fried chicken. 

Their fried chicken definitely lives up to it's name. Get the Original Dry Fried Chicken! It doesn't disappoint. The fried chicken skin is crispy and the chicken meat is also still moist! San Tung's has perfected their recipe for amazing fried chicken that leaves you drooling and wanting more.
author: Brandon D.

description: San Tung 2 is not great for the famous chicken wings but the other foods is just like unregular Chinese food. Just don't come here and don't get 5 plates of chicken wings and like don't get some rice or something for not under $90 and it's not a good meal for 5-6 people.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Their popularity speaks for itself. If you're going on a Friday or Saturday night, expect a wait. My party of 4 went around 7 on Saturday and waited for an hour. But it was definitely worth the wait!

Go to dishes:
- dry original wings
- green beans
- egg drop soup
author: Mako U.

description:
To keep it short and simple: if you're only craving the wings, both restaurant would work. If you want other dishes, you're better off waiting for the original restaurant. 

This restaurant is good too, but it's not as good as the original. I was a bit disappointed by the black bean noodle here as it was blander than usual.
author: Brian D.

description:
Some people go hard on Halloween, others on Christmas. My husband and I are more National Chicken Wing Day people and to celebrate this momentous occasion we decided to check out San Tung, named one of the best chicken wings in the US by Food & Wine magazine.

San Tung opens at 5, and by the time we arrived at 5:10 pm there was already a long wait at the original location. Luckily our stars aligned because we were able to grab a table at their second location (literally right next door) without any problem! 

We ordered their famous chicken wings with some noodles and green beans for good measure. The chicken wings were sticky sweet and a little bit spicy as well. It was definitely good eats, especially with a cold beer to wash it down. The green beans were also a big hit (it's basically the same sauce as the wings but in vegetable format). By the time we left we were full and happy. 

My only compaint was the way the food came out, we had ordered two plates of wings but they came out about twenty minutes apart from each other. Just give me all my chicken wings at once so I can properly gorge please!

Affordable, simple eats. I'm a fan!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Food was delicious. Absolutely exemplary. But so disappointed by what we found out at the end. When we were going over our check, my family counted to make sure we got everything and found an extra charge was added to us for no reason. When we questioned it, we were given no answer as to what it was. They took our check back, told us a significantly lower price to our surprise and took our money. When they were ringing up our check at the register, we heard the male waiter (our original waiter who gave us the check), arguing that the price was right. Money came back to us higher than what we were told with once again no explanation. We didn't even have the ticket to check what our costs was. Frustrated and tired (we've had a long day) we weren't going to fight over money as they didn't appear to be in the bests of moods and left. While we do appreciate the hard work by the workers and chefs in the back, we do not appreciate dishonesty. A disappointing experience. Please check your checks at the end to make sure no "surprise" costs are added without you knowing. (And no, it was not the tip because we did not have 5 or more people as the policy stated. If not for the fact that the one young female worker worked hard we wouldn't have left such a generous tip.) and to the restaurant? At least leave a receipt for your customers when they leave and be honest.

P.S. probably best not to cuss each other out during a rush hour. I understand your friends but tell each other f*ck you and talking about alcoholism in front of a table with a child?
author: Kang T.

description:
I've been back and forth regarding whether or not San Tung chicken wings are the best in the city, but every time after eating here it's hard to argue against. The sauce is just the best thing ever and makes the wings taste like candy. Super sweet and sticky with a hint of red chili spice, definitely worth the trip and wait. 

They have a minimum $8 order per person. Service is okay. They actually check in to see how you're doing which I appreciate.
author: Brian G.

description:
The roommate was craving spicy soup noodles for dinner. Since it's a pain to go to San Tung for pick up, we decided to order from San Tung #2 through Caviar for delivery. I placed the order on Monday, February 27th at 5:59pm. It arrived at 6:39pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Original Dry Fried Chicken: chicken wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roasted red peppers, 12 piece ($12.50)
*Dry Sauteed String Beans: fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle ($10.50)
*Combination Spicy Soup Noodles: stir fried shrimp, calamari, beef and mixed vegetables on top of homemade noodles finished in a spicy broth ($9)

I adore San Tung wings, so these did not disappoint. Just to make sure to toss the wings as all the sauce ends up at the bottom of the take out container. The wings are crispy, garlicky, sweet, and spicy. Just like how I remember the wings next door. Another favorite dish of mine are the green beans. They were nice and crunchy. At first, they didn't have much flavor. Then I realized all the sauce was at the bottom of this dish too. When mixed together the sauce and chinese pickle added the flavoring I needed. The soup noodles were good, though I forgot to add the note about making it extra spicy, so the roommate found the dish lacked heat.

I've never been here in person, but it's good to know, if I'm craving San Tung's crack wangs, I can always order them from San Tung #2 for delivery.
author: Elena N.

description:
If you're on here, you've probably heard by now or will hear very soon that San Tung is known for their AMAZING chicken wings! And let me tell you, they are finger-licking good. 

San Tung has two locations which just happens to be conveniently right next to each other. I've been to both locations and can guarantee you that the way the food taste and is prepped is no different at all, or at least I don't find anything different between the two. The only difference is that the second location (here) has a smaller menu, but all the popular picks are served here as well. The second location tends to have a shorter wait as well, perhaps because many believe the original location is better or they want to eat at the "original" place. Whatever it may be, take my advice, if the wait at the original location is long as hell, make your way over to the second and place your name down. Make sure that you are in reachable distance to the restaurants because they will call out names off the list and if you're not there, they may possible cross your name off and for sure will give your table away to someone else.

So the wings... yes, they are delicious. They are saucy and sweet and tangy and crunchy and just all around amazing! I have friends who would each order their own plate (which comes with 12 wings) and finish an order all by themselves. I can tell you that you're not going to find wings like these anywhere else. Definitely get yourself an order! Literally one time this guy walked past my table and said to me, "man what do they put in these chicken wings, must be crack or something" LOL

The green beans are also amazing! They're stir fried with ginger, loads of garlic, and with a mild sweet sauce. I get super addicted to these, can't stop eating them... they are good and I highly recommend an order of these as well.

The last time my boyfriend and I came, we also got an order of their handmade three deluxe spicy noodles. It came with a variety of seafood and the sauce was spicy, but it wasn't too bad.. the heat level was good, you are still able to enjoy the noodles. Fresh handmade noodles says it all, it had an amazing texture - just the perfect amount of chewiness. The sauce was just okay to me, not sure if this is something I'd order again. Their black bean noodles are also a very popular choice and I had it a while back but I didn't find anything too special with those. 

Parking can be hard to find, it's all street parking like everywhere else in SF so just keep in mind that you may need to walk a block or a few to the restaurant. 

The service varies, sometimes it's good and sometimes it's mediocre, and sometimes you can feel neglected. They get very busy so I understand, but I let that slide because the wings are to die for! I always rave about this place to everyone I know and anytime someone brings up SF, I'm always talking about San Tung because it's just that good.

Do not hesitate, come to San Tung! Bring your friends and family.
author: Brittney D.

description:
San Tung 2 serves the same dishes as the original San Tung. Only difference, that I have found, is that this location has little to no wait. This is fantastic news because it means I get to enjoy the Original Dry Fried Chicken sooner. 

What we, a party of 3, ordered:
- 2 orders of Original Dry Fried Chicken: So good that we ordered 2.
- Black Bean Sauce Noodles: lots of sauce, not enough sliced beef, calamari, or shrimp. I think there were 5 whole shrimp in the bowl. Our waitress served our bowl with a pair of scissors which was a great call because the noodles are super long and difficult to serve.
- Combination Fried Rice: had sliced beef, eggs, shrimp, and calamari. The dish is average but is quite filling
- Dried Sauteed String Beans: pretty good and makes me feel less guilty about eating so many chicken wings

Service is great. The employees are constantly on the go but are attentive to customers.
author: Katie C.

description:
Infamously known for their dry chicken wings, I'm here to say yes, the hype is REAL on them. If you love flavorful wings, go and get them! (their other Chinese food is a meh from me though, I'd just focus on their wings instead)

Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings ($11.50 for 12 wings)- Okay, admittedly they did live up to the hype EVERYONE was fawning over. My roommate RAVED about them for ages and I have to admit, my standards for their wings was pretty high and I didn't really want to buy into the hype, but I finally caved so my roommate would stop bothering me.

I was shocked at how much I liked their dry wings. They're literally packed with so much intensive delicious flavor I was surprised to see how much I dug into them, especially as a person who doesn't like to get their fingers dirty for food.
They're sticky, but have a nice crisp texture to it, and their magical sauce that they pair with the wings is amazing. It has a nice heat to it, and the mixture of garlic, ginger, and peppers was just right. I'd definitely come here for their wings again. And I mean at around a dollar a wing??? It's priced so right here. Definitely a messy food but the flavor is so worth the mess.

Pork Fried Rice- ($7.75) Honestly probably one of the most flavorless fried rices I've ever had. If the Chicken wings didn't come after the fried rice, I definitely would have given this place a solid 2 solely on their fried rice. Maybe it was an off day but it literally tasted like sour salt and rice was mixed together. The pork really lacked flavor. Not impressed and I'd pass.

Green Beans- Mmm these were okay. Though it's not the best Chinese cooked styled green beans I've had, these were decent and I wouldn't mind picking them up again to help mellow out the intensity of the wings. Decent item on the menu, but I mean nothing to write home about.

Also like everyone complains, I mean their location isn't disgusting, but it's also not the cleanest place in the world. Their bathroom is kinda dingy but to be fair I've been in a lot worse. I'd give them like a deflated 3/5 for cleanlieness. Also the waiters here seem fine but if you need help you need to wave them down if you need anything. Expect less than superb service if the line is long or you see a lot of customers here.

I feel like overall a lot of people mostly come for their wings, and yeah while I do agree that they're amazing, their other food so far isn't really selling it to me. I'd rate San Tung a flat 4, and that's solely bc the chicken wings are carrying them. Based on their other foods I wasn't that impressed nor would I go out of my way to recommend else besides their wings. I'd definitely come back here for their iconic wings though!
author: Allison O.

description: Stopped in during my trip up in SF on a Saturday evening. It was close to closing but we managed to squeeze in and enjoy our meal. The hype on their fried chicken was a must so we went and tried that, along with the combo fried rice. They say us promptly. There's a line so get there and put your name on the list.
author: Yoomie Y.

description: So originally my friends and I wanted to go to the first San Tung but we came on a Saturday around the time they open again in the afternoon and it was super packed. We haven't eaten all day so we didn't have the patience to wait that long so we just went here since I read the reviews and its basically the same thing. We still had to wait for at least 30 minutes but that was way shorter than the first one so we didn't mind. We ordered a lot and there was only three of us. We got their popular original dry fried chicken, the spicy black bean noodles, their salt & pepper chicken, string beans, and fried rice. We didn't finish everything but we just took the rest home. So I really enjoyed the chicken and I can see why its so hyped! It was super juicy and full of flavor. We really liked the string beans as well! It wasn't too salty and it was quite addicting. The noodles and rice were just alright. I'd def come back and would want to try the first San Tung. I believe the wait was worth it so def come by!
author: Alexa-Ferl S.

description:
To be honest I'm not really sure what the difference is between San Tung and San Tung 2 aside from the fact that San Tung 2 has a shorter wait and way more seating. In regards to these two menus, they look very similar (except San Tung 2 didn't have dumplings the night I came here).  

* Original Dry Fried Chicken *
Don't get me wrong, fried chicken (or anything for that matter) is damn good. The chicken here was good and flavorful, but nothing special to me. I personally like my fried chicken crisp on the outside while being moist and tender on the inside. I didn't think that this fried chicken was worth the hype of this restaurant. 

* Hot Braised Chicken *
I liked this fried chicken dish more than the original dry fried one because the sauce makes the meat a lot more moist without causing the chicken to lose its crisp skin. As someone who enjoys spicy food, I didn't think the sauce was crazy hot. It gave the chicken a nice flavorful kick.

* Dried Sautéed String Beans *
If I were to come to San Tung again it would be to just get this dish. The beans were oh so flavorful with a nice garlic taste to it and it still had a crunch to it in each bite (soggy beans are a nightmare). Definitely get this dish as your dinner's source of veggies.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
FRIED CHICKEN HEAVEN. Best meal I had during my SF trip. This restaurant is the exact same as the one right next door (that seems to be the "original" but I see no difference other than the wait being much MUCH longer next door). This place opens at 5pm but the place was already filled/a huge wait outside both restaurants by 5:15pm. San Tung 2 had a little less of a wait compared to San Tung. Even at 5:15pm we waited for about 30 min (had a party of 2).

TIP: BETTER TO COME EARLY BEFORE IT OPENS AT 5PM AND WAIT SO YOU'RE THE FIRST ONES IN :)

We ordered the Dry Fried Chicken "wet" (of course) and Noodles with Peanut Sauce. Literally every table's order was some combination of the Dry Fried Chicken and a noodle dish. The 2 most popular noodle dishes (from my observation and from the waiter's recommendation) are the Black Bean Sauce Noodles and Five Spice Beef Soup Noodles. We decided to be special and order the Peanut Sauce Noodles. The Dry Fried Chicken was just so good. I mean EVERYTHING about it was delicious AND it came out pretty fast (less than 10 minutes). The Noodles with Peanut Sauce was pretty tasty as well but it took quite awhile (15 extra minutes). It was kind of hard to eat because they didn't cut the noodles up so they were super duper long (ask to have it cut at least twice in the back?). The description for the peanut sauce also says "spicy" but it was not spicy AT ALL so don't worry if you can't eat spicy foods. This ain't one of them. 10/10 would come back again but earlier so I don't have to wait!
author: Yoona K.

description:
As with many Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, the biggest question mark you will probably have is if the place is clean.  No offense.  With that being said, this place looks clean enough.  As for the food, well, I only came here for 1 item:  the famous dry-fried chicken wings.

After seeing an episode of some cool, hip food TV show, I bookmarked San Tung.  That was about 5 years ago.  Well, I was finally able to make it after a failed visit to the nearby museum (note:  avoid the free museum days.  It's a mad house!).  We walked by, but the line was long.  But, at the corner of my eye, I saw the space next door labeled San Tung 2.  This is essentially the same as the mother restaurant, but selling less items.  I placed my order for the wings and that was it.

Now, on to the wings.  They were worth the wait!  However, my 4-star rating is accurate as they didn't blow my socks off. The wings were not as heavy on the heat I was expecting, but the flavor was on point.  Based on the description, I wasn't expecting a sauced wing, but the sauce was great!  It was heavy on the ginger, but the sweetness balanced it out perfectly.  We ate these on the drive back to San Jose and let's just say my steering wheel needed to wiped down when I got back.  They were messy!

If I was in the area and wanted a snack, I'd come back.  I have to try the rest of their food anyway.  Parking can be slim, so get there early to find some parking.
author: Jamie J.

description:
Came here over the weekend. Waited in line outside before opening and was one of the first people to be seated. My friend and I ordered the fabled chicken wings, hot and sour soup, and black bean sauce noodles.

The wings were awesome, and I would've gotten another order instead of the black bean noodles had I known. However, I was a little irked that it took them over 20 minutes and reminding the waiter before they came with our food. I understand it's busy and a lot of orders have to be filled, but every other guest had already received their orders long before despite us arriving at the exact same time.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This place used to be called Next Door Sweets because it was next door to San Tung #1 and it sold gelato and also part of the San Tung menu. But then they got smart and decided to scrap the whole gelato idea and just turn it into San Tung #2. I don't find any differences between #1 and #2 except that #2 is more modern looking and there is practically no wait. 10/10 times, I end up dining at #2 since the wait next door is way too long. I honestly don't know why people are waiting so long next door but all the better for me. 

ORIGINAL DRY FRIED CHICKEN
This is what people come here for as this is what San Tung is known for. Are they overhyped? No. They're hella delicious. They're worth bringing your out of town friends over to visit. I could literally eat a whole order of these myself but it is nice to share so that you can also try the other things on the menu. These are similar to Korean soy garlic chicken (sweet) with a bit of spice from the red peppers. The batter is light and the wings are big and juicy. 

SHRIMP AND LEEK DUMPLINGS
