Twelve dumplings -- each very small so I was disappointed. Doesn't come with any special dumpling sauce so make your own with the soy sauce and vinegar provided or just dip it in the dry fried chicken sauce.

Other favorites include their noodles such as black bean noodles or the peanut sauce noodles. Dry sauteed string beans are excellent as well. They also serve a fish option that comes with the same sauce as the dry fried chicken.
author: Diana C.

description:
Decided to visit with my boyfriend and a friend after hearing many wonderful things about the chicken wings and was really excited to finally make it! The line at San Tung on a Sunday afternoon was kind of long so we decided to go to San Tung 2 because we realized the two menus were essentially the same (and we mostly wanted the chicken anyway). 

We were able to get seated way faster than we would've if we waited at San Tung and decided to order 1. the chicken wings 2. black bean noodles and 3. string beans. The chicken wings were crispy despite being covered in sauce and were a great size! I didn't know what to expect upon getting these so I was surprised that the sauce was sweeter than I expected - not that it was bad, it was pretty good! The black bean noodles were okay (could've used salt) and the string beans were aromatic and smelled delicious, but the sauce was a little too sweet for my taste (sweet sauce on chicken + slightly sweet black bean noodles + sweet-ish string beans = meh). 

My experience was about average despite having great chicken wings, but honestly I'm not crazy about the rest of the place.
author: Mar S.

description:
About time I tried San Tung's famous Dry Fried Chicken! It only took me 3 years... LOL I got the chance to come during my winter break with a couple friends that I met in Japan that were on their Winter Break's too! We were originally planning on going to San Tung (typical chinese dine-in restaurant) but it was very busy so we put our name down at San Tung 2 next door (more HK cafe vibe). The food is just as good according to my friend (no variation!)

Parking: My friend and I bused then walked there, some other friends Ubered, and the others found parking down the street! It an be hard to find parking since it's a little sparse. 

Ambiance: Your typical Chinese restaurant vibes. 

Service: Servers are quick. Food comes out fast! Our table was ready before my full party arrived and the servers were patient and waited for us and didn't fill our table. 

Food: My friends and I ordered 2 orders of the Dry Fried Chicken, 1 order of the Green Beans, 1 order of the giant Pot Stickers, and 3 bowls of rice! That was definitely enough to fill the 6 of us! The Fried Chicken was sticky and crispy and sooo delicious! The Green Beans were a little oily but that is typical for Chinese veggies. And the Pot Stickers like I said were HUGE and very yummy as well! Everything was sososo good and I will definitely recommend San Tung to my friends visiting from out of town!
author: Jessica N.

description:
Just as delicious as San tung #1. I'm not quite sure why people would still wait over an hour to eat at #1 when #2 tastes exactly the same with less than half the wait time! The only difference is that #2 doesn't have any dumplings but really when you come to San tung... who really cares for the dumps?? It's all about the wings! 

***Things to get***
-wings (dry) 
-green beans
-tsingtao
author: Christie V.

description: Yes, yes..order the wings.  They are as good as advertised.  And San Tung 2 is conveniently open on Tuesday's, unlike big brother.
author: Karim O.

description:
It's got the same classics as its mother restaurant next door but with WAY less of a wait. You want Dry Fried Chicken? Black Bean Sauce Noodles? Dry Sauteed Stringbeans? Get them at San Tung 2!

Truthfully though, do yourself and everyone a favor and order everything as takeout from the original San Tung. Even though San Tung has expanded to occupy two restaurant spaces, seating is still incredibly limited. While San Tung 2 has less of a wait, the ambiance detracts a bit from the experience as it can get a bit warm... Wouldn't you rather just enjoy this food in the comfort of your own home?
author: Charles L.

description:
Excellent dried chicken wings (was expecting dry rub, but this was better)!! We came in when San Tung 2 had about 20 groups on the waiting list. Quick and very attentive service.

Would recommend coming around the time they open so you don't have to wait in line.
author: Melissa L.

description:
We didn't have to wait too long and the food came out super fast.  Wings, string beans and noodles (black bean?) were all excellent.  You can't go wrong with any of those dishes and most people opt for those three.  All are priced reasonably.

I won't bore you with bunch of stuff that other people have already written.

Go give them a try, and factor in some wait time.

Service was cool.  Better than most Chinese establishments.
author: Ty C.

description:
Wow some of the best Chinese-Korean food I've ever had. 

Definitely get their dry chicken wings, jjajangmyun, and jjamppong!

They don't serve dumplings at this location, so I'm excited to go back to San Tung original next door!!!
author: Christine H.

description:
Friend and I came in here since next door was too busy.

We got the hot n sour soup, dry fried mushroom, dry fried chicken, and the three delights. Everything was prepared well and came out piping hot which was awesome. Out of the meal I liked the dry fried stuff the most I'd say, but the hot n sour soup being a bit different ingredients wise was a nice change. The three delights was interesting, but certainly not the star of the place. Might be a bit sweet to some because of the sauce but you can scoop some off or just grab the ones at the top if you want it not as sweet in this case. 

I'd definitely come back again just to try some of the other dishes to see if there are other dishes I'd want to return to.
author: David C.

description:
Wings wings wing. Nothing could ever go wrong with some crunchy, saucy, flavorful wings. You'll typically notice San Tung's store front to be packed full of people. If that is the issue I'd highly recommend coming next door.

Personally, I don't taste or feel much of a difference. When it comes down to it, I'm just here for the wings.
author: Wesley L.

description:
Man before I visited this place I was confused why it had so many stars and so many reviews. Now I get why!

The main shop is closed, so we had to go to this one "the 2". The wait was pretty long, and you can see inside the place is owned/operated by a family who work very hard to serve the huge crowd of customers. The food is AWESOME especially the wings. Every table there we see wings, so definitely get the wings. They taste a little spicy and sweet, with a crunchy crust, which is different from anything I've tasted before and totally AWESOME.

We also got the black bean sauce noodles. Note that this is NOT jangjangmyung--it's different kind of dish. BUT it is actually way better in terms of taste. Lots of calamari inside, and the sauce sticks to the noodles. Definitely worth getting it--still dreaming about it right now.

The wait staff (family) are really nice. They go out of their way to ask if you are ok, and refill your water glass, even though you can tell they are busy as HECK. ++1 on service.

Definitely worth coming back here again and again.
author: Henry L.

description:
First time here. 
Everybody ordered the fried chicken. So we ordered it too. And we were not disappointed!
The fried chicken is really crispy and tasty. 
Food: 1A
Service: fast and friendly

We will Definitely come back
author: Donny S.

description:
Leaving San Tung behind in SF has left a hole in my heart. These fried chicken wings are life. I am jealous of all the locals who can drop by whenever and pick these up, do not take that for granted!

These wings are ginormous, I don't know what kind of chicken this comes from nor do I care. Their glazed sauce is very thick and flavorful and on the sweeter side. Let me tell you these are good leftovers and when warmed up in the microwave for a second meal, they're still good! Probably better in the oven to be crispy again but eh.

Order the chicken with string beans, soup and rice and you'll be stuffed for days! Okay thats very dramatic but all the dishes I tried were good. I also had an order of steamed dumplings. They were good but the shells were on the sticky side.

I went to Sun Tung 2 because the original had a long line. Idk why people don't go to this one to avoid the line...
author: Kathy N.

description:
I actually haven't been to the physical restaurant before, so I can't comment on the service. I'm usually averse to long waits and this is around a 30 min drive from me. 

I ordered takeout here. I got the famous green beans and dry fried chicken wings. Was pretty pricey since it was delivery, but honestly was so worth. 

The wings. Are. So. Good. 

I've had like Buffalo Wild Wings and like Wing Stop as well as some really good wings from Gator's, but these were honestly one of the best. 

The sauce is really good, it's a little sweet but not overpoweringly so, and really goes well with rice and green beans (which were a little mushy due to delivery but still good). They cook the wings to a perfect crisp where the skin just tastes perfect. Honestly super addicted now and can totally see why people rave about these wings. If you're around definitely stop by or order some with a promo code.
author: Michelle L.

description:
W O W.

I was shook when we arrived and realized how long the wait was, even for SAN TUNG 2 (had never been to the original and didn't realize it was right next door).

1. Beef Soup Noodle: The broth was good and noodles were chewy but I wasn't over-the-top, blow-your-brains-out impressed for some reason. I wouldn't order again because they seem to have SO many other noodle options that are even better. I GLARED at the girls next to us who ordered the Black Bean Noodles.......THEY LOOKED SO GOOD WAH.

2. Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings: WOW WOW WOW WOW WOW -- I don't even usually like fried chicken but this was UNBELIEVABLY good. Lots of people with only two or three people in their party ordered TWO PLATES and you get a lot (like 12 pieces??). My only regret is that we didn't follow suit.

3. Garlic Green Beans: I. COULD. NOT. STOP. EATING. THESE. Never has a vegetable tasted so good.

Sad they didn't have dumplings at the second restaurant. I love dumplings.
author: Christine H.

description:
I was really torn on what review to give this restaurant so I will have to explain in depth why I chose to give it a four star. 

I am from so cal and all of my norcal friends raved about this place and recommended me to try it because of the wings. I also saw that this place had a lot of reviews and was packed when I visited. HYPE! The reviews of the wings wasn't wrong, they were delicious and it was clearly their speciality. However the rest of the food was not that great. I ordered some noodles and the noodles were just not that good. However I was warned by my friends that the main attraction were the wings. I would give the wings a 5 star and the rest of the food a 3 thus the 4 star rating. In all I still would recommend people to come here to try their famous wings, it was really good!
author: Dan N.

description:
My problem with chicken is that I love San Tungs, but the wait is always so crazy! San Tung 2 is literally an extension of San Tung 1. It's not really a whole new location. They are next door to each other and when they open, you get into one line, then they fill up the first restaurant up and when that gets full, that's when they'll start dispersing people into the second side. It also seems like they disperse depending on party size since san tung #2 is smaller, theyll seat smaller parties where as if you have a larger group, they'll have to fit you in the first location. However since it is the same place, you can rest assured you are going to be getting the same delicious chicken!!!!

You can't go wrong with their signature chicken. They serve it either dry or wet. "Dry" is a little misleading because it's not really dry. They are both saucy, it's just the wet is extraaaaaa saucy and a little more gingery and sweeter since it's sitting in that delicious sauce. 

Aside from the chicken, they also serve a number of other dishes that are always consistently good! I love the moo shu they have! It's a simple dish that you wrap with something reminiscent to a crepe. Yum! Whenever I come to SF, my dilemma is always should I try something new or go to San Tungs again?!
author: Maleah M.

description:
Chicken wings.  

^^ The only thing available to take home and so very worth it.  Spicy and sweet have come together here in a perfect proportion to coat these morsels of deliciousness.  

Yes, the "dry" chicken is swimming in that sweet and spicy sauce.  And yes, you should save the extra sauce for me!  Because it is making my mouth water as I type this.  

10-15 minute wait for an order to go, but I'll be back to try the other goodness served here.  From the looks of it, there were bowls of noodles and plates of tofu as well.  The bowls looked plentiful and delicious and while I may try some of those, the wings will definitely be on order.
author: David B.

description: The wait for this location is SIGNIFICANTLY less than the location right next door. They serve the amazing, one-of-a-kind chicken here too!! Location 1 said 1-1.5 hour wait. This location sat us within 10 minutes. Ordered the green beans, chicken, spicy noodles, and hot and sour soup. Everything was very good! The flavors are on point and the food is cooked to perfection. Only downside is how long it takes to get any drink refills or the check. But they are SUPER busy so be patient!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Some people can taste a difference between her and San Tung #1. Nope, I can't taste the difference. Both taste the same so let me head over here where the wait is shorter. Not sure why it's shorter but whatever is getting me closer to those delicious wings!

A San Tung meal isn't complete without the wings and I don't think I need to comment on anything else. Get the wings!
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
Was in the city on Monday and decided I wanted some San Tung for dinner.  When my husband and I walked to the restaurant, we were devastated (DEVASTATED!) to see it was closed.  Low and behold, San Tung 2 next door was opened!  Huzzah!  It was around 6:40pm and we were seated immediately.  Ordered the original san tung fried chicken, black bean noodles, and green beans.  That's a winning combination of a dinner right there!

Was served promptly.  Dinner was DELICIOUS.  Those wings are life.  So on point.  And I'm obsessed with the noodles.  SO GOOD.  Green beans are delicious, but I could do for a different vegetable dish next time.  

I basically could've killed my whole meal but did not want to look like a fat a** in front of my husband so we had some food to take home.  My lunch now!

This restaurant is directly next to San Tung.  It used to be the dessert place that shared the kitchen with San Tung where we could on the down low dine at and order San Tung while others waited at the long line next door.  No longer the case.  /Sigh.  When we left around 7:30pm, there was a CRAZY line waiting to dine here.  On a Monday.

Be prepared.

Oh and they take card!  Including American Express.
author: Kim D.

description:
** You write your name and party size on the dry erase board when you enter. No one will walk over to you to figure out what you want. So you will just stand there waiting for a long time. I made that mistake. 

I definitely think I'm cursed by the hype. I did not understand what was so special about this place. Perhaps, the original one next door made that much of a difference ..? The second location next door had similar menus but a few differences here and there. The service was what you would typically expect in a Chinese restaurant but it was just even slower due to the amount of people waiting and the high turnover. But I don't get it, if you're a busy place, there should be more staff on the floor especially on the weekends. The two servers were young, nice, spoke English but not very quick but you can't really blame them, it was packed. 

It was my first time at San Tung and I had no previous experience to compare it to but I guess this place is just too hyped up. The chicken was just ordinary and it was really nothing special. Actually thought it was too saucy. The hot and sour soup, string beans and black bean noodles were just very ordinary. The portions were huge though so maybe easy on the ordering. 

If you do decide to swing by, expect to not find a parking spot and long waits.
author: Carrie C.

description:
We happened to walk past the restaurant before it opened, and there was already a line! A few of my friends had raved about their famous chicken wings, so we decided to give it a go! Luckily the wait wasn't too bad.

The chicken wings were sooooo tender and flavorful! I'm still dreaming about them weeks later. We also got a plate of their string green beans to at least pretend to be healthy. Yum!!! Would recommend a bowl of rice to balance out the saltiness. Adding this place to our favorites list. Definitely want to try the black bean sauce noodles next time we visit. :)
author: Saundra N.

description:
The hype is real, folks. I've tried both San Tung #1 and San Tung #2 and they serve the SAME Original Dry Fried Chicken. The main difference is that San Tung 2 has a smaller menu. Therefore, if you're only there for the chicken, just go to San Tung #2, where the wait is a lot shorter! But there's no free kimchi at San Tung #2... so if that's a deal breaker for some of you..

The Original Dry Fried Chicken is anything but dry - they have the perfect amount of juicy, spice, and crispiness. Those roasted red peppers are so good with the wings! Each plate comes with 12 pieces, perfect to share between 3-4 people. It's definitely one of my top 5 places to get chicken wings. I hope they make their way down to LA! Of course, don't forget to order some vegetable dishes to clean your palate in between every few wings. I preferred the Spinach with Garlic over the Green Beans because it's a little lighter in flavors and sauce.
author: Chariya S.

description: First time trying the second location since the line was shorter. Overall, food was pretty comparable to the original location but the menu was more limited. Ordered the classic crack wings and the braised flounder. Classic crack wings were bomb as usual but the braised flounder was not the best. I order this dish at the original location and was much better. Lesson learned: just stick with the classic items and you can't go wrong at either location (crack wings, garlic string beans, dumplings).
author: Kevin T.

description: The longest I've ever waited to eat at a restaurant besides Boiling Crab...but I must say the 2hr wait was worth the delicious crispy sweet and spicy chicken wings.
author: Alessandra C.

description:
San Tung gets its claim to fame for their dry fried chicken wings. Seriously. They're the first things on the table once you've placed your order, and the first ones gone :P
An order gets you 12 pieces ($12.50) with sauce so addicting it should be illegal, and so sticky, it might as well have a swarm of bees around it (kidding)!

My cousins and I came here on a Monday night after seeing San Tung being so packed (literally next door), and within a few minutes, San Tung 2 also had a huge wait line!

We ordered a combination fried rice, 2 orders of the wings, and an order of the salt and pepper calamari. The fried rice was ok- I don't think it was too flavorful, but it could have been due to its appearance after the wings, and the salt and pepper calamari had kind of a weird aftertaste, but after coating some in the wing sauce...man!

Really though, if you drop by San Tung 1 or 2, remember the name: DRY FRIED CHICKEN WINGS. and ask for extra napkins!
author: Mary F.

description: As you're walking down Irving Street towards 11th or 12th Avenue, it's hard to miss San Tung because there's always a crowd. Guaranteed during dinner. You find yourself putting your name down for the original restaurant and find that the wait is already two hours at 5:30pm but luckily you can go to San Tung 2 next door and get seated right away! San Tung 2 has the basic dishes the original San Tung has and you're in and out in half an hour. It's pretty great. The dry fried chicken wings are always a winner and the black bean noodles are a win, as well. I find San Tung always tastes a lot better when you don't have to wait so don't be afraid to try this location!
author: Grace L.

description: We have always been wanting to come to this place! We were originally was going to go to San Tung but the place was always full so we go to the next door which we understand is the same owner. The food was great and the wings are to die for! We were a little disappointed a little because we wanted to try the dumpling also but were told that only the original San Tung have the Dumpling. Over all everything was pretty smooth.
author: Sikharin J.

description:
I love the original San Tung and this place is literally the same restaurant!
I know they opened another location right next to the original to accommodate for the large crowds of people that come.

This location is definitely for smaller parties, I would say don't come here with any party larger than 5 or 6. If you have a big party I would definitely recommend you go to the original because it has a bigger space and is meant to fit larger parties We came with a party of 5 and had to wait a bit because our party was so large. 

Parking is just street parking so goodluck! It takes a while sometimes so be patient, or park further away and walk.

We ordered:
CHICKEN WINGS (ORIGINAL SAUCE)
- SOOOOO GOOODDDDD
- it's just like the original chicken
- the sauce is perfectly sweet and tangy
- I love this chicken so much
- everytime I come to SF I have to come here to get some chicken

CHICKEN WINGS (SALT & PEPPER)
- we wanted to try it out since we hadn't gotten it before
- it was pretty good, definitely less flavorful, but overall really good
- it's just a different taste, I prefer the sauce wings but these were solid wings

SAUTEED STRING BEANS
- I love this dish
- I feel like it helps balance out the fact that I'm stuffing my face with chicken wings
- made with garlic and some type of dark sauce

Overall, I love San Tung in general and am really glad they opened another location to control the wait times. I 100% would come back as I do everytime I'm in town!
author: Vivian H.

description:
How have I lived in sf for 8 years and just trying San Tung now?! The wings are so good. I'm normally not a glaze wing fan and usually only like dry rubs but they do it right here. 

Also ordered green beans and tofu fried rice. All of which come out duper quick and are super tasty. 

Come early or at an off time otherwise be prepared to wait.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Good Food - perfekt for small and large party's
The food was incredible goo, service very friendly!
They remembered us, as we arrived at the restaurant 
We will drop in next time we visit San Francisco
author: K. B.

description:
Currently visiting Cali for a week, so my friend took me down to San Francisco because she said she had heard about it from multiple people and we decided to give it a try. Exactly the same menu as the original San Tung, but just more of their famous dishes and it was more minimized. Essentially, we ended up going since the wait was shorter. 

We had the infamous chicken wings, black bean noodles, and the stir fried dry string beans. All of the food came out in a timely manner and it was pretty tasty. The chicken wings were cooked really well and were extremely crispy despite the glaze it sat in. The food was pretty good, but personally I thought a lot of the food was sweet and it needed saltiness to be balanced out, just a personal preference. Really enjoyed the chicken wings and beans, but could have done without the black bean noodles. 

Overall it was a pretty good experience and the food was a good price. We got 12 chicken wings for around $8-10 dollars and the other two dishes were about the same.
author: Gabby N.

description: Damnnn I never had an idea that this place exist til' my cousin brought me in here. I so much like their food specially the seafood noodles and spicy chicken (chicken is somehow caramelized)
author: Nicole L.

description:
Pros: Great food and cheap prices

Cons: unpredictable opening times, they might not follow regular holiday pattern, for example, this restaurant was open xmas eve but closed the night after xmas. 

extremely long wait times, average half to 1.5 hour on popular times
author: Jesse J.

description:
2 words - over hyped.

The wings were good, slightly too sweet. Got hooked up and only waited 5 minutes instead of an hour on prime time. (arrived at 6pm) The wings need a little fish sauce ( might be a little bias because I like fish sauce wings) The green beans were a little too sweet as well. 

The hot and soup soup was refreshing, especially the shrimp inside it. Tables are square for smaller groups while the main one the tables are circular for bigger groups. 

Service was quick, all the servers were probably college students.
author: Anh L.

description:
Worth the wait!!!!

Decided to try out #2 as the wait was much shorter and I was not disappointed. In fact, this is probably some of the best Chinese food I have ever had. The dry fried chicken wings really lived up to the hype. The sweet, garlicky, spicy sauce that they come in is so good that you will want to lick the plate clean.
 
I would also have to recommend the cherry pork - it has its similarities to orange chicken but it is a real novel dish. The sweet and savory aspects are perfectly balanced.
author: Noah P.

description: This place usually has a shorter wait than nextdoor, so definitely put your name down here! As expected, the original dry fried chicken was great! We ordered 3 orders for 5 people and finished it all...in addition to our other dishes. We also got the hot braised chicken, salt & pepper chicken, string beans, and black bean noodles. Everything was good, but next time I would just replace the other two chicken dishes with the original =).
author: Cynthia M.

description: On point like usual! Best chicken wings, honey garlic sweet glaze, a little bit not too much spice, and a nice crispy skin for the last touch. Unfortunately only San Tung has dumplings on their side but we were only in the mood for black bean noodles thank god!! Also they didn't have brown rice either but I didn't mind white rice for a change!! Maybe call before choosing which one to go to if you're picky lol imo! Good customer service and nice generous servers! I feel like they can satisfy more of ur needs due to being a smaller size restaurant and being more lit up & vibrant. Will def come back here soon again! Another plus me and my bf loved is that they give u scissors without questioning for ur noodles do eat easier and cleaner!! My fav go to spot when going to SF! A MUST TRY!
author: Courtney H.

description: Terrible experience at San Tung 2. I had forgotten my wallet so before I even sat down I asked if I could use Samsung pay  and if it went through I would eat and if it didn't I would leave. The three people present would not even let me try it on their credit card machine. I tried to explain to them that it would work almost everywhere but they were adamant that it would not work on their machine because the person had not set it up for Apple pay. I tried to explain that Samsung pay will work without someone having to set something up and it's different than Apple pay but they continued to refuse even trying. Very disappointing. It would have not cost them anyting to at least just try.
author: A M.

description:
YUM! I can always expect decent Asian food here. I've actually only been this this one, rather than the main San Tung next door. This location has a much shorter wait. 

Last time I was here, friends and I ordered the black bean noodles, fried rice, and chicken wings. Everything was shared family-style. Noodles were super delicious! I always order it when I'm here. Fried rice was so so. Good but nothing special. Chicken wings were (obviously) the reason we came. Has a bit of a spicy kick to it, but still bearable to my pansy taste buds. 

Overall it's a great place for Chinese food and people always rave about the chicken. After eating there a few times, I still like it but will only go if the wait isn't too long.
author: Jenny T.

description:
There's a San Tung 1 and then there's a San Tung 2 and both establishments are next to each other! 

A couple of friends and I from SoCal was pretty hyped to try the original San Tung but the wait was too long. So we decided to go to San Tung 2. 

The restaurant is decently sized, it could fit small to large parties from 2-12. 

The most memorable dish I could recall was their C H I C K E N W I N G S ! 

Demmm wings were on point! 

The gist of this review is the wings. I ordered wet wings and I recommend them as well. Wings wings wings. 

Note: The Wings aren't comparable to places like bdubs or wing stop. These wings have an Asian flavorful twist to it that hits right at home for me! 

Overalls, service was alright. Ambience was ehh. But the wings? Mhmm! Delicious!
author: San Z.

description: You never disappoint me. Except for on super bowl and you wouldn't answer your phones and when I showed up to place an order you said it would be a 45 minute wait and I still forgave you. It's a love hat relationship.
author: Thi K.

description:
*SAME chicken as the original next door!*

Boy does the original San Tung restaurant get packed! Being like everyone else, we placed ourselves on the wait list at the original location... time ticked away while we notice that San Tung 2 is practically empty!

Uhmm why is it empty? We decided to screw the wait and walked into san tung 2.

DIFFERENCE:smaller menu from orginal location BUT it has all of the MAIN dishes that you'd usually order next door anyways. 
Con: No kimchi. Can be out of supply on certain dish.

FOOD:
-AWESOME SUCCULENT FINGER-LICKING GOOD FRIED CHICKEN! It is exactly the same as next door.  5/5 star

- Mongolian beef: tasted like how it would with regular chinese take-out. 3/5 star

- Hot and sour soup: humungous portion. You would need about 6 ppl to finish this. Tastes more sour with no balance of 'hot'. 2/5 star

-Potstickers: poorly made, filling lacks flavor, has barely any crunch. 1.5 /5 star (stick with the dumplings!!)


Decor: 
-much cleaner than san tung 1. 
- more walkway space
-interesting girly lights (flowers/butterflies?) on the ceiling

Service:
- servers were younger and they're so much more courteous! 
- they are fast with the wings! Other dishes came out with fair wait time.

Still giving thus place 5 stars just because of the wings! Plus with better service and shorter wait time, whose to complain?
author: Jackie C.

description:
After reading so many rave reviews about their famous chicken wings, we knew we had to come here to try them. We ordered takeout since we didn't want to wait in line, and were glad that we did  - both San Tung and San Tung II next door were packed and there was a bunch of people waiting outside. Our takeout was ready in 10 minutes (one order of chicken wings with approximately 10 pieces came to $13.50). The box came with a lot of napkins as well, which were necessary since it was a messy job eating them! 

The chicken wings themselves were very good. They were very fried and crispy, and a good size with a lot of meat on the bone. I thought there was a bit too much sauce, and the sauce was a little too sweet. However, overall I was very satisfied. Spiciness is mild. Definitely one of the better fried chicken wings I have had, although I still think Bonchon soy and garlic wings take the cake for the best wings.
author: Amy C.

description:
Gladly would share that the food is great, customer service on the other hand! Not GREAT AT ALL! very rude female servers.Never had a bad customer service from this side of the restaurant. Always had great service next door at the nicer building,not sure what went wrong.

YOU also should all know this place doesnt accept pennies which means your bill/tax will be rounded,and when asked the staff was rude in telling us why they do what they do.."thats just what the boss does" 

ex. If your tax is XX.93 they will charge you XX.95 they don't tell you that though, But they gladly let you know that 18% gratuity will be added for a party of 5 or more. How rude is that? It would be courteous to lwt ypur customers know that instead of stealing from them. Wonder how much they are making off all their customers who are unaware of that!
author: Kiarah M.

description:
The original San Tung had a 1.5 hour wait, so we went next door where we didn't wait at all and ate the same thing! Chicken here is not HYPE, it's the real deal. 

Yes, I had my doubts. Why would anyone settle for #2 when they could go for #1? San Tung #2 shares the same exact same kitchen as the original. I asked the waiter why on earth would nobody come over to the sister restaurant and he shrugged. The menu was almost identical. Smaller, but come on. The wings are what we really care about. Plus no wait? Priceless. 

Ok, let's talk wings. I've had a good number of wings in my lifetime. These wings can I dare say were....orgasmic. Hot and crispy on the outside, but moist inside. Then drenched in a hot, sticky, sweet sauce that got all over my mouth. OH YEAH. Food porn at it's best. Finger lickin' good. 

The downside to this place, there were noodles EVERYWHERE on the floor. I was wearing my new boots and tried not to get that stuff stuck on the soles of my shoes. But hey, the dirtier the better right? 

Pro Tip: Why wait for a ridiculously long time for the original, when you can wait NOTHING and eat the same thing? Sure, the menu is smaller. But when you come to San Tung, you just want the wings. Trust me. And maybe the garlic string beans. Ah yes, those were a winner too.
author: Jen P.

description: San Tung has one of the best wings in SF Bay Area, their restaurant is right next to each other which makes it easy for guest to sign up on both waiting list and see which one you'll be called in first. Unfortunately when I came the wait was too long, and some items were sold out so I got it togo. We bought a sides of rice and ate in the car and it was sooo good! The skin was crunchy and had lots of flavor, was not dry at all! I ordered 36 wings and that wasn't even enough for 3 adults and 1 child. I have to come back one of these days and try the other items my friends are raving about. San Tung's Chicken is so addicting I caught myself craving for it the next day!
author: R V.

description:
Let me tell you one thing. THE HYPE IS REAL! Those chicken wings were some of the best ones I ever had. They were cooked perfectly and were super delicious. Tasted kinda like orange chicken. We also got an order of kung Pao chicken and pork dumplings which were delicious too. The portions are pretty big.

When we arrived they already had a long list of people waiting. We figured it would be a while before it was our turn so we put our names down and decided to walk to a boba place that ended up being a lot farther than we thought it was. When we got back they were already 4 parties past us. Luckily one of the waiters was very nice and understanding and sat us down in the next available table. 

I hope to be back again soon so I can get my fix of wings!
author: Jazmin M.

description: My group and I originally came to San Tung but the wait was ridiculous so we decided to go to #2. My sister lives in the Bay Area so she recommended that my cousins and I check this place out. The dishes we got were string beans with chicken, black bean noodles and the dry chicken wings. The chicken wings are really good and crispy (they are known for the chicken) other than that everything else was alright. Everyone thought the dishes we got here tasted like we can get these at any Chinese fast food places back home. The lines and the hype didn't live up to our standards but at least we can say we've been here before!
author: Sovanary T.

description:
Parking is tough and the wait probably tougher. You can play your odds and write names down at both San Tungs, but you're still looking at 30-60 minutes for a table at normal eating hours. But it's worth it. 

The two San Tungs share recipes, and not sure if it's been confirmed, but might share a kitchen too. It's uber popular, and while it's a tough sell as perfect food - it will always be consistently good. 

Of course, dried fried chicken is a must after standing for so damn long. We actually like the diced more than boned, but try both! We're also fans of the dried friend flounder (get it in the same sauce as the chicken), the black bean noodles, and the three deluxe spicy noodles. 

Vegetable dishes (pretty much garlic + [insert vegetable here]) and soups are good complements, and you probably just shouldn't overload on fried chicken (though we do), but nothing that tastes different than what you'd find at any other restaurant featuring Northern Chinese food. All in all, San Tung is definitely in the upper echelon of comfort food and we will be back every few months to wait by their doors encouraging waitresses to not call names more than twice. 

One more thing: you won't be seated until your whole party is there, so either fake it and get dirty looks or give your friends a heads up so they don't keep you waiting longer.
author: Mo B.

description:
Way quicker line than the other place.

I never enjoy veggies, but I was guzzling down these stringbean things like they were candy.
The wings made me feel like they could fly, even with all the thick sauce weighing it down. How do you keep something so crispy in something so drenched in sauce? 

Yeah just come here and eat up
author: Innsu K.

description:
Always come here instead of to the big San Tung 1 restaurant! There's seriously like no difference (except positive ones like no wait and fast service) and the menu at San Tung 2 is pretty extensive already. I can't imagine someone coming here and being like "I can't find that item I want!!!"

The dry fried chicken wings are sooo good!! For me, they meet the hype. They are crispy wings that are dripping in a sweet and spicy super sticky sauce... The portion size is pretty big too so I think they are a pretty good value. 

I also really enjoy the pork dumplings here, mainly because they have a hint of gingery flavor. The tables have vinegar so it's easy to make a nice dumpling dipping sauce! Additional side orders that are enjoyable are the green beans and mushu pork - these are just safe always-good sides I think.

The black bean noodles here are kind of weird to me and seem more similar to the Korean style. The sauce is starchy with chunks of veg/protein. I personally would not re-order. 

San Tung 1 currently has terrible health code ratings and I don't understand why it doesn't transfer to San Tung 2... But I try not to think about that. At this point I've never seen bugs or hair or anything too questionable in my food so I'm going to imagine that everything is OK. :-)
author: Diana W.

description: Chicken wings are unbelievable. Customer service is pretty good as well. But be warned majority of the time there is a wait. The wings are so yummy it's crazy because you can order the chicken wings and eat them the next day and their still as good, definitely beats other wings bc other wings would get soggy and not delightful after a few hours but there wings could probably stay good for a lifetime!
author: Kassandra M.

description:
Get the chicken. 

I'm reviewing San Tung 2 because the line for San Tung 1 is always too long, so I always end up eating at San Tung 2. I've eaten at San Tung 1 once and honestly can't really tell the difference in taste with the chicken.

Every time I go to NorCal, I end up eating at San Tung. Why? The chicken is just way too good. The sauce on the chicken is amaaaaaazing. It has an awesome spicy but sweet flavor. Think of it as a sweet honey glaze but with the kick you want from peppers. Instead of the sauce complementing the chicken, the sauce is the boss here. Chicken was made for this sauce. Of course, it helps that the chicken is always cooked to a juicy perfection. I need more of this sauce in my life, but sadly, I can only get it at San Tung. 

Chicken, you won't regret it.

I've also tried the jjajangmyun. It was all right, but I'll just say, the chicken is where it's at.
author: Jin L.

description:
Brother of the OG San Tung. Opened to make the lines move faster. If you are trying to simply eat the famous chicken wings or just the popular dishes, feel free to visit this San Tung #2 as it's menu only include the most popular ordered dishes. Much less wait.

Chicken wings taste the same. They're really good but personally I feel they aren't too special (maybe cuz I had it too many times).

Nonetheless, some good Chinese food!
author: Raymond C.

description: The line for San Tung was already getting long when we arrived at 5:45 on Friday so we peeked over at San Tung 2. They appeared to have all of the menu items we wanted and there were tables available so we decided to just switch over to that one. We had the egg flower soup, chicken wings, beef mushu, and the string beans and everything tasted great! The service was good and the food came out quickly. But by the time we finished, there was a line for this restaurant as well but not nearly as long as the one for the original San Tung. If all the menu items you want are offered at San Tung 2, I would definitely recommend skipping the line and eating here!
author: Gloria N.

description: People who like their wings a little sweet and crisp would love this place. I went here with a friend who absolutely love this place. They come here just for the wings. I personally like the wings a little spicy so not my cup of tea but nonetheless the food was good.
author: Shwetz M.

description:
The wait for Sam Tung #1 was too long. Had to settle for San Tung #2. 
Everyone has their own preference when it comes to chicken wings. Some folks like the expensive, organic, Michelin-star quality chicken wings. While other people are perfectly happy with the fried chicken they get at their local KFC. Me? I'm somewhere in the middle. While I'm no expert on chicken wings, I have to say their world famous chicken wings definitely live up to the hype at a very affordable price. Crispy on the outside, juicy and tender on the inside, and the sauce tastes magically delicious. I'll say it's pretty on par with the Bonchon chicken wings you can get around the bay area.

Besides the wings, also tried the black bean sauce noodle, beef chow mein and shredded pork with jalapenos. The quantity is a lot - we're a party of 3 and we can barely finish it. Quality is ok. Definitely not the best chow mein or shredded pork or black bean noodle dish I had, but it's decent. All of the dishes (besides the chicken wings) are surprisingly light in favor. 

Would definitely come back for the chicken wings. If you're in the area, you're a fool not to check them out.
author: Xin W.

description:
TERRIBLE SERVICE. Understaffed. Rude waitress. 

I tried this place the other day as the original next door was closed. It is rare to experience a wait staff where someone gives you attitude, but the waitress here was exceptionally rude.

The was only one waitress waiting on ALL the tables in the restaurant. This waitress was also responsible for managing takeout orders and the register. We indicated we would like to order takeout, at which point the waitress told us we'd only be able to order wings. After at least 20 minutes of ignoring us right at the register, someone ELSE finally took our order as the waitress rudely talked back to us when I asked how long it would be for her to take our order. We had already been waiting for 20 minutes for her to acknowledge us a second time!

While the food did look decent, I will not be back here again due to the rude waitress. Having a busy restaurant is no excuse to having rude wait staff.

Do yourselves a favor, go to the original instead.
author: Christine G.

description:
The best wings ever. The line is long, but I can honestly see what the hype is about. There's San Tung 1 and San Tung 2. San Tung 1 is the original and it seems like it is more packed so I put my name on both San Tung 1 and San Tung 2 to see which line is faster. We ended up going to San Tung 2.

We ordered the black bean noodles and while it came pretty quickly, the black bean sauce wasn't too flavorful. You can tell it lacked the traditional ingredients to the black bean noodles--the grounded pork, mini potato cubes, lots of onions, and lots of sliced zucchinis. Instead it had shrimp, calamari, a few big potato cubes which I thought was pork belly (DARN), pork, some onions, and some zucchinis. Of course, I didn't have high expectations for this dish. The main dish to really rave about is their...

ORIGINAL DRY FRIED CHICKEN WINGS. 
The name itself is very deceiving for it is literally drenched in a honey, sweet, gingery, and savory sauce. The wings took a while to come, but once it was placed at our table, we knew we made the right choice of coming here. That beautiful glisten makes our mouth water and eat bite was crispy and hot. The sauce was so flavorful--like MSG/Umami in each bite. They overload the sauce with honey, causing a nice thick consistency of the sauce. This is worth the hype and it's highly recommended that you eat at the restaurant. Come in a happy mood and a decent appetite so you don't get angry at their customer service and long wait.
author: Iris C.

description:
I'm glad that I had a chance to try San Tung again, this time in their satellite location... Conveniently right next door. It's ideal for smaller groups. There are mostly rectangular tables for four, unlike the original restaurant with several large round tables for parties of eight.

I was here with a group of friends, and we ordered pork, Mongolian beef, chow mein, and the famous San Tung wings. Similar to the last time I was here, I was not impressed with the food, much less the famous wings. It was decent food, but in the future, I wouldn't be jumping up and down with excitement saying, "Let's eat at San Tung!" I'm always down when someone makes the suggestion, though.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The chicken!!!!! Oh the chicken. Dry fried chicken. Heaven deliciousness. San Tung was packed and the line was humongous so we went next door to San Tung 2 (which has just the most popular dishes which is great cause I just want the chicken!!). The list was long too BUTTT it was all parties of 3 or 4, so since we were a party of 2, we got seated IMMEDIATELY!! Service was fast. Food was great. Got the spicy black noodles too, that was just ok. But the chicken definitely makes everything worth it.
author: Amy N.

description:
Anytime someone says "you want santung?" You hardly ever get a "NO."

My boyfriend and I were on our way towards the Presidio and just said "oh f!ck it, why not". We went over to check out San Tung 1 (The original) and there was a wait there already... we went over to San Tung 2 and checked out the menu, still has the staple go-to's like their dry fried chicken wings and the black bean sauce noodles. Portions are huge and plenty enough for left overs.

We just decided to go to San Tung 2 since there was no wait what so ever and we already knew what we wanted to order. The thing about the location of San Tung(s) is the ssttttttuuupppiiiiidddd parking! But luckily we got parking on Judah street. 

Everything here is just as good and delicious and burning hot as it is at San Tung 1 without the wait.
author: Crystal C.

description: Dropped by to pick up some food for the airport. There was no wait and our food was prepared pretty quickly. We got their original chicken wings with the black bean noodles which were both tasty. Customer service was friendly as well.
author: Cheyne T.

description: Came here for Sunday lunch! We ordered the string beans, chicken wings, and black bean noodles. Overall the meal was very appetizing; with a lot of Asian cuisine it can be easy to make things too salty or overwhelming, but San Tung offered a very satisfying flavour. The green beans were crispy, well seasoned with a slightly sweet garlic honey sauce. The chicken wings weren't too heavy or salty. I could just keep eating them. My favourite was the black bean noodles. They have a depth of flavour and a firm texture that makes them irresistible.
author: Ian L.

description:
I have learned my lesson. Wait for the original. 

They don't offer the full menu. They don't even have sweet and sour sauce? 

The service is even lower than what is expected at a mom and pop chinese restaurant. 

Dirty. 

The food. Something was off. We couldn't pin point it. But it want the same. 

We will wait the appropriate time next time to go the original.
author: Michelle I.

description: Went here for dinner with my family last weekend and we ordered the chicken fried rice, beef chowmein, green beans, dry fried chicken, and this spicy noodle thing with seafood! Everything was good! Service was just very slow and the servers were unattentive..
author: Alyssa C.

description: I enjoyed this location more than the original.  Not sure if the original is hyped up or not.  We waited approximately 30 minutes for a tablet and the server was super friendly (even though he was running around like his head was chopped off).  I possibly enjoyed this since I was starving!  Ordered combo fried rice, firecracker soup, wings, and dried styled green beans.  I enjoyed EACH thing I ate.  Wing were SUPER hot, crispy, and TASTY.  Fried rice as simple and not soggy (which I hate).  Firecracker soup had a light broth w/ vegetables and crispy rice for texture.  Green beans had a night crunch and tossed in a dark sauce.
author: Ivy T.

description: 4 stars because the mushu chicken was disappointing. It lacked flavor and frankly, is much better at Chang's across the street. And the hoisin tasted off. BUT- I finally tried the wings. And they were INCREDIBLE. Better than I thought they'd be. I've watched people eat them since I've lived in the city and just now finally tried them. I regret not having them sooner- they're delicious.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Agree with the 3.5 rating on the yelp page but rounding down because I really wanted to try the original San Tung. I came to visit from the east coast and was told by a friend that I had to try San Tung. I walked 2 miles to their location only to see a sign on the front door that they would be closed for vacation from Oct. 25 to Nov. 9 for vacation. UGH. Would have been nice to have gotten some kind of notice from their yelp page before trekking out here. Luckily San Tung 2 is right next door so the trip wasn't a complete waste. 

I ordered the dry sautéed green beans, original dry fried chicken, and the shrimp and leek dumplings. After being seated, your order is quickly taken and food comes out quickly as well. I never felt like I was waiting for the waiter to come by or for food to come out. Green beans and chicken were good, but the dumplings were pretty mediocre and bland. I've had frozen dumplings that I've enjoyed more. The chicken was hot and crispy and it tasted less artificial than Bonchon. They're marked as spicy on the menu but I really didn't get much of a spicy flavor even though I'm pretty sensitive to spiciness. 

There was nothing that I hated, but at the same time nothing I was wowed by that would make me crave to come back. Maybe the original San Tung does it better? Our total ended up being $35 after tax and tip. Not worth it in my opinion.
author: Johanna H.

description:
Favorite chicken wing spot! Always come like 30mins before they close if you want to get seated without a long wait. I love how people don't know if this place is connected with the other one that's next door! THEY ARE! 

My go-to is always the wings and hot and sour soup. Sometimes I will order their noodles if I wanted more carbs. Love love this place!
author: Alice Z.

description:
The food is okay. Typical Chinese menu with fried chicken glazed with "hot" sauce. You could find this style with similar flavor at most other places. The dumplings had a chemical aftertaste and the shrimp fried rice was mediocre. 

On to the service. We ordered wings but wanted half with sauce and half without. They couldn't accommodate my request and didn't give me a solid reason why. What's so difficult about cooking half the wings without sauce? Plus, our server had really long, acrylic fingernails and I immediately knew that it wasn't right.  It's unhygienic, especially when handling food. I'd prefer not to get a side of fecal matter with my wings. 

Overall, there was something "off" about the food and the "service" is lacking. Go at your own risk.
author: Geoff S.

description:
I do not understand why people do not go to this one more often, this place definitely serves the same quality as the original. Sometimes the wait here is faster than the original! It is a little smaller, but it is more intimate and not as loud, so definitely a nicer "date" spot. The menu is smaller than the original, but it contains all the important menu items from the original like the dried fried chicken wings. They are pretty quick with their service, like the original. They attend to you and serve the food pretty quickly. I feel like the service here is better than the original. They servers are nicer and more attentive. The servers are the original just come take your order and bring whatever you need, they always seem to be in a hurry.

The best dried fried chicken wings EVER! The hype is definitely real. Honestly there are other places where the chicken wings are crispier or you have more flavor options, but nothing beats this, especially for the price too. They only have one type of sauce which is a house special, but it is absolutely phenomenal. It is the right amount of sweetness and tanginess that allows you to keep eating the chicken wings without getting tired of the flavor! There are a lot of flavors out there that are delicious, but get a bit too much after a while. With these wings I can chow down on a huge amount and eat it again the NEXT day. The wings are decently sized too, so you're definitely getting every bang for your buck. These are definitely the best things on the menu. I would make an hour drive out to SF just to eat these wings and go back home. This is what makes this restaurant a 5 star for me. You cannot get this anywhere else. 

The string beans is also really delicious here. They give you a LOT too, it is definitely something you can share. They sautee it in a sauce that is similar to soy sauce but slightly different as well. It is a little bit less salty, but adds a lot of flavor to the string beans. It has a hint of sweetness to it as well. They are definitely a nice counter part to the wings.

I have tried two different noodles, the black bean and the peanut sauce. The black bean is hands down so much better than the peanut sauce. The peanut sauce is not super flavorful, it tastes quite bland. The noodles are not dry, but the sauce just has no taste to it. I do appreciate that they have meat and veggies in it, but I would definitely not order it again. The black bean has a TON of flavor. They give you a LOT so you will definitely have leftovers. The noodles are soaked in the black bean sauce so you are getting a punch of flavor in each bite. I would order this again. I would like to try the dry black bean noodles too!

The honey walnut shrimp was very reminiscent of when I was younger and attended weddings at the big banquet halls and they served this dish. It is flavored very well and the shrimp pieces are actually decently sized. I had imagined they were going to be the baby shrimps. I would order it again, but not every time. I don't think that it is worth it for the money, it is a little bit pricey and you don't get too many pieces of shrimp with it.
author: Michelle B.

description: San Tung # 2 is right next to San Tung #1. It is basically an extension of the original, minus dumplings and some other menu items. Try the dry fried chicken wings here: they are the real deal.
author: Johnny M.

description: Went to this location after seeing how packed the first one was, there was no line at this location. My friends and I got seated immediately, the waitress was quick and prompt with bringing over the menus and water. We ordered the egg flower soup, combination fried rice and original dry fried chicken. All of our dishes came out in about 5-10mins. The egg flower soup was delicious and light, make sure to add a few hints of white pepper to make it a little saltier. The combo fried rice was only okay, a little plain. The chicken wings were meaty, crispy, tangy and very hot from the kitchen. They were sooooooo delicious that we ordered a 2nd one haha! This place definitely lived up to its hype. Also the service we received from the waitress is the best I've seen and i've been to a fair share of Chinese restaurants. Definitely going to come back often.
author: Jason W.

description:
Chicken wings. The famous San Tung wings live up to the hype. 

The chicken wings come in a dozen so they are easy to split with people kill them all yourself. 

I recommend getting the wet style with the sauce dipping off the plate. The sauce is an Asian tangy zesty sauce. Delicious. 

Try the seafood chow mein too. 

Overall: will return and will bring friends. One of the spots for chicken wings in the SF area.
author: Stephen C.

description: The funny thing is that San Tung 2 doesn't get as busy but it's the same portions and food. Minus the Kimchi!! If your craving the Original Dried Garlic Wings that most people get them just stop by here. No Wait and your belly will be happy!
author: Justin A.

description: Love this place ! Nice place to relax and hang out with the Family. The food is great
author: C Frisco L.

description: BEST CHICKEN WINGS EVER! The wait could be torture but I promise it's worth it. Every time I'm back in SF, I'll be sure to pay a visit to San Tung.
author: Evett L.

description:
FIRST TIMER PERSPECTIVE: Great food even for the wait.

They have 2 locations right next to each other, my niece and her friends said they both taste the same; which is good. They are known for their "fried chicken" and I can concur it is delicious. However, I was in the mood to having something more than just chicken. I decided to order "hot and sour soup" and one of their noodles. I can't remember which one at the moment but needless to say both were superb. The noodles were hand pulled which also set them apart from other Chinese restaurants. We waited for about 45mins and "San Tung 1" had a longer wait. 

The reason I gave them 4 vs 5 is service. It took them a while to bring things we asked for and even for the check. Remember I said it was a long wait, could this be because of service? After a several attempts to get a waiter/waitress, my niece's roommate got up and got the togo containers herself. We were the back table near it. They saw us and didn't say anything, so I guess it happens often. 

I would go back but I would definitely not go starving (grab a small bite or snack while your waiting).
author: Nazarene L.

description: Would have been a nice place to eat. The interior is clean and cozy. Too bad the waitress was extremely rude and unpleasant. The minute we walked in she seemed annoyed. I had to beg her for water, which she slammed on the table with an attitude. So my friend and I walked right out.
author: Di P.

description:
DO YOU LIKE WINGS? THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE!

Food here were awesome! Favorite food to order: Honey walnut shrimp, Combination Fried rice and of course!!!  Dry Fried Chicken !! Whenever we are in the area this is the place we always go to, even though parking is a nightmare!  Place and service is so-so.
author: Pauline P.

description: Usually get take out from the original San Tung but couldn't be bothered waiting in line and I was getting hangry so went into San Tung 2. The food here is just as great as the original and will be visiting here for my wings from now on. I like how it's not as crowded and more updated at this location. I'm not a fan of the black bean noodles as I feel they are too sweet so went with the Pork with hot pepper noodles not super spicy and very delicious. The sauce was delicious! We also got the original dry fried mushrooms which is covered in the same sauce as their wings. If you like mushrooms this is the dish to get!
author: Carol L.

description:
Coming from Chicago, I've been warned that the Chinese food in SF can't compare which makes me thankful for San Tung. Of all the dishes I've had here, my favorite is the sauteed bean threads with sauteed shredded pork. So flavorful and the beans are cooked to perfection. 

There's typically a long ass line next door, but don't hesitate to pop over here - they're the same.
author: Selena L.

description:
Those wings, those wings! Dry fried chicken is pretty much all you need to know here.

I've been wanting to try San Tung for ages, but the first two times we came by, they happened to be closed for an event/away on vacation! Third time's the charm - they were finally open tonight.

I came in a group of 3 at about 7 pm on a Saturday, and both San Tungs (the original and this one, #2, are right next door to each other - and likely share a kitchen) were popping. But this one was slightly less busy, so I put my name on the list. We waited about 20 or so minutes - not too bad! We ordered almost immediately, and the food came out super fast, which was a pleasant surprise.

We ordered 4 dishes to share:

DRY FRIED CHICKEN (duh): Amazing. Worth the wait! Sticky and crunchy and sweet and spicy and yuuuummmyyyyy. Obviously, order this!

DRIED SAUTEED STRING BEANS: Surprisingly sweet, but quite good!

DELUXE SOUP NOODLES: Seafood and beef with homemade noodles in a super comforting and thick egg broth. I thoroughly enjoyed this, but it wasn't quite as flavorful as the other dishes we ordered.

COMBINATION FRIED RICE: So good, I kept going back for more. It's a pretty standard fried rice, except the pieces of meat and seafood are pretty large, and it seemed butterier (or something; might not have been literally butter) than most take-out type fried rice.

Overall, if you don't mind milling about for a bit while you wait for a table, then you won't be disappointed! That was a very satisfying meal.
author: Liz F.

description:
Its hard to find parking.
Then you have to wait either to be seated or for your food. 

I alwaysss just pick up now ;) for SAN TUNG NOT SAN TUNG 2!!!

I came here for the 1st time with a friend and lovedddd it. Returned for the 3rd time later that week. Super dry. no wait. ordered our food: them wangs, honey walnut prawns and some rice. We kindly asked to cancel the prawns and add another order of wings. The waiter did not do so and gave us the prawns and we kindly reminded him we asked for them to be removed. He argues we said we wanted them. Either way now we don't so he should respect that. Instead he agitatedly took the prawn plate away and ignored us the rest of the night.

We left our empty water cups and the end of the table so he could refill and he intentionally kept walking PASSED up going to EVERY SINGLE TABLE but ours. Seriously and there were not even packed whatsoever. 

I just can't deal. I highly suggest picking up than to wait and deal with the rudeness. 
I SUGGESTED THEY OPEN AN EAST BAY LOCATION!
author: Jasmine-Desiree L.

description:
Honestly, I just really love their dry fried chicken haha. Crispy, honey glazed and just delicious! I saw some chili peppers, but it's not spicy at all (this is coming from someone who can't really handle spice).

Came here because it was packed next door. It was noon and there was barely anyone in this restaurant, but hey...no complaints here! I also tried the string beans for the first time and it was pretty good. I like how they add the sliced Chinese pickles...this dish is kind of sweet though, so I wouldn't recommend it if you don't like sweet vegetables.

We also got the black bean noodles, which were not yummy at all. It felt kind of slimy, wasn't really hot, and flavor was weird. I ate a few bites to figure out what the weird taste was, but couldn't put my finger on it. Definitely doesn't taste like your typical black bean sauce. They also add a few pieces of beef, squid and shrimp. Also not very tasty. 

But go and try their dry fried chicken and string beans! Yumm!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Basically the same as San Tung but with slightly more modern decor. All that matters is that the dry fried chicken wings are the same- and they are and at slightly less of a wait. 

The chicken wings come fresh out of the fryer and are covered in a glorious concoction of honey, garlic, pepper, and other Asian spices. A plate of 10 of these can easily be devoured in minutes- but let them cool down or else you'll burn your tongue! I also got some string beans to try the balance out the unhealthiness of deep fried goodness- but they are also oily and fried but nonetheless delicious and I guess a bit of fiber. Can't go wrong with some of the sweetest and savory chicken wings!
author: Steven V.

description: Call me crazy but I can tell the difference between san tung and this place. It was good but not san tung good. The wings weren't as good and the spicy seafood noodles weren't memorable. Worth it if you would like to skip the wait next door
author: Antonella H.

description: The chicken wings are why I come here so I don't know why the 1st restaurant is crowded and this one isn't! The seating here is more comfortable and you get service faster! One time I wrote my name on the board at the original san tung, walked over and ate at san tung2 and went back to see that my name hasn't been called yet!
author: David P.

description:
Best chicken wings in the Bay Area. Yes, I said it and I'm sticking by it. If you love chicken wings, then San Tung is a must try. It's so good that they opened a second location right next to the first one! If that doesn't tell you something, then I don't know what else would convince you.

There's a misconception that there's a difference between the two restaurants. I'm guilty of thinking this too, but please be advised that the chicken wings are the same! The only things that may be a difference are that the second location may not serve the dumplings, potstickers, and kimchi. There was a sign outside that said this, but I'm not sure if it's a permanent thing or if they just ran out for the day.

We arrived on a Sunday almost right when they opened (5pm). There were about 7+ parties before us at the original location, so we walked next door and saw there was no wait. We were seated right away and given waters all around. We ordered 2 orders of the Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings, string beans, and the black bean noodles. We were so hungry that we started eating whatever arrived to the table first. (The order was string beans, noodles, then the chicken). String beans were crunchy and coated well with the sauce. The black bean noodles were so-so. We ended up adding a little bit of salt and sriracha to it and it made all the difference, in our opinion. The chicken speaks for itself. It was so hot that we had to wait a bit until we got to eat it, so that's how you know it was freshly made. It doesn't leave you with that heavy, sick feeling in your stomach after eating, which is a huge plus. It's a must try and I'll let you be the judge for yourself.

Located in SF, parking can get so tricky. Be prepared to drive around for a while, unless you get lucky and find someone leaving as you happen to drive by. But I promise that it's worth it and the wings will have you and your group planning for your next San Tung food trip.
author: Mia T.

description: People here are way nicer than San Tung 1. They re hella rude. But in San Tung 2 they are super nice. We only came here for chicken to go so no need to wait for a long lime and my husband never get the help he needs or answer to his inquiry only to find out San Tung 2 sells the same chicken wings and we are good! The chicken wings was hella sweet but its yummy not to bad
author: Erika Camil R.

description:
If you have never heard of San Tung, you're missing out. Especially if you're into chicken wings. The most amazing and delicious chicken wings that you've ever tasted? I think San Tung nails that description with their original dry-fried chicken wings. 

So if you've never heard of San Tung, let me enlighten you. Chicken wings. People make the drive from all sorts of places just to wait in line and get a taste of these delicious and mouth-watering wings. And because it was such a hit with customers, they opened a second San Tung's next door to the original one. I'm not sure why this one has much lower ratings than the original, but as I've only eaten from San Tung 2 twice AND enjoyed it, I don't know if there's that big of a difference. 

The first time I tried San Tung's, the line was quite long and it was almost closing time. We ended up ordering three orders of the original dry-fried chicken wings and debated on eating it back at my friend's apartment ... or being shameless and eating outside of a liquor store on a public bench. With the AMAZING whiff of sauce from the chicken wings hitting our noses, we knew that we wouldn't last the few blocks so we opted for the latter. Yep. We sat outside, using chop sticks and fingers trying to quickly eat up the chicken wings because they were that good, but also trying to avoid burning our tongues and mouths. We ended up burning our mouths anyway, but because it was so good, we didn't mind. We just wanted to continue eating. Even though the chicken seems pretty lackluster, the moment you eat it with the special sauce, something triggers your taste buds to think, "no, I've actually never had anything as amazing as this." It's not fried to the point of KFC as the chickens are then doused in a sticky sweet sauce that hardens quickly. 

So when I came back to San Tung with my family, the line for the original restaurant was horrendous, but there was no wait at San Tung 2. So ... of course we headed to the second restaurant. 

Garlic Green Beans: They're good for a vegetable dish, but honestly it's just a regular green bean dish. You can probably make just as good green beans at home. I wouldn't say they're anything spectacular. 

Black Bean Noodles: My sister originally saw some type of noodle and asked the waitress what it was. The waitress told us it was the black bean noodles, and when it came out, we were pretty disappointed because it wasn't the dish we had originally planned on getting. The black bean noodle dish is light in flavor and pretty unique, but for me - I just thought it was bland and tasteless. There were bits and pieces of meat inside, but personally, wasn't a fan. 

Rice: You pay by bowl. 

Original Dry-Fried Chicken Wings: Each order comes with 12 wings, and I don't think you can do half orders, so we had 2 orders of chicken wings. Even though they were that good, we couldn't finish it all and had to force ourselves to eat the remaining few wings. But, I'm glad we had rice to complement the sweet sauce of the chicken wings. The rice allowed us to feel as if we were eating a hearty Chinese dinner. After my family tried these wings for the first time, they agreed with me that it was really good. Something about the way they cook it and douse it with the sauce - it doesn't taste too unhealthy. The chicken is crunchy on the outside with tangy flavor from the sauce seeping in, but upon biting into it, you get mouthfuls of tender chicken. 

tl;dr - Yes, I actually wrote detailed paragraphs about how finger-licking good the chicken at San Tung (1&2) really is. If there's a long wait at 1, just head to 2 or order take-out to save time. Original Dry-Fried Chicken Wings is all you need from San Tung's. I don't know if there's ever no line, so it kinda comes down to luck. You can also call in to order for pick-up, but I tried that once and they told me they had run out of chicken wings. Definitely give this place a try if you've never had it. It's worth the visit and you'll leave feeling full and without any regrets.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
San Tung 2 is the destination when the OG location directly beside it is too full. Let's be honest. We're all here for the chicken wings. Maybe the dumplings. Definitely the green beans. But mostly for the chicken wings. 

I often wondered what the difference between the 2 restaurants were. San Tung 2 had been closed while we ate next door at the original location every time I had been there so I never got to try it out until a few weeks ago. We were told it has a smaller menu than next door. They said they dont have the cold dishes available. Fine by me... We were there for the wings and for the string beans. We put our name on the list and were called within half an hour. This was a little past 5pm. They hadn't been open for the evening that long (they open at 5pm for dinner) at the time but both restaurants were packed with long wait times. It helped that there were only 2 of us. We were seated by the window out front on high stools. Right in front of the people looking at the menu taped onto the window. Kinda awkward because everyone could see what we were eating but it was ok. At least we were seated. 

We went with one order of dry fried chicken wings, one order of garlic string beans, seafood soup and some plain rice. All of my focus was on the wings and string beans as that was all I needed. It was just as tasty and delicious as next door. They really are the most crackinest wings in the city. So good. And the garlic string beans, to me, are the perfect compliment to the wings. So tasty and they are pan fried/sauteed in a garlic sauce worth writing home about. It was the perfect early dinner on a Saturday evening.

Wings. String beans... all you need. Check, please.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Sister to San Tung and less of a wait!  Thank goodness! The wait is the big reason that I don't go to San Tung often or even at all! 

Same delicious chicken wings glazed that you would have like next door and service is just as INattentive. I just go here for their wings.  Their other dishes, such as their black bean noodles and sizzling rice soup, suffices as good sides with the wings. 

It's inexpensive and they handle big groups, which is convenient.  Nice additional space to San Tung's limited room.
author: Tiffany D.

description: fyi they don't do takeout. and they don't answer the phone in case you were going to call to ask.  so i unfortunately drove 30 minutes out of my way to go out the random place across the street called chang's kitchen, which makes their own version of san tung wings.
author: jeff l.

description:
Difference between San Tung and San Tung 2 according to the workers: San Tung 2 has a smaller menu. From a customer viewpoint San Tung 2 is smaller, more modern decor, and intimate atmosphere. 

We got the shrimp and leek dumplings, original fried chicken wings, garlic spinach , and peanut noodles. So much food for two people! Had to take two containers home, but definitely worth it to try it all since we're from philly. Wings were crispy and flavorful, a good medium of both compared to other places I've been in philly where it's either really flavorful or just really crispy. Shrimp and leek dumplings were good, not sure if there's anything special about it except that they give you a lot, I think we had 10-12 pieces! (Thought we were going to be given like 6) Peanut noodles were good and the portion was so large, can't imagine eating that all by myself. Wish it came with more seafood though, nonetheless still good. Garlic spinach was standard, just ordered that to get some veggies in.

Service was standard, people were nice and they weren't busy at the time so they were attentive.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Not sure if a review is needed, but if you want good chicken wings, get here ASAP. This is a Sunset District staple & now that they have a 2nd location (next door) it makes it easier to get everyone's favorite chicken wings!
author: Melissa D.

description: My brother recommended this place while visiting SF. He said make sure you order the fried chicken and the green beans and you're set. Sure enough I had the most amazing friend chicken and seasoned green beans ever!!! Their service was average but their food most definitely makes up for it. I would expect some waiting getting to this location. However, the second location is next door. One location is more family style and that is the one I visited.
author: Ngoc N.

description:
The customer service we recieved tonight spoiled our whole experience. First of all, we ordered seaweed soup and we got seaFOOD soup. They did not remake our order because they said they  reconfirmed our order and that was fine. BUT THEN the waitress splashed the soup all over table when serving us, after we confirmed what kind of soup with her. Well, it could be a mistake or misheard our order, but that was fine, we did not even complained and just accepted it. There is nothing wrong to ask what kind of soup, she didn't have to splash our soup all over the table, then walked away without cleaning her mess. It looks like our bowls are floating in the pond. Then I have to asked the waiter to wipe off our table. Ummm.....the soup does cost us $21 instead of $17.  Don't just waste the customer's money on the table like that!!  We still have to pay for her mess.  That waitress is so RUDE. I understand the place is always busy and crowded, but don't take it out on a customer. 

Btw, the soup has so much MSG made me feel numb after.
author: Kaitlyn N.

description:
Of course I came here for the chicken wings!!!!  My boyfriend has never tried it and loved it so much that he wants to make a monthly trip to San Tung.  

We ordered the wings, eggplant, peanut noodles and spinach.  All were very good, but I probably would not order the eggplant again.  

The staff is very friendly and provided great service to us.  I will definitely come back... Monthly. :)
author: Rachel L.

description: Good luck with finding close parking. We choose to park at least 2 blocks away and walk because that is faster than circling for at least half an hour. There is always a line to get a table after 7pm. Right next door to the original San Tung, this location has a limited menu and is run by the son. The staff are always hustling trying their best to get you seated so don't expect them to be extremely attentive. If you need something raise your hand and make eye contact as the staff are always on the move. Make sure you know what you want to order as soon as you get seated because the sooner you put your order in the sooner they can start cooking your food.
