Our go to dishes are the dumplings (all of the flavors are good), black bean noodle, chicken wings, and green beans. We love eating here.
author: Jinnie L.

description: Would advise you not to go here if you are vegetarian or vegan. The waitress was rude dismissive and did not know which dishes were vegetarian. All tofu dishes have chicken stock so beware!
author: Chloe C.

description: The black bean noodle is really good... the dried fried chicken just ok since it 's too sweet for my taste. The ambience is bad ... too noisy and disorderly. And worst of all, the wait is too long , just not worth it. Way overrated IMO.
author: quang l.

description: I came here with a group of six on a Saturday afternoon because San Tung 1 had a ridiculously long line and we just weren't down for the wait. We were able to get a large table without having to wait and received our orders of fried chicken and string beans not long after ordering. To be honest, I really cannot tell the difference between the food here and the food next door. If you'd like to eat at San Tung 1 to be able to tell all your friends about how you waited in line for over an hour and got to try their super famous chicken wings then you can go do that. However, if you just want to be able to eat some delicious chicken, don't bother waiting and just go to San Tung 2. =]
author: Joshua M.

description:
It's like San Tung #1, but with less options.

Like, waaaaaaaay less options.

So much less that if you order takeout, they only allow you to get the dry fried chicken to go. 

Then I got food poisoning. 

Think I'll stick with waiting around for location #1.
author: Susy C.

description: shorter menu, shorter line.  didn't have dumplings that day but can still get the classic chicken wings.  more molasses like if you take out the red chili spice. string beans soy garlic and black bean noodle with shrimp and squid. still a good place
author: Rob C.

description:
I didn't know how the line waiting worked so I just signed myself up for San tung 2 since they had a board. Had the chicken wings since they were so well known. Also had the string beans.

Came here on a Thursday night around 8pm and the wait wasn't as long as I thought it was. I was able to be seated for a party of 7 in about 10-15 minutes. 

The chicken wings were obviously fantastic. Be careful eating them once they come out because they will burn you!! The chicken wings were sticky with the sweet sauce. Yet, they still maintained their crunchiness. They were just perfect. The string beans however were regular string beans and they weren't anything special. I would definitely come back here for the wings.
author: Eric Q.

description:
Pretty much the best wings I've ever had and the green beans are a close second 
If you're spending the afternoon in golden gate park I would highly recommend you wander over for dinner (it's only a five minute walk away)
author: Michael B.

description: After seeing the long wait for the original location,  my group decided to go next door. We were pleasantly surprised to find that there was no wait. We came for the wings and decided to try the original and the hot. I highly recommend getting the original as the hot is not the typical hot wing. It is covered in a sauce so you don't get that crispy goodness while eating the wing. The original is covered in a honey type sauce that needs to be bottled and sold as is. We also had the combo fried rice that was in all honesty, a bit of a letdown. If decide to bypass the lines, come in and get yo wing game on.
author: Lisa V.

description:
TIP: I know everyone loves eating out in groups but if you're going to come to a place like San Tung, go with one other homie if you want to be seated faster. We were about #10 in line and we were seated first before everyone else because a table for 2 opened up ! There ya go, there's your key to happiness.  

This place is nothing short of expectations. I seriously tell everyone to come here when they visit San Francisco for the chickeeennnn wanggggsssss. 

Dry Fried Chicken Wings = crack. I know every girl always try to be all cute and stuff when they're eating out with their friends but give me a plate of this and I'll seriously can and will out-eat all of the guys and can finish the whole plate on my own. So good@ 

Sauteed String Beans! This is the best pairing with the fried chicken in my opinion. You can never go wrong with this. I love the sauce that comes with it. 

The lines at San Tung 2 is definitely shorter than the line at San Tung 1. The food is practically the same but the menu is a bit more limited. Parking sucks in the Irving area, what else is new. I also noticed that the store closes at 9:30PM but they erased all of the names on the board around 8:30-8:45PM even when everyone wasn't seated? I'm not sure what happened but be sure to get here early and not right before closing time if you want to get seated!
author: Tram N.

description: In terms of dry fried items, we got the wings, beef and fish. I'd rank the beef as best, followed by wings then fish. Flavors are good but just a tad too sweet for me. Salt pepper wings are very good as well (tastes like salt pepper crab minus the scallion mixture). This was a lot of food for 4 persons so be ready for to go.
author: Mike N.

description: Excellent service, great portions, and good value.  While the menu is "smaller" than Tung 1, they have all of the great Americanized Chinese favorites.  Fell free to eat here instead of 1.
author: Michael K.

description:
San Tung #2 only serves the most popular dishes (when compared to the restaurant next door), and there is no crazy wait. :) San Tung #2 also does NOT serve desserts, since the owner of San Tung #2 did not want desserts on the menu. I think this place is family owned, since the wait staff told us that 1 brother manages San Tung and the other brother manages San Tung #2. 

The original dry chicken is THE BEST. It reminds me of Korean Bonchon Chicken in Los Angeles. :) Flavors are fabulous, would come here next time just for the chicken wings!

We also ordered black bean noodles (it comes with shrimp, etc.). The portion size of this noodle bowl is huge, and could feed at least 2-3 people. Flavors were decent, although mild.

Also ordered a plate of potstickers. These are not ordinary pot stickers, they are HUGE in size! Incredible...
author: Yonnie C.

description:
I thought we had arrived at San Tung early enough to avoid the wait but I was terribly wrong. I had skipped breakfast and was desperate for some chicken for lunch. Despite the signs that indicate that San Tung 2 has the exact same food as the original San Tung, it was still half empty. I was willing to wait it out but my tummy complained. San Tung 2 is more casual younger sibling of the original location. The menu is more limited and completely in English.

I ordered the House Special Dry Chicken. What can I say? It was addicting!
author: Yi Z.

description:
San Tung 2 is an extension of the original San Tung just next door. San Tung just has too much business so they had to open the second one! I've never been to the original location so I don't have much to say as to why the star ratings would differ when the two places serve the same food, etc. But I will say that my experience at San Tung 2 was perfectly enjoyable.

There's a bit of a wait (it's San Tung, after all), but get there early and you won't have to wait too long. Write your name and number of people in your group on the little whiteboard that's right next to the entrance. They seat by group size rather than going straight down the list (e.g., if a table of two clears up, they'll seat another group of 2).

The food is great. The chicken wings (I think it's called something something dry fried chicken wings on the menu) are amazing as always. It's similar to Korean style fried chicken wings where the skin isn't super crispy and the wings are covered in a sauce. I love how the wings are just slightly spicy. The skin is PERFECT - still crispy even when covered in the sticky sweet sauce. The meat is perfectly juicy and tender too. I'm from the 626 area and I can honestly say that I've never had chicken wings like this before. Oh yes, also, when you get the wings, be sure to eat them FAST, even though they're piping hot, because that's when they're the BEST and they're freshly made and if you wait, the sauce will caramelize and it won't be as good.

We didn't order too many other items on the menu as our focus was on the wings (3 plates = 3 dozen wings, yikes). We ordered the green beans, which I liked because they weren't super oily and the crunch is great. We also ordered a veggie + tofu dish which I recommend as well.

The main drawback is, I think, that there's only one restroom and the lines can get long. People need to wash their hands from the sticky chicken wing sauce!
author: Judith C.

description:
I had family in town who wanted Chinese for dinner, so I Yelp'ed and found this place. We originally planned to go to the original San Tung but they were on vacation so we opted for San Tung #2 which was next door. We arrived 30-40 mins before they opened at 5pm and there was a line slowly already beginning to form! By opening time, there was a long line down the block! 
The food here is DELICIOUS! Their famous chicken wings lived up to its hype. Other notable dishes were their chicken fried rice, honey walnut shrimp, and green string beans! Service was also quick and friendly. They accept credit card, which is pretty rare for a Chinese resturant. I will def be back!
author: Lynn T.

description:
We never actually got seated here so this review is purely for the attitude of the staff. We put our name on the list and after waiting for a long time, I went to check into and check found that my name was crossed off the list. 

Of course, it was probably due to the fact that they called and we didn't hear them. But instead of apologizing for the error, they took the attitude and said that I clearly wasn't paying attention. They could have easily just seated me without being accusatory. When I retorted that maybe they didn't call clearly, the lady I was talking to took objection to that and said that she wouldn't seat me.

Whether the food is good or not is one thing, but this type of attitude is not warranted.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I will wait for the original San Tung. I will wait! I will wait even if my name is 8th from the list. I will wait even if it takes 35 minutes. No way am I going next door... 

*2 mins later*

Family is hungry. We go next door. Whoops!

Yeah, so if you don't know there's a San Tung 2 right next door. There is usually no wait unless San Tung is over populated and it shifts over. But for a Tuesday night, it was half empty. Both San Tung offer the famous chicken wings and dumplings. However, San Tung 2 always runs out of dumplings and their menu is smaller. 

Here's a tip though, order your dumplings from next door as a to go order and they will deliver it to your table. That's boss right there. 

So here's the thing, although it's the exact same food, I still prefer #1. Let's take the chicken wings for example. It was way more sweeter and way more sauce. Secondly, the green beans were also similar in that it was sweet and had lots of sauce. It almost tasted as if they used the same sauce as the chicken wings. Perhaps I ordered the wrong kind because I'm so used to the garlic flavored ones. The green bean dish had so much sauce that it ended up being very "wet," which was a no-no. Lastly, the noodles were very soft and lumpy. You know, when noodles end up being in water for too long and start to sog. Of course it didn't get to that level yet, but as I ate the leftover noodles from that night the next morning, it totally sogged. 

I mean, #2 gives your fix but doesn't solve your root problems ya'know. You already drive out and put your mind in #1, so why not just wait for it. That's my 2 cents right there. 

No kimchee either.
18% gratuity charged for parties 5 or more.
Service was meh.
author: Fiona L.

description:
San Tung 1 was closed! D: What do we do?! Not to worry, San Tung 2 is open and right next door! Yayyyy!

Ambiance//
Even though we got here within 15 minutes of opening, we still had to wait 30 minutes for a table. This place has colored ceiling accent lights that change color. It is very narrow restaurant. There is only one unisex restroom and it is very busy. If you have to use it, prepare to wait! 

Fooooood//
Dried Fried Chicken Wings!
These took forever to come out. They are constantly frying these golden, sweet, and sticky wings. And everyone, I mean EVERYONE orders them. And you better order them, too! They were piping hot and definitely had a kick to them! The sauce was so flavorful, I poured it all over my rice! YummMM!

Black Bean Noodle
This was a huge bowl! Black bean flavor was delicious! It tasted just as good when I reheated it the day after!

String Beans
I recommend eating these fresh while it's hot! It does not taste as good reheated. I wish it had a little more garlic. Nothing magical. Standard stir fried string beans. I wish this had meat in it!

Tip
I recommend eating family style here! That way you can try everything!

Portions//
We ordered those three dishes and two bowls of rice! I took home the leftovers and I easily managed to make another two meals from the leftovers! Everything is so flavorful here, reheating is not a problem!

Service//
This place was extremely, extremely busy. I wish the service was a little faster and less curt, but that would be unreasonable considering how busy it was. I did appreciate that the waitresses bringing out food wore plastic gloves. 

Summary:
Family style
Long wait
Dry fried chicken wings!
author: Vivian C.

description:
San Tung #2 might be the offshoot location from the original San Tung, but it hits the spot all the same. I left here satisfied after eating my heart's content of greasy goodness, but that said I won't be knocking down the doors to come back anytime soon. The food just doesn't quite meet the hype. 

When you arrive here, you'll quickly realize that the original San Tung and its next door counterpart serve a pretty similiar menu -- so if you're hungry -- it really comes down to whichever place has the shorter wait. For us, this meant San Tung #2 was the move, and I actually ended up preferring it by the end, as it's basically a slightly less cramped, nicer looking version of the original, plus it has a much shorter wait. 

As I mentioned earlier, considering the absurd levels of hype San Tung generates, the food isn't quite as good as advertised, but that said my expectations were also pretty high. The food ain't bad, and it's always fun to fill your taste buds with fried food from a Chinese spot every once in a while. Just be careful not to order too much. Because of the wait, we saw lots of people asking for multiple orders of everything and it didn't end up well. You're going to fill up fast, and this isn't the type of food that keeps well for reheating. 

Onto the food:

DRY CHICKEN WINGS - This was the main draw, and I have to say I was a little disappointed. The wings are decent, but for them to be known for them practically around the city didn't make sense to me. I found myself enjoying the wings that were coated in sauce far more than the ones that weren't, so the sauce flavor is certainly good. But other than that, the wings just really didn't do much for me...there's just nothing really special about the chicken itself. Enjoyable, but certainly disappointing. 

BLACK BEAN NOODLES - A solid dish with a very unique flavor (still can't quite put my finger on it). Heavy, creamy, a little oily, but the end result is somehow pretty good. A word of caution though: there are a lot of different ingredients thrown into the bowl, including what seemed like potatoes and also some still-to-be-identified seafood. Good...but strange.

PORK FRIED RICE - A classic, but still highly suggested. The fried rice is an especially sound option if you order the black bean noodles, as they compliment each other well. But still, you don't come here for the rice, so a minor victory at best. 

OVERALL - I enjoyed my time here, as it's definitely an experience. If you want to try the famous San Tung chicken, definitely stop by and give it a shot. But at the same time, it's necessary to realize what this is...it's basically Chinese fast food in a restaurant setting...which is fine, but 5 star this is not.
author: Brian S.

description:
Personally, the chicken tastes the same to me whether you go to the original or here. The original is definitely more family oriented. The second one i feel is more for smaller parties. There's not as many items in San Tung 2, but the main items are what matter. Less of a wait here.

Dry Fried Chicken - So delicious. Crispy, sweet and so flavorful in your mouth. You can ask for it without the bone too which is pretty cool.

Dry Fried Mushrooms - I love mushrooms, and san tun 2 has them here. Not in the original. This is why I like number 2 better than the original. 

Warning: The parking to get here is ridiculous. Be prepared to walk or wait for a period of time
author: Serggio A.

description: We put our names down for both 1 and 2 , but we were able to get a table at 2. I have had the wings before but this time, it was too sweet. We also ordered the green beans, which also had the sweet sauce. The fried beef wasn't very good either. Not worth the wait.
author: Shu T.

description:
I'm guessing that the difference between the two San Tungs right next to each other would be that this one has a larger menu. But, to be honest, I am okay just sitting in San Tung #2 with just the chicken wings. This San Tung is more family style kind of seating with the turn tables in the middle and everything. 

GET THE CHICKEN WINGS AND THE BLACK BEAN NOODLES. YAAS. 

Service is very Chinese and quick paced!
author: Kim N.

description: To start off this review, I want to say that I was BEYOND ECSTATIC to finally try these wings that everyone keeps raving about. I came here on a Sunday evening and put in reservations for both this location and San Tung next door in hopes to eat faster LOL! This location called my group's name first. The location is pretty small, but decently clean. There were about 3 waiters staffed and they were pretty quick about getting things that we needed. So onto the wings! To be completely honest, the wings didn't WOW me. Not really sure if it was because I went to this spot rather than the original San Tung (but I heard they share a kitchen), the wings were too hyped, or I came on an off day. They were just okay. The peanut noodles were something different. The fried rice was decently good. All in all, I would come back if I was already in the area.
author: Joanne Y.

description:
Pure happiness. 

The staff here is awesome just like the chicken! I also love the sweet and sour soup. The wait can be long but then again it's shorter than the first spot next door.
author: Amy G.

description:
Go to order: 
dry fried chicken wings 
shrimp and leek dumplings
jangjangmyung
and stir fried green beans 

all of it is so good!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
FOOD IS BOMB! Customer service really sucks.
Ordered: 
- Original Dry Fried Wings: RECOMMEND you can never go wrong with these wings! I dislike sweet or Asian sauces on my chicken I usually like spicy buffalo, but I love this one!! 
- Deluxe Vegetables: I don't recommend this plate, unless you like really bland vegetables for 9 bucks. 
- Pork Fried Rice: not too oily, very good!
- Beef Chow Mein: on the oily side, but still very tasty

Food came out very fast! Maybe 5-8 minutes after we ordered

Customer service, the young Asian guy and lady are rude.
author: Chelsie O.

description:
Honestly, the wait for ST2 is so much more reasonable that it just becomes common sense to put your name down for this one instead of ST1, next door. I mean, they share the same kitchen. It is LITERALLY the same. We had about 10 people in front of us, several dropped out, and we were seated within 40 minutes. Pretty reasonable as the line next door was insane and at least 30 parties long. 

Ordered:
Dry fried chicken - I'm not sure why it has "dry" in the name, because in fact these wings are dripping with sweet, molasses-like, tangy, spicy, ginger-y GOODNESS. Crisp but not crunchy or overly fried, these wings are definitely worth the hype. 

Deluxe soup noodles - This dish on the other hand was disappointing. Wished that we had just ordered soup without the noodles. WAAAAY too much noodle, not enough soup. That and the noodles just soaked up all the soup. Anyway, not a lot of seafood, just a whole lot of noodle. Not really worth paying $10 for.

Garlic eggplant - Another pretty tasty dish.. Still not as flavorful as the wings, but better than the noodles. It's a really large portion with strips of eggplant and a pretty garlic heavy sauce. Good for bigger parties to share. Solid veggie option, but on the saucier and slightly heavier side.
author: Lauren S.

description: This place was delicious!!!!! My families favorite the chicken wings. I would highly recommend this place
author: Karen L.

description: The food here is good but the service I got from this waiter was horrible. I put my name down to get a table for two and then this other couple came in about 5 minutes afterwards. The guy waiter walks up to the other people to tell them a table is ready and he can seat them. So I informed him that I was here first. Also the couple did tell him that there was a party in front of them which was me. Then he rudely said to me " I'm not going to seat a party that only has one person. I'll seat a party that has both people. " I understand not seating til the whole party is here but he didn't even come up to me ask if my party was all here. The other person was outside. And then he told me to tell the other person of my party to hurry and get here to get seated.
author: Crystal A.

description: Per my experience there is much shorter wait time here than San Tung if you have a smaller party, not the exact same menu but all their famous and popular items are available and the same as San Tung.
author: Jessica Z.

description:
I was intended to try San Tung but the line was ridiculously long, so I went over here to San Tung 2 and was seated in less than 30 minutes. I ordered the dry chicken wings, black bean noodles, shrimp dumplings, and green beans. The dry chicken wings were actually delicious, full of flavors, and crispy. Though, I feel that I expected more from the many great reviews because they claimed it to be "crack wings". I've had the same at one Korean restaurant before, so it didn't blow me out of my chair when eating these dry wings. Black bean noodles were overrated because it was plain. Green beans were alright. The dumplings were good and I like it. 
My husband and I noticed there was a smell in their water, which grossed us out and we've decided not to drink it. Customer service was so-so. Are we going to drive back here all the way from east bay? Nah. I thought it was something more due to the long line, but I guess I don't feel the same way towards the food like others do.
author: Lynn T.

description:
12/21/14: I moved up here about 3/4yr ago, and I think this is the first Chinese restaurant in SF that I've tried that actually is on par with what you can get down in SoCal.  Pretty good, with perhaps some exceptional dishes.

We were told by the waiters that this restaurant is the same as its uber popular parent next door except for a smaller menu.  The other place had a swarm of people waiting and there was no wait here, so this is where we ended up.

1. Original Dry Fried Chicken Wings $10.50: Despite the name, these wings are not "dry"--they might have been deep fried but they're smothered in a sticky sweet and slightly hot honey-like sauce.  REALLY good.  So good that next to us sat a pair of Caucasian teenagers who only ordered this + rice!  This would be the 2nd best fried chicken wings I've had from a Chinese restaurant, and I've tried many dozens of versions of these.  BTW, there's a lot here, so the price ain't bad for what you get.  10/10.

2. Shrimp and Leek Dumplings $8: These are very well made.  Slightly fancy format--small and cute vs. the larger half moon shapes your mom would make at home.  The skin is tender and not too thick.  For some reason the filling wasn't as shrimp tasting as I thought it would be despite the menu listing only really 2 main fillings--the shrimp and leek.  Feels like there's some kind of filler in there like egg.  You can see in my pictures they're slightly yellowish inside, which isn't really the color of shrimp.  Well, anyway, they taste good no matter what they used inside.  Not the best, but good.  6/10.

3. Beef Soup Noodles $9.50: This one is odd.  We've all had the traditional dark and rich beef noodle soups with stewed beef and sometimes tendons inside.  Well, this is NOT that.  (See my picture!)  The soup is similar to traditional lamb soup--a thicker white soup with preserved cabbage and other stuff mixed in.  The beef is not stewed beef--it's the ultra tenderized type they use for stir fry.  The noodles are not remarkable--not the thick house-made types that the best places use.  I actually do like the soup, which is quite rich and flavorful, but I feel the beef is cheap tasting and it's just not how this type of noodle soup should be made.  5/10.

Service: well, the people are very nice and are Americanized so speak English fine.  But it's just totally impossible to get their attention.  I guess it's typical Chinese service for you.

The wings are a must get.  The rest is okay.

4/5.

#Chinese #wings #dumplings #beefnoodlesoup
author: Dean C.

description:
I LOVE SAN TUNG DRY FRIED CHICKEN! this is probably the best chicken I've ever had in my life! The chicken is super glazed with a garlic and sweet flavor. I definitely wish there was a close location to Vallejo because I seriously would come every week.

We came in on a Tuesday, around 2:25. They close from 3-5pm so I'm surprised they took us in. Luckily there was no line and we were seated right away. Before 3pm, they have a lunch special available for smaller and more affordable portions.

For a party of 4 and a toddler, we ordered 2 orders of shrimp fried rice, 3 orders of the amazing crispy and glazed fried chicken, 1 order of honey walnut prawns, and 1 order of the string bean. They serve you kimchee and tea with your meal. We ended up having extra chicken and string beans for leftovers.

The service was great. Food came out super fast and they continues to come around to refill our water glasses.

If you haven't tried dry fried chicken from san tung, you have NEVER tried chicken. =)
author: Frances V.

description:
I've noticed San Tung opened an extension of their original location. They advertise the same menu, but slightly limited. Everything we usually order is on their menu so we decided to give them a try. 

Thankfully, the chicken wings were the same saucy wings as the original. The peanut noodles we ordered came in a larger bowl than usual. That was a pleasant surprise. But our string beans were undercooked. They had almost that raw snap when you would bite into them and didn't have that nice caramelization on the outside. We debated for a long time whether to send them back and finally did. They came back and were improved, but still not sauteed to our usual liking. That was a bit of a downer. Not sure if that was just an anomaly because we've never had that problem before. Also I'm not sure if they share a kitchen with the original san tung or it is separate? One small thing I noticed was they do not serve kimchi as an appetizer like they do next door.

The service was pretty bad from beginning to end. For one they are understaffed, but I didn't like our server's attitude either. I hate it when they greet you at the door with a "what do you want?" face instead of asking me how many people in my party. At least at the original san tung the servers work quickly and efficiently even if they are not the friendliest. The servers here are disorganized and not friendly :[

All four stars dedicated to those beautiful chicken wings minus the wait time.
author: Danielle G.

description: Dried fried chicken and dried sautéed string beans. Staple of any paleo diet. Loved the sauce as it is boss. Chugged down of water to wash down the deliciousness. Definitely worth it as San Tung had a long line. I had no wait here.
author: Richard L.

description:
Smaller menu compared to the original place, but has everything you need with a shorter wait. I usually get their signature chicken wings, string beans, dumplings, and black bean noodles. They're known for their chicken wings and it's pretty darn delicious. Tender juicy chicken meat, crispy skin, topped with a sweet glaze with a hint of spiciness. I enjoy their other dishes as well, but hate waiting in line so I don't come here as often as I would like. Even with this express shop, you're still expected to wait at least half an hour to get seated. They only have a limited numbers of tables and it's pretty cramped. Parking can be a hassle in this area especially during dinner time. I haven't been here any other time so I'm not sure how the wait  is during the off peak hours. 
I do suggest going with a small group (4 max) that way you can get a variety of dishes, but wouldn't have to wait as long for a big table.
author: Renee Y.

description:
I accidentally walked into San Tung #2 trying to get to San Tung #1. How I managed to miss 1 door I will never know.

Have no fear though, San Tung #2 is every bit as good as #1. Even my hyper-critical-of-Asian-food parents gave their stamp of approval. They never do for the restaurants I choose. This is certainly a milestone in my life.

San Tung #2 is the hipper, more modern version of San Tung #1, although "hipper" might not be the appropriate term when taking into consideration the gaudy light effects. Doesn't matter though, you'll be too busy destroying your food to notice anyways.

Try the:
(+) Hot and sour soup.
Third best hot and sour soup I've encounter in my years. Unlike other places, San Tung does this soup right, perfectly balancing the sour with the hot. The only criticism I have for it is that it was a little light on the soy sauce and lacked that third flavor depth. Thankfully, there's soy sauce on the table. 

(+) Mung Bean Hand Pulled Noodles.
Usually I skip the price tag on the hand pulled noodles- most restaurants don't make it well enough to be worth my time or money anyways. This place though, has seemingly mastered the hand pulled noodle craft. The noodles here are deliciously chewy. You just have to try it to believe it.

(+) dumplings.
ALL OF THEM. I had the pork ones. Again, this place knows how to serve their carbs. A lot of places can make the meat and vegetables on the inside tasty. The real craft is making the skin that wraps it perfect. It can't be put into words, but once you try it, you'll know.

and of course, the dry fried chicken wings. Delicious. duh.
author: Patricia K.

description:
We ordered the dry fried chicken and the black bean noodles. I must say the dry fried chicken was delicious and flavorful but the black bean noodles were overall bland, lacking in flavor, and did not have any spice as suggested in the name. We ate a few bites of the noodles and unfortunately had to waste a lot of it because it was so plain. The reviews overhype these Black bean noodles and I have no idea why they think it is good because it is super bland and plain. 

Either way, 4-5 hours later after eating these two entrees, I am suffering from food poisoning and just threw up multiple times and stomach still hurts currently. Stay away from this restaurant because no food is good enough to be worth food poisoning! They have a very low health inspection score and the original San Tung straight up fails the health inspection as seen on Yelp. Don't ignore these red flags and heed these warnings! You do not want to be miserable and throwing up and diarrhea after dinner. This place is seriously not worth the hype and not worth putting your health at risk.
author: Nina V.

description:
I was told this place have a line and a wait, however, I was told this place was going to be good. I don't  care how long the wait is at any place. If the food is awesome, I'm down for patience.

Apparently I noticed that San Tung original, served more on their menu, but San Tung #2 was faster to get in and offered the same top items that has made them popular. When you enter the joint, there's a white board on the wall to add your name to. When they are ready, they'll call you and cross you off the list. The joint isn't that big. I'd say no more than 15 tables top. The decor is bright and colorful: orange walls and lighted ceiling panels. The staff is super efficient and the wait time once you order is non existent! We ordered our food and literally got it  within 10 minutes, NO JOKE. I was amazed! Here's what we got: 

-Combination fried rice for $9.00. This Chinese style fried rice included shrimp, calamari, chicken and beef. The flavor was savory and there were a lot of protein pieces throughout the rice. So much different flavors from the combination of proteins. 

-Family style been curd for $8.50. Fresh tofu tossed with mix veggies and bean thread in a spicy garlic sauce.This was a nice flavor as well. I got a bit of oyster sauce within the dish and the noodles brought a  soft element and worked will with the crunch cabbage. 

-Pork dumplings for $7.25. 12 pork dumplings filled with ground pork and napa cabbage, seasoned with ginger and garlic and boiled. These dumplings were ON POINT! The filling was seasoned perfectly. Create a soy sauce and vinegar and you've got the perfect bite!

-Original dry fried chicken (glazed) for $10.50. Chickeen wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roasted red peppers and a sweet glaze. This was THE BEST thing that night. The glaze brought a sweet and tangy element and I loved how the wings were still extra crispy, even with the glaze all over. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this position!

OMG, the food was awesome! I would wait outside in line for hours just for the wings. I don't care what neighborhood you're in. Take the N Muni, walk couple of blocks and check this place out! You will absolutely love the wings and the food!
author: Rockne H.

description:
Every time someone mentions let's go to San Tung's, my first thought goes from sheer delight on the thought of possibly eating their chicken wings, quickly followed by feelings of terror thinking about the long wait, wasting away slowly in their line hoping for just a taste. As of today, that view has officially changed as it looks like they've since gotten rid of their next door boba & gelato shop & have turned it into a full blown dining room to serve as overflow. FANTASTIC.

Key takeaway when comparing original San Tung & this next door location, there's less of a wait & the same don't give a shit service attitude. I couldn't ask for more. They've always shared the same kitchen even when the gelato shop was in place, but the table turnover was way slower before going full blown San Tung #2.

Chicken wings & more chicken wings. Our table of eight easily destroyed four plates of chicken wings & wanted more. Everything else on the menu comes second. Black bean noodles are good & the dumplings are QQ, but you can easily order that at another comparable restaurant. Northern Chinese-Korean cuisine can indeed be found elsewhere in the Bay.
author: Steven C.

description:
What do you do when you're #45 on the club-long guest list for San Tung during dinner time? Hop right next door to San Tung #2 - restaurants share the same kitchen and owner, menu is just scaled down to limited options (no kimchee or lunch specials).

But who cares, because all you really come for at San Tung are the dry fried chicken wings right!? And of course they serve them here as well. They came out pretty fast and tasted just as good as it would've next door. It was smothered with generous amount of sauce, kick of spiciness, hot, fresh and had the perfect crunch into each bite. Mmmm

We were also able to order hot and sour soup, the small order was perfect to split between two people. The honey walnut prawns were the last thing we ordered and probably my least favorite out of the 3 because it was way too battered. The first two prawns that I ate were pretty good but after that I was kinda over it because it tasted like I was biting into a ball of fried nothing then by the time I'd get to the actual prawn, it was just plain and tasteless. Not sure if it was their fryer, or oil or lower quality from what I'd usually order next door.

By the time we were done with our meal, I figured we'd probably still be waiting for a table next door. I'd definitely come back to beat the line just for the wings but maybe even order for to-go. The service was pretty bad. I felt almost as if the waiters were scared or avoiding our tables purposely unless they had something to bring over, no checking in to see if we needed anything else or glasses of water until we asked.

If there wasn't such a long line next door, I'd pass on the #2.
author: Georgina G.

description:
I found this place from a list on SFist denoting the best places for noodles in SF and Oakland, and being a big noodle fan (they are my favorite food, after all), I had to check it out to see if it lived up to the hype.  As a heads up.I haven't been to the original ST next door so I can't speak for how ST2 compares.  The original had a wait at around 2PM on a Sunday.  I was just done with a long run in the park, so not wanting to wait, I decided to dive next door to this sister branch instead, which had a couple of empty tables.  

Location is hard to find parking in.  I happened to be in the park so I simply walked over here without moving my car from Irving and 5th since it already took over half an hour to find that parking spot.  But that's expected for anything within a few blocks of the park.  

The store itself is slightly smaller than the original, and while not grimy, it ain't clean either (I saw a pile of spilled noodles on the carpet of the table next to me, and there they stayed through the next patron's meal.  Hot.).  

We ordered 2 noodle dishes, black bean sauce noodle and peanut sauce noodle.  Both servings were fairly large so we took leftovers home from both dishes (add more noodles at home and voila, 2 more meals).  However, I thought they were both a little pricey -- a little under 10 (maybe 9.25?) for each dish.  The noodles themselves were good but didn't blow my mind, I've had better in Chinese places in the Bay Area burbs.

Black bean sauce noodle -- good in general.  Very saucy, if you are into Korean jjajang sauce.  The sauce had thin sliced beef, the typical zucchini chunks, onion and (surprise!) calamari.  Maybe I wasn't hugely impressed since I do know how to make this stuff myself at home but was hoping that this place could do it better.  

Peanut sauce noodle -- again, very saucy, and rich and spicy.  This one's a heavy dish.  I enjoyed the peanutty-ness and creamy texture of the sauce.  However, I wasn't a big fan of the seafood flavor (there was shrimp and scallop in it, in addition to water chestnut) which stood in odd contrast with the peanut theme.  Don't get me wrong, I love seafood and in particular shrimp and scallop.  Just maybe not necessarily with peanut sauce, which didn't cover the fishiness of seafood as well as other aromatics normally would.  

Overall, it was a fun little lunch in the city at a place that has gotten a lot of hype and coverage, but the food was somewhat underwhelming or not put together as well as I expected.
author: Anita T.

description:
YES, THEY HAVE THE SAME DRY FRIED CHICKEN WINGS AS NEXT DOOR. 

My friends and I planned to eat at the original San Tung, but the wait was 30 minutes long. It was clear from the crowd waiting outside that we wouldn't be seated for a while, so we ventured to San Tung #2 just next door. There were plenty of open tables and we were seated right away. Everything we planned to order next door was on their menu, including the dry fried chicken wings, black bean sauce noodles, and the shrimp and leek dumplings. The waitress was attentive and kept our water cups filled. The restaurant is smaller than the original San Tung, but seating wasn't too tight. And the bathroom was clean, thank goodness!

I would recommend to tell your friends, but keep this one on the low so we can keep the wait short lol.
author: Camille B.

description:
Very good Chinese food!  Right next door to the sister restaurant.  Same recipes for the most part, just no Kimchi served here.  If you wish that, you have to go next door.  

The green beans were like a sweet and savory dessert.  The wings were also very good but they are not dry, they are wet and sticky,  The Broccoli Beef with extra veggies were done to perfection and we had one Vegetarian dish that had a garlic based sauce that was to die for!  

The Egg fried rice with mushrooms were great to mix with all.  All served fast and at a reasonable price.  You need to get there when they open or you will wait a minimum of 30 minutes.  I would go again!  Not five stars as the place is small and a very busy ambiance around it, however I would still go for the food!
author: Larry H.

description:
The only thing worth ordering from here is the dry fried chicken. They were crispy, flavorful, and a bit on the sweet side. 

The black bean noodles were not good, and the seafood soup noodles had a bitter after taste. There were more more noodles than soup, which was disappointing. 

The Mongolian beef and fried rich dishes were OK. 

The wait was about 15 min on a Thursday night.
author: Quan T.

description:
Just like the rest of Yelp, I was planning to go to the original San Tung right next door but I saw several people waiting and I saw no wait at #2 so we went in. I don't care for the kimchee and it was dinner time (no lunch specials or kimchee at #2 by the way) so it was fine. Didn't need anything special off the menu and everything popular / what we usually order was on this menu. It's pretty much the same, without a wait! And I love being able to be seated right when you walk in.

We ordered the pork dumplings, broccoli beef and the original dry fried chicken wings. It came out fairly fast. Dumplings came out first.. Then the broccoli beef and wings. Everything was the same size portion and tasted the same as next door.

I couldn't help but giggle a little Every time I saw a group of people walk by wondering what the place was or that sign of no kimchee really turned them away from coming in. Oh well, better for me!
author: Tiff C.

description:
San Tung #2 is the old 'Next Door Sweets' that used to offer boba and gelato...but more importantly...was the secret shortcut to San Tung chicken wings. I'm pretty sure they closed down because the wings were more popular than their actual dessert options. 

San Tung #2 is basically the same thing as the original Sun Tung next door. Same owner, same wings you all know and love, and pretty much the same menu (no lunch specials though). San Tung #2 has more of a cafe feel and is a bit smaller with only one banquet table, but they still fit a substantial amount of people. There were probably around 15 well-spaced tables in the restaurant. 

THE ORDER: 

1) DRY FRIED CHICKEN WINGS: Crisp, sweet, hot, and divine as usual. A mandatory order. Period. 

2) SPICY BLACK BEAN NOODLES: Saucy, spicy, great noodle texture, and a good amount of pork and veggies mixed in. 

3) SAUTÉED STRING BEANS: Perhaps slightly overcooked as they were a bit wrinkly and soft, but great flavor with a nice sweet sauce. A great vegetable option if you don't like them veggies! 

Eating at the original San Tung can be stressful; long waits, no-nonsense service, cramped tables, a loud atmosphere, and the general feeling of a rushed dining experience. No one cares though because everyone is really here for the food - or rather just the wings. San Tung #2 however, provided a much more pleasant atmosphere. The service was much better; our waters and cups of tea were refilled multiple times and the bill wasn't thrown in our face before we were finished eating. The decor has a cutesy, modern flare and they have new bowls and plates (which is probably because they just opened), and hefty tea mugs. Everything felt cleaner and was a nice change of pace from the usual chipped tea cups and weathered dinnerware of the original San Tung. 

Which restaurant is better: Original San Tung or San Tung #2? It doesn't matter. They're practically twins and #2 is just an extension. They might as well knock the walls down. The food, at least from what I ordered, tasted similar if not the same. Whichever has the shorter wait time, go for it. If you want better service, perhaps San Tung #2 though.

Came here on Friday at 6pm and there was no wait, but I'm sure that will change as more people discover their grand opening. One of the reasons I don't eat at San Tung very often is I don't want to wait over an hour for a table, but now the wait times will be divided amongst the two restaurants. The crazy lines will be diffused and it will encourage more business as patrons will not have to wait in the cold as long. It's a win-win situation! Excited about the new, or rather revised addition to the block. I'll be back soon!
author: Deanna Y.

description: The chicken here is DELICIOUS and I absolutely love it and the sauce. I came here with my friends and we shared 2 plates and it was perfect. The only downside is that my friend tried to order something else in the menu and our waitress gave us a dirty look. I'm sorry Miss, we are ordering our own food not something you have to eat so please don't judge us on our decision to order an additional plate. My friends and I ended up not order that additional plate because she was being judgmental
author: Claire P.

description:
This location is better than the original which is right next door in terms of service. It's less crowded and the wait staff actually WANTS to refill your water glass! 

Same chicken, same owner, same recipe - no brainer.
author: Briget P.

description:
The wait here is always ridiculously long, but somehow that doesn't stop me from coming here. Parking in this neighborhood is hard to come by but nothing seems to deter people from waiting here for their wings. 

Every time I come here, the wait is always over an hour long and when you finally get your food, you're already starving and can't wait any longer. 

This time my party had to share a table with another and we almost ordered the exact same dishes. My party ordered two plates of chicken wings and it's nice how the waiter gave us one plate at a time so that others would have a chance. It was funny cause when we got our second plate of chicken the party sharing a table with us thought it was theirs. The sweet and sour fish and sautéed string beans was a nice addition to the chicken wings so that we weren't just eating meat. 

Waiters are attentive and they're willing to get you what you need even though it isn't their table.
author: Maybo L.

description:
We all come to San Tung's for 1 reason: DEM WANGZZZ.

But sometimes, the line is just ridiculously long. Solution? Go next door! Yes, you can't get the full menu, but they have the same delicious wings!

Service is friendly and pretty quick, I actually enjoy it more than next door.

I've tried some of their other dishes...ehh..they're just ok. The peanut sauce noodles were actually quite bland. My friends thought the beef noodle soup was just okay. 

BUT THE WINGS. Yep, it's crack.
author: Noelle H.

description:
After hearing everyone talk about this Chinese restaurant in Norcal, it was time for the hype buster to see if the restaurant was really good or just a bunch of hype. San Tung is a Chinese restaurant located in San Francisco, and supposedly has legitimate Chinese food. 

After my friends picked me up at SFO, we proceeded to go to San Tung. Street parking might be hard to find, so you may have to circle the block a few times. Even at around 8:00 P.M, the original San Tung had a wait, so we went to the one a few stores down, San Tung 2. After comparing menus we figured that it should be the same food. 

San Tung 2 only had young Asian patrons in it, which already set off a red flag. The more older generation Chinese people at a Chinese restaurant the more legitimate it should be!! Anyways, we were sat immediately at a round table and ordered the chicken wings (not shown) that everyone raves about, along with other things. 
First of all, I want to say the chicken wings are way over hype. It was decent, but the sauce and the way the chicken was cooked did not exceed any type of standard. I'd rather spend my approximately 10 dollars at buffalo wild wings. 

The best thing we ordered was probably the fried rice, and that wasn't amazingly good either. The other two things were ordered were the Mu Shu Pork and Dried Sautéed String Beans. I did not like the Mu Shu pork at all, and the string beans were a bit too over cooked. 

Maybe I am being too harsh, but if everyone is going to hype up a restaurant it better live up to standards in my opinion. On the bright side however the ladies who work there were wearing leggings.
author: Koty W.

description: This review is for a while ago because for some reason I can't find San Tung 2 on Yelp until now. The seafood in the black bean sauce noodle was spoiled, it smelled like ammonia. When I informed the waiter about it he didn't do anything and walked away. Yet, I still pay the full price.
author: Tim C.

description:
Sang Tung #2, Sang Tung (#1), I don't really know the difference since I haven't been to the "original" store. But, the food at #2 is delicious! Kristen T. has been raving about the chicken here for such a long time, we finally made it out here together with her cousins- and I am so glad I did! Dishes are fairly prices ($8-12 dishes) and I thought the portion was pretty big. We ordered the dry fried chicken pieces, and the sautéed string beans. The chicken was deliiiicciiioooussss. As they were cooking it, the whole restaurant smelled so good... yum! The string beans were very flavorful and no overcooked either. I enjoyed both dishes very much! I have intentions of bringing my husband back sometime because he really enjoyed the left over chicken I brought home. He can only imagine how good it'll taste fresh! 

Only downside, there was a sign that said they don't have kimchi in this store and you have to wait next door if you want kimchi. Kristen's BF said the kimchi was good, but obviously we didn't get to try it. Oh well. Next time!
author: Louisa T.

description:
It's sad that "really good" Asian food in NorCal is considered the minimum standard for SoCal. San Tung and San Tung 2 would both be considered average in Socal, but since NorCal Asian food is so bland, it somehow warrants long lines of customers jostling for a taste of dry fried chicken wings.

San Tung 2 typically has a shorter wait than San Tung because it does not serve the whole menu. It only has the popular items available.

Their dry fried chicken wings are extremely popular, and usually what I come here for. Everything else on the menu is sub par. 

Their black bean noodles are good, but they do not use fresh seafood. I had a stomachache from eating the seafood...so eater beware. 

Their dry fried beans taste like any typical beans you can get from a Chinese restaurant.

Chicken wings and two mediocre dishes equate to $40...which is ridiculous because Chinese food should be cheap.
author: Mina K.

description:
BEST WINGS EVER!! 

Definitely order the dry fried chicken wings and the three deluxe spicy noodles!! You won't be disappointed! Believe the hype because the wings are worth every penny and I have to go when I bring new friends to SF.

I would have given four stars, but had to minus one star for things being thrown across the restaurant, with small food scraps landing on our table and sweater sleeve....
author: C H.

description:
I have to give this establishment 1 star this time. Despite it's 'tasty' chicken wings, we drove to eat this only to see that SAN TUNG 2 was closed on a Saturday night. SATURDAY night. REALLY?!??!

How lazy can the employees be?

Also when we were in the neighborhood looking for parking spots (PS-its' very hard to find a spot here - good luck, youre in SF), I called them to see how long the wait was.

Guy on the phone was SUPER RUDE...self righteous, just arrogant. 
This is how it went:

Him: San tung.
Me: Hi... How long is the wait?
Him: ....For what?
Me: For the Dine-in Option.
Him: Uhh...40 minutes.
Me: OK then. How about for the take out?
Him: 1 hour and 30 minutes.

*HANGS UP THE PHONE ON ME*.


....really?


We ended up finding a really good parking spot anyway so we walked into the restaurant to scope out the situation. Because SAN TUNG 2 was closed next door, the line was double. it was NOT 40 minutes for dine in.. more like 2 hours. We put our name up..and then 10 mins into it, we were looking and found that someone in the crowd had erased a chunk of names (about 10 ppl) on the list on their white board....wha????? That was our last straw. We left.

No bueno:

1. Why are you using white boards instead of paper? People can easily just erase other peoples' names...
2. That was THEIR wrong for not opening up the shop next door, selfish to its patrons where everybody has to wait double the time .

We drove about 6 hours from LA to SF so we were expecting more from them. This can't be a one-way relationship. BLAH.
author: Summer S.

description:
Hmmm I ate at Sam Tung 1 last time but this time around there was a congregation of people outside of it. You know what that means- a long wait and this girl was hangry. 

What's the difference? I must have heard a person come in every 5 minutes to ask the same question. The wait staff didn't have a great answer. "We're smaller." "We are out of dumplings." "We are better? Eat here."

It's the same restaurant, and all I wanted was the fried chicken so guess what, I skipped all the lines and got sat right away. Suckaaaas at Sam Tung 1 following the sheep. I got fried chicken in 7 minutes flat and it was absolutely delicious. The stickiness, sweet and crispy combination is everything I remember it to be. Awesome no frills Chinese food. Dont mind the service, it's a Chinese restaurant, you can't expect much.
author: Kim P.

description:
Haphazardly came across the new location as we wanted to go to the original location. On a whim decided to be adventurous and try the new location.

I haven't been to San Tung in forever so can't exactly give a solid comparison. Overall, I found the wings too heavily sauced, not spicy enough and too sweet! The green beans were also too sweet as well. The chow mein noodles were soggy and not pan-fried enough.

I wasn't impressed and won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Angela D.

description: Decided to come here since the line was shorter than store #1. Big mistake! The food isn't as tasty here even if it's just the fried chicken. Lesson learned. No matter how long the line is, stick with store #1!
author: kevin c.

description:
Just get the original ooey gooey crispy juicy fried chicken ($11.50), the string beans and dumplings. Dinner for two under $35, sold!

Quick friendly service, albeit long waits to be seated. Still quicker than San Tung #1 next door though. If you haven't gone, it's definitely worth the visit.
author: Angela L.

description: The dry fried chicken was amazing!  Definitely the highlight.  Other very good dishes included the mushu pork and garlic ginger string beans.  We got there at about 5:05 and the main restaurant was already full with a pretty long wait list so we went right next door to San Tung 2.  Will be back.
author: Leila ..

description: The original dry fried chicken was one of the best that I have eaten! They had excellent service, much less of a wait compared to San Tung 1, and good quality food. I came here with my friends a week ago and ordered original dry fried chicken and string bean chicken. The original dry fried chicken was fucking delicious. However, after we finished eating. I received food poison from their string bean chicken! It's been a week and I am still recovering from it. They had excellent service and good quality food, but because I got food poisoning from their shit string bean chicken, my rating remains 2 stars.
author: Andrew N.

description:
My family and I decided to go to San Tung for an early birthday celebration. The original San Tung was very crowded with a long wait list so we decided to head over to San Tung #2, which had a much shorter wait list. I've heard the food is the same so we thought this would be the best choice.

I was a little frustrated because there were tables available but they weren't seating customers. I think this was due to the shortage in workers. There were two servers who were busy trying to get dishes out to the tables. They barely had time to clean the vacant tables.

The food was pretty good. We ordered the dry fried chicken wings which was as amazing as the original San Tung. It's a little bit sweet and spicy, and just perfect in flavor. It has a hint of garlic and ginger and lots of red pepper. We ordered the chicken fried rice, which was cooked with eggs, peas and carrots, was also good. It had the perfect amount of flavor.

The eggplant dish was a little too salty for my taste. I felt that it was drenched in its spicy garlic sauce and overwhelmed the dish. I barely tasted the garlic, and it was just salty. The eggplant was sliced in huge pieces so it tasted undecooked. The green bean dish, which came with Chinese pickles and a garlicky sauce, was very good. I felt that there was a balance of flavors that worked out.

I think the food in general is of similar quality as San Tung, but the service is lacking due to the shortage of workers. I recommend ordering the food to go. You'll be able to get the food that you want without the long wait to be seated.
author: Andrea G.

description: We got to this restaurant at 8:15pm only to be told that we wouldn't be seated because they were closed. Both Yelp and Google shows that they close at 9:30pm. The waitress was very rude and abrupt about the whole situation. We drove 45min to try this restaurant. We will not be back. Literally throwing money away by not seating customers over an hour before they close.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I applaud the two waitress that is holding down the whole restaurant on this Monday night! 

But the food is awesome like always.
author: Vincent Y.

description: We were waiting in line and politely asked if they had called our name because we thought we had heard it. One would expect either an "oh yes..." or "no, sorry not yet." The girl responded in such an unnecessarily mean, b*tchy tone, "if your name is still on the board then I didn't call it" and stormed off. Um... ok, I get it. You totally hate your life. That's cool, but you shouldn't be working in service. The girl next to her looked at me apologetically. We left and went next store.
author: Natalise K.

description: I come here once a month. Less wait than San Tung #1. It's a more casual vibe. Food is just as good although a more limited menu. The staff that run this is great too.
author: Joe Z.

description:
My friends and I are documenting the differences between San Tung and San Tung #2 as we are eating their delicious diced and whole chicken wings.

San Tung #2 has...
1) Shorter wait
2) Blue Moon beer & sake
3) Dry fried mushrooms 
4) No kimchee
5) Lots of bros (heyyy single ladies!) 
6) Large water glasses
7) No hot tea (that we can see)
8) Carpet
9) Colorful walls and ceilings
10) Crooked SF skyline decal
11) Friendlier and younger staff
12) TV
13) Smaller menu 
14) Cleaner bathroom 
15) Sriracha but no chili 
16) Tsingtao gong!
author: Heidi C.

description:
It was like San Tung (#1) except there was a sense of overall composure. The interior is modern and clean and the noise level is significantly lower. So you don't get that chaotic Chinese restaurant experience, but the wait is shorter here. Menu items are more limited here, but it didn't make a difference for us. 

Ordered the dried fried chicken wings, sizzling rice soup and chicken chow mein. All excellent and quality is no different from the original. But somehow, I feel the authenticity of the place gets lost here - hence the 4-star.
author: Suji C.

description:
I was wondering why this location has less stars than the original location right next door and now I know why - they are understaffed & lacking customer service!! 

Busy night as usual and there's only 2 waitresses!! Their service wasn't so great either. I know it's busy and all but at least have some proper waiting service. One thing that really annoyed me was that our dish came out before we got our waters and tea. AND when I asked if we can get our beverages, the waitress said ok but proceeded to do other duties such as bussing a table, bringing other dishes to other tables, and taking orders before bringing our waters. Like cmon, how hard is it to just get some glasses filled and bring it to the table? It only takes less than a minute. Also, we literally had to flag them down if we wanted something or go to the front table where the register is at. They never came to check back on us or anything. Like I said, I know it's busy, but you should still have some great service and be nice. When we said thank you to them, they don't respond. We didn't even get a check from them, we just went to the front and asked to pay. 

The food on the other hand tasted good as usual. I got to try a couple of dishes that I haven't ordered from there before.
 
Original dry fried chicken - nice, crispy and full of flavor as usual. 

Mu shu & seafood fried rice - first time trying these 2 dishes here and it average/mediocre. 

String green beans - I usually don't really care for green beans, but this right here is a must try. It's good & crunchy. 

Only reason why I would come back is if there's a huuuuge wait at the original location.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Came here with my buddy. Correction: First we went to put our name down next door at San Tung as soon as they opened for dinner, but then one of the guys that works there was like naw son don't wait 45 minutes here, just go next door. So, that's how we ended up sitting down.

We had a waiter in basically like a second, and went ahead and ordered the chicken wings and string beans. The food came to our table in like 10-15 min. The wings are legit. Heard a bunch about how the wings at San Tung are legit, and I agree that they are bomb. A bit spicy, but damn so good. The crunch on them is on point, and the spice was just right. 12 is def. the perfect amount for 2 hungry people. The string beans were meh. It's a huge plate of beans for 2 people, and then flavor on them was just alright. I wasn't like damn these are the best string beans ever. In fact, I only ate a couple. The wings though - again, legit.

I'd say if you're coming out to San Tung just for wings (which is basically the only thing you should be ordering now that I've tried them) then don't hesitate to just come to this place next door. You'll be in and out much faster then if you try to bother sitting at ST1, espesh if you have a group larger than like 2-3 people.

Lastly, the bathroom at this place is a step up from ST1. I'll definitely come back here for more wings in the future.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the wings are still just as good, however, the atmosphere could use some tweaking as could the service. 

Pro's:
Awesome wings
Awesome wings
REALLY good wings

Con's:

Smaller space
smaller menu
Sign in sheet confusing
author: Petra S.

description: All I got say is chicken wings. The original dried chicken is a must. We ordered shrimp fried rice and the tripled deluxe spice noodles as well.
author: Zach S.

description:
The same as neighboring and highly rated San Tung Chinese Restaurant, its neighboring venue is a huge hit on flavor and taste at such a reasonable price! 
Order the flower soup (a small for 3 people!) then the green beans, chow mein, three different chicken wings, and your alcoholic drink of choice to wash everything down. You'll be stuffed to the brim.
author: Regina D.

description: Slightly less good than the original next door, and no free kimchi to snack on, but still delicious. You can't go wrong with the dry fried chicken wings, some dumplings, and black bean sauce noodles!
author: Kazu O.

description: This place used to be a dessert place that had the san tung menu, but closed down and recently reopened as San Tung #2. Best wings in sf hands down. Smaller menu than san tung #1 but usually a shorter wait. Black bean noodles, string beans are also good.  I always try to drop by when I'm in town.  Only one credit card per table so come prepared. We came here after we realized the ramen festival was a bust. We had a party of 5 and waited about 25 minutes.. which isn't too bad. Once we sat down and ordered the food came out in about 10 minutes.
author: Milton F.

description: It's San Tung without the crazy wait and without the fuss. I have been to San Tung's original location and their 2nd restaurant is exactly the same. I think the service here is much better too! This use to be a dessert place that served the San Tung menu but finally, they are the real deal. My friends and I had ordered a number of dishes. We ordered their famous dry fried chicken wings, the dry fried string beans, the seaweed soup, the mu shu pork wraps, and a pot of steamed rice. Everything was perfectly sauced, perfectly cooked and nothing was too greasy or lacking in flavor. Everything tasted like how San Tung should be. The sauce on the string beans is like crack. It has a great sweetness to it and I love pouring it all over my rice to eat alongside many of San Tung #2's dishes. Avoid the long lines and the stress and go next door and you'll have a great meal.
author: Danster L.

description:
We arrived for an early dinner on a Monday only to find a long wait list for both locations.  So, after reading multiple reviews about the two locations having the same chicken wings (but #2 has fewer menu items), we cleverly put our name on both lists.

About 20 minutes into waiting, ST#1 announced that they were out of chicken wings.  We then hopped over to #2, and, seeing that we were pretty close to being called, we asked them if they still had wings.  Yes, they said, but #1 had just come over to their kitchen to ask for some wings.  Ohhh no you don't - we haven't been waiting over 30 minutes just to have #1 jack all the wings!

The waitress asked us where we were on the wait list, and when we said we were next, she told us that yes, there would be enough for us.

Unfortunately, the whole experience was pretty much a let-down.

I didn't love San Tung's chicken wings.

SORRY AMERICA, I LET YOU DOWN.

Not a fan of the sauce flavor, not a fan of the hard-to-crunch-through skin, and definitely not a fan of the wait.

Not a fan of the green beans - too much ginger.

Black bean noodles were ok, until I tried to reheat them at work the next day and then it started getting funky (especially since there is seafood).  So, if you get these, definitely try to finish them all at the restaurant, because these don't keep well.

HOWEVER.. I am a fan of the shrimp and chive dumplings.  They're plump and juicy and have great flavor.  The pork dumplings were just okay, but seriously I could eat two orders of the shrimp ones by myself.

Is ST (or ST#2) worth the wait?  IMO, no.  I'd be willing to give their other items a try (along with the shrimp & chive dumplings), but only if there is zero line.
author: Tori S.

description: Just called 5 times to place an order for pick up, but they hung up on me each time. Wtf? If you're too busy to take a to go order on Father's Day, then just say so. Stop hanging up on your customers. Apparently now that they have two locations, it's beneath them to have good customer service. I'm done with this place.
author: Tiffany C.

description: We came here for their wings.  It's covered in some sweet and spicy sauce.  The wings did not get soggy from the sauce.  It's nice and decent size.  I also ordered hot & sour soup.  It's also pretty good.
author: Alice T.

description: The original San Tung was crazy busy, and this one was surprisingly empty. We decided to go for it, I mean, it was right next door, and thank goodness we did. We were able to order the same famous fried chicken: mostly sweet, a little bit spicy, and yet still so crispy with all that sauce. I don't know how they manage it, but it lives up to the hype. We also ordered the black bean noodles and large sauteed pea sprouts with lots of garlic. Both very delicious as well. The price was good, the service was okay (they never came back to check on us after the food was delivered), but the no wait was the best!
author: Veronica C.

description: The peanut noodle sauce pasta was very bland and didn't taste very good. The chicken wings are okay, was expecting more but was quite disappointed.
author: Danielle P.

description: Like what everyone says, the dry fried chicken is completely addicting. We had one portion there and one to go. We ate more the day after and the quality kept really well. We put the left over chicken in a toaster oven.
author: To N.

description: The wait for San Tung and San Tung 2 are long, but so worth it. Our group had to split up just to get seated earlier, but it wasn't a huge deal. The chicken was flame, the black bean noodles were amazing. Everything even the vegetarian dishes were great. Definitely would recommend this to anyone from out of town.
author: Devin M.

description:
Thank God this place opened. Lessens up the wait, and I came in at 7pm with one other friend on a Tuesday and there was no wait!

Dried fried chicken wings = crack. I've been to several chicken wing places and this place still reigns over all. Great sized, crispy, that delicious sweet glaze... and you get 12 pieces for just $10.00!

The black bean noodles are also a honorable mention. They got your other chinese food fixes (chow mein, fried rice, broccoli beef, etc.) if you're interested.
author: Cris-ann L.

description:
I finally got to check this place out with my wife and her cousin recently.  

We ordered their wings, noodles with black bean sauce and some dumplings.

Dumplings were alright, same as you would get at any asian restaurant.

Noodles were ok, nothing special about the flavors.

The wings, I was bit disappointed.  I actually prefer the spicy and crunchiness of the wings from Bon Chon over this place.   

All in all, I wouldn't mind going again and giving them another chance, but if I have to wait in that hour long line, probably not.
author: Will C.

description:
We came intending to go to San Tung for the famous dry fried chicken wings and ended up coming to San Tung #2 since there was a line at San Tung and #2 was basically completely empty.  

The dry fried chicken wings were really good.  An order comes with 12 pieces and the wings are meaty, not small little things.  Definitely enough to share.  The wings are super crispy even though they're coated in a sweet and sour sauce that has a little bit of a spicy kick, and the weird/magical thing about them was that even though they sat for a bit as we worked through them, even the ones sitting in the most amount of sauce NEVER got soggy.  The wings are definitely worth coming to try and they are very tasty, but they don't really change your life like everyone says.

We also ordered the black bean noodles, which were just okay.  I would probably skip this item.  The noodles came drenched in sauce.  The sauce was pretty creamy for black bean noodles, but didn't have must depth of flavor.  The good thing about the noodles was that they came with pork as well as some seafood mixed in. 

Service was good.  The server came by and refilled our water often and were quick to ask if we needed anything, and also in bringing out the food and more napkins when we asked.
author: Ruby Y.

description:
I was warned this place wasn't good. Forever noted.

Rude waitress with an attitude and fake dual personality. May I add that I'm not the only one complaining about their service? the availability of the seating in there are half empty--that should tell you something. Also food is either salty, too sweet, or just a bit plain.

Just turn around and just wait in line for San tung #1 instead.

btw, they include 18% gratuity for more than 5 people for shitty service. This place is nothing but a few light shows on the ceiling. go bring your money to something better than this nasty place.
author: ABC Z.

description:
Had to wait about an hour for a party of 6 on a Sunday. The place was buzzing & people were happily waiting just to get in. Dramatic irony that there was another chinese restaurant right across & nobody went there.

The dry chicken (wing & boneless) both were outstanding & worth the wait. Everything else like Mongolian Beef, Noodles & Fried Rice were all above average. Good but not outstanding.
author: Saddle U.

description: I have been a loyal customer for over two years and this has quickly changed. Over the past year the health score rating has dropped to 58.. I'm surprised they haven't been shut down by now. Furthermore, I went on the evening of 1/9/17 and the ENTIRE front seating area closest to the store front smelled of urine. I thought I was imagining the scent until my partner brought it up and we had to excuse ourselves and leave. It is disgustingly unsanitary to allow the restaurant to run in these dirty conditions. STAY AWAY unless the health ratings and integrity of the restaurant increase.
author: Lissette L.

description:
Hot & Sour soup - It was just okay. Soup was a bit too thick. It wasn't spicy or sour enough. 
Shrimp & leek dumplings - 12 pieces for $8 was not bad. This dish was good but I don't think they put enough shrimp in it.
Sauteed garlic string beans - It has a really good flavor but the string beans were a bit overcooked. I like mines more on the crunchy side.
Dry Fried Chicken - It was good! Very crispy with a good flavor of sauce drizzled on it. 
Came here for the first time w my bf. When we first got here, the line was really long for both San Tung #1 & #2. We had better luck w #2 so we got to dine in the newer restaurant. The restaurant was kind of small, smaller than the #1. Decor was nice & the waiters were pretty attentive.
author: Thanh T.

description:
Come here if the original one's wait is too ridiculously long (as it often is). You won't be sorry. Quality wise, everything tastes exactly the same and delicious! Their signature wings come out piping hot and amazingly crispy, smothered in their secret sauce. Sometimes I can't even wait long enough for them to cool before stuffing them in my mouth. So drool worthy!!! 

I actually prefer this restaurant over the first (which is right next door), as you get the same great food, with less of a wait, and the ambiance is much more calm and clean. Hot and sour soup and string beans are so yummy!!! Mushu pork however is so-so.
author: Christine N.

description: Not as good as San Tung next door for sure. The sauce in the chicken wings are tastier and much more flavorful next door. The service was quick, and we ordered way too many dishes for 3 people but we got lunch for the next day :) They were closing so we felt a bit rushed eating because they already started putting up chairs around us - which isn't recommended to do because I felt as if I wasn't fully enjoying my meal. We had the black bean noodles, fried rice, house special chicken, and string beans. My favorite were the string beans and the black bean noodles. I love noodles and black bean noodles are one of my favorite noodle dishes. Portions are generous and definitely suggest to go to the San Tung next door if it's your first time, but it's always packed on that side so this is a good alternative if you don't want to wait.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Silly silly children, San Tung #2 and the San Tung next door are the same! The fam and I always come to San Tung #2 to avoid the wait and lines. 

There isn't much else to say, they make great fried chicken and noodles. We always get a plate of dumplings, couple orders if dry fried chicken, black bean sauce noodles and string beans. Look around everyone orders fried chicken, if you come here and don't get fried chicken... You're just silly :)
author: Jen L.

description: This review is for San Tung 2!!! Im a regular here... And they showed us so much love tonight while I held my boyfriends surprise birthday dinner! They were extremely accommodating and went out of their way to make our table feel extra special for this occasion. I can't thank them enough!! My boyfriend was so grateful, he made sure to shake everybody in the establishments hand to personally thank them for making this night so memorable. Big ups to this place!!! We love u guys.
author: Brenda G.

description:
I know what you're thinking. Why is there the usual mass of hangry patrons still waiting outside the original San Tung, while #2 remains comparatively empty? What's the difference? Why does it look like a Kwik-E-Mart? Why would a restaurant put "#2" in their name? (Doesn't the #2 come after the meal...?)

Well I'm putting your worried, hungry thoughts to rest. San Tung #2 is exactly the same as the original with the following exceptions:
- wait is shorter (if there is one)
- they don't serve kimchi
- they don't offer lunch specials
- it's quieter and cleaner
- tackier rainbow light ceiling fixtures

Sitting inside the restaurant, you'll most certainly observe hungry, inquisitive people outside, doubtfully reading the window menu and expecting (almost hoping) to find a huge discrepancy that would require compromising the full-fledged San Tung experience. But relish in your own seat, safe from the merciless Sunset chill, knowing that the benefit of the doubt you've given to San Tung #2 shall soon be rewarded with a hot sticky plate of chickeny goodness 40 minutes early. 

The food: I'm not usually impressed with San Tung's (spicy) black bean noodles, but I gave it another shot this time and it did not disappoint. It wasn't spicy in the slightest, BUT the flavor was tasty and caused me to stuff myself to the land of food baby remorse. The string beans were balanced and moist--surprising because most restaurants prepare them too salty and dry them out (just because they're glazed in sauce, doesn't mean they're moist). And the chicken--well, you know the chicken.

In this lesson in dining, patience is not a virtue--it's a misguided commitment to "the original restaurant", perhaps derived from ravenous delirium. It's the same food, people! Save your hungry soul, don't wait in line, and eat at San Tung #2.
author: Marina L.

description:
Originally we were trying to go to San Tung but the long line outside dissuaded us. We ended up getting in the shorter line for San Tung #2 . 

Unfortunately the wait time was about 45 minutes. It seemed like that had lots of seating but maybe have been limited in staff so they were slow in seating people.
