We ordered the famous chicken wings and really, they are most certainly not worth the wait. Everything else (fried rice, egg drop soup) was totally generic Chinese restaurant food. 

I don't recommend this restaurant. Specially due to the ridiculous wait time for a product that is really not that exciting. The original San Tung might be better though.
author: Vega S.

description:
PARKING: Limited! All street parking so you might have to walk a ways to eat here. 

WAIT: Long but not as long as San Tung #1, located next door, which is why my friend and I decided to go here. 

FOOD: They serve the same food as San Tung #1! They just have two locations to keep up with all the business they get. The dry fried chicken wings are a must order! They're fried to perfection and dipped in their sticky sweet and spicy sauce. The dumplings here are great too! 

CON: Not enough people working! There were only 2 girls and it looked like they were juggling to do everything. 

ACCEPTS CREDIT CARD: Yes. 

TIP: Put your name on the wait list for both San Tung #1 and #2 and see which one calls you first!
author: Stefanie K.

description: Sorry .. This place is really really really dirty.  The owners are also very rude to the customers.  Don't even bother.  Got diarrhea.
author: Koalie W.

description:
I'm not sure why people even bother going to San Tung as opposed to San Tung #2.

No line, faster service, quieter, and the same delicious food. Skip the long lines and come here! Ordered the black bean noodles (with pork, shrimp, zucchini, onion), the shrimp and leek dumplings, and the original dry fried chicken. Everything was YUMMY!

Shrimp and leek dumplings: they're like wonton-sized dumplings but super soft and delicious. The shrimps are chopped up into little pieces and mixed in with the leek. A definite MUST if you're craving dumplings.

Black bean noodles: I love the chewy texture of the noodles. They were like skinnier udon noodles. At first I thought the whole thing was drenched in sauce but the sauce was light and not too salty. Had a good amount of pork and big pieces of shrimp in there to balance out the noodles. Unlike San Tung, this one comes in a HUGE bowl so you don't have a hard time mixing it up.

Original dry fried chicken: Crunchy skin, sweet sauce, and perfectly cooked on the inside. Haven't had chicken wings anywhere else that beats this.

One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the city. 5/5, straight up yummy!
author: Ting Jung L.

description:
Let it go - Dedicated to San Tung 2 

The sign glows San Tung 2,
No one is in line,
A restaurant of quietness,
And it looks like I am the only customer.

The fried mushrooms are too sweet,
Like the desserts in the store down the street,
Cannot handle the MSG,
You can tell I have tried.

Don't give me salty spinach, don't give me oily noodles, 
Cannot handle San Tung 2 anymore, 
Let it go, let it go,
Turn away and spit the food.

I don't care what the staff thinks,
Let the dish stay in tact,
The food bothered me so much,
Let it go, let it go,
Cannot handle San Tung 2 anymore,
Let it go, let it go,
Turn my back and run to the original San Tung.
author: May Y.

description:
An extension of the famous San Tung, and the food does not lose any quality but has a shorter wait. I'll definitely support the shorter wait because food is king. As long as it tastes the same, the ambiance of a Chinese restaurant does not matter to me.

FOOD: Original dry chicken wings. The only thing you need to know. Got two orders and it is just so good. It's not authentic Chinese as far as I know, but there is nothing else like it and it takes chicken wings to another place. The sauce is this sweet, tangy, garlicy, concoction with a kick of spiciness from the peppers. It is perfect and lingers in your mouth for extended flavor. I believe they prep their chicken with egg whites and deep fry it but regardless, it has perfect texture. It is the perfect type of crispy contrasting the moist tender chicken on the inside. We also ordered the black bean noodles which was also very good. A couple of different proteins engorged in a mildly thick, not too in-your-face black bean sauce. This with the help of soft noodles makes this dish a nice complement to the wings. We also decided to order the garlic eggplant. This was not particularly amazing, as it could use a little more garlic flavor. Still good though.

Overall, if you want the San Tung chicken, come here. I see no substantial reason to wait the extra half hour to go the original when there is the shorter wait with the same food. WINGS. That is all.
author: Bryant C.

description: The absolute main #1 reason to come here is for the chicken wings. They have a perfect tang with a hint of flavorful spiciness. They're practically perfect. Their other menu items are tasty as well, such as the chicken chow mein, although it's hard to reach the same plane as the wings.
author: Corey S.

description:
Definitely a fan. 

I finally had the opportunity to check this place out. We originally tried San Tung [original] next door, but the wait was longer.  When the guy recommended us next door, this place was way more chill and relaxing.  We waited about 20 mins on a Thursday.

- Chicken Wings: Read the reviews, they meet this standard.  It definitely is better than SF's SO, but still does not seem to meet the standard of Chicago's Great Seas chicken wings.  But definitely does meet the mark.
- Black Bean Noodle:  Good. Tasty, and well seasoned.  The egg is a nice touch.
- String Beans: Very good.  Definitely worth getting to break up all that chicken wing action.

Definitely worth it.  We lucked out with not a crazy line, so I don't know if I could wait the hour to eat here. The service when we were seated was quick, but the turnover on tables and cleaning up was definitely on the slower end.  It was delicious, and definitely will be returning.
author: Natalie G.

description: I was going to the original San Tung, but damn the wait there was way too long. My family basically ordered San Tung's most popular dishes: fried chicken, black bean noodles, honey walnut prawns, seafood fried rice, and some eggplant. I am not entirely sure if the seafood fried rice and eggplant are popular but the others sure are. All of these dishes tasted good, but they didn't really WOW me, which leaves the fifth star out of the rating. Quick service and an overall nice place to eat some Chinese food. It's worth a try to say the least.
author: Kevin L.

description: Not sure why there are so many negative reviews about the quality of the food.  I hope it's just one of those "all-in-your-head" things.  The food is the same as San Tung, the menu is shortened to the main staples of what makes San Tung so great.  The owners are the same and the head chefs at each location are the brothers that run San Tung (if you've been enough times, you know who the main guys are).  If folks think San Tung 2 is a knock off version of San Tung.... I guess I can't complain, it means shorter lines for when the rest of us go.
author: Mare C.

description:
I came here on a Saturday for a late lunch with a friend after playing some frisbee in Golden Gate Park. By the time we got to San Tung, it was already almost 3 o'clock! I guess I shouldn't have been surprised that the entire restaurant was packed full of people with a crowd waiting outside! Luckily, #2 had plenty of seating available. After going through some Yelp reviews and verifying that there would be the same chicken wings, we went in and were seated immediately.

The lack of kimchee and lunch specials didn't affect us at all (which only the original serves). We ended up going for the wings (of course). The chicken wings were cooked perfectly and the sweet and spicy made them even better! The wings are hyped up for good reason.

#2 was pretty dark inside. But there was plenty of seating and service was pretty good and prompt. It was great to finally try the chicken wings and have a beer after hanging out in the park.
author: Vivian L.

description: The only different is that there is no kim chi.  The wait is much shorter so I'd just come here since the food is the same.  The wings are yummy and the potstickers were good.  The black bean noodles were great.  The service is quick and efficient.
author: Chris L.

description:
*****I want to report those Yelpers who do not like the Dry Fried Chicken Wings! I mean seriously?! It's ridiculous! *****

So after raving about the chicken wings to my family, we decided to go to the Original San Tung Restaurant on a Friday night. As usual, there was an hour wait. So while everyone was trying to squeeze in just to write their names on the waiting list...I walked my way next door to San Tung # 2 where there were no lines. 

It was about a five minute wait...even on a busy Friday night! To be honest, this restaurant is actually cleaner and more modern than the original. The menu isn't as extensive but they have all of my favorites so I didn't mind at all. Service was surprisingly good. Servers were always attentive and made sure our glasses were always full. I really appreciated that.

Our Order:

- Hot & Sour Soup: One of the best I've had in a restaurant. Lots of protein and veggies unlike other places where it's mostly broth. Perfect balance with the spiciness & sourness.
- Black Bean Noodles with Seafood: My mom who is very picky liked the chewiness of the noodles. We also liked how there were lots of seafood in the dish. The sauce was good too; sweet and salty, but I would go lighter on the sugar.
- Salt & Pepper Shrimp: Personally we thought this had the shells on. But it was peeled battered shrimp. Nevertheless...they were good. 
- Sautéed Garlic String Beans: Still had a good crunch to them. Sauce was good...but like the noodles I would go a little lighter on the sugar next time.
- Dry Fried Chicken Wings: HANDS DOWN THE BEST CHICKEN WINGS IN THE WORLD! Always consistent. I like how the chicken remains super crispy even with the sauce. So addicting! Sweet, salty, spicy, savory, & most of all DELICIOUS! It's my ultimate guilty pleasure....

Overall, it was a good experience as always. I might go here more often as opposed to the Original Restaurant because it's cleaner, faster, & easy on the wallet. Please try the chicken wings...it'll change your life.
author: Ralph N.

description:
Stopped by for lunch and tried the Jjambong and Mushu Pork.  Amazing thing is the menu looks the same and the owners are the same, but the food is not up to par as the original, eventhough it's right next door.  The mushu was very salty and it looked like almost leftovers from a rejected order.  The Jjambong broth was not as tasty as I remembered it.  Anyway, I probably won't wait in line for the original and will pass on #2 going forward.

Good thing Yummy Yummy is right next door.
author: Sam M.

description: Was looking to go to the original San Tung next door and was standing outside for a table. Then I noticed San Tung #2 next door with signage emphasizing they are the same owner and offer everything that is on San Tung's menu. I gave them a try by writing a name on the wait list to see which restaurant would call us up first for a table. I was initially seated by the waiter, but was told to get up after to seat a bigger party which was out of the ordinary. They then reseated us in about ten minutes at a smaller table. I assumed that they pulled us out since the bigger party would obviously order more food than us. I decided to get the usual Dry Fried Chicken Wings and the Dumplings which were exactly the same as the original San Tung next door. The service here was lacking since I had to get their attention to order, refill water, and to get the check. Would return here if I am in a rush for chicken wings, but would sick with the original restaurant next door since they do not offer lunch specials or kimchi at this restaurant.
author: Peter C.

description: So the wings totally live up to the hype and then some. They were delicious! It's a good thing I am not walking distance from here or I'd be double my size and eating them daily. The broccoli beef was really good too. I look forward to trying more dishes!
author: Kat R.

description:
Came here wanting to go the original San Tung but was crowded. Ended up going to San Tung #2. Order the Original Dry Fried Chicken wings or w/e, Satay Beef, and rice.

The Chicken was good that's why i give it two stars. However, the rice was soggy as hell. If it was added with a little bit more water, it could have because the rice for porridge. Wasn't really edible for my taste. What's worst is that the satay beef was drowned in so much sauce that I needed to use my rice to absorb all that sauce to be able to eat it. Wasn't good at all. The service was also kind of bad, probably because there was only two waitresses for the whole restaurant, which doesn't seem to be a efficient number to serve the whole restaurant. It took a while for the waitress to take out check so we can leave.
author: David M.

description:
Disclaimer: based on service, not food. Never got to even sit down to eat there. 

Put my name down at the original San Tung for about a half hour wait, not bad. Decided to peek next door at San Tung #2 - smaller menu, but has everything I want: dry fried flounder, homemade noodles, hot and sour soup. 

I walk in to the smell of bleach and several tables of people eating. The girl sitting at the counter says, "sorry we're closed." I ask, "oh, so you don't close at 9:30pm?" (As the sign outside says). "Oh no, we ran out of chicken wings." 

First off, I don't want the chicken wings (not bc I don't like them). Second, you have the same owner as the original San Tung! And are right NEXT DOOR! Is it against the rules to pick some up from your father restaurant?! 

Back to waiting at the original San Tung..
author: Tea Lyves ..

description: Seen some much pictures about this from my followers on instagram and heard that these wings were amazing! My sister and I went after I picked her up from SFO and we get to the area but as we all know, parking sucks in SF. We get to the restaurant and realize that their white board where you check in your name was completely full and the list was looooong. We then discovered that next door, was the same exact thing but #2 and about a quarter of size of #1. We order to go because it would have taken long as well. The order came in really quick! When we got home, I honestly loved the wings! I thought they were so good! I didn't think it lived up to the hype but they were delicious wings. Even the fried friends was good too-
author: Ben Z.

description:
Same food. Right next door. And no lines.  Yes, I'm there! 
The menu is slightly condensed but it has all the essentials I need so no complaints here.  The tables are a little sticky for my liking but whatever, as long as the food is still the same.  I'm all for it!
author: Meshell C.

description:
Dry rub fried chicken wings. Get it here. Don't wait in that crazy line for the original San Tung. It is the same darn thing. San Tung #2 doesn't have the same foods or the same great service, but the fried chicken is all you want anyway.

A word about the noodle soups: I don't like it. They don't provide enough of the soup, and there's just too much. I appreciate that they wanna give me all this food for my buck-- but I really just want more of the soup and less of the noodles. This goes back to why you should just get the fried chicken wings.

Would I come back? Yes, because San Tung (the original) has the biggest line in the whole world and I'm addicted to the chicken wings like it's got crack in it or something.
author: Julie H.

description:
Came to San Tung #2 because we had a hungry toddler with us who couldn't stand the wait at San Tung.

When I sat down, I noticed my spoon was dirty. Not just a "spec of food" dirty, but "full of goopy sauce" dirty. Gross.

The menu was more limited than at San Tung, but the staples were still available. The wings were just like next door - to die for. The dumplings were quite good as well. 

I'd stay away from the noodle soups (bland) and the highly regarded "sizzling rice soup". While I admittedly haven't tried this dish at San Tung,  what I had at San Tung #2 was a complete let down. It was like putting rice crispies in soup, and not even a good one at that (broth, spinach, water chestnuts, and mushrooms straight from a can). Meh.
author: Cindy T.

description: Awful service!!! After looking for parking for almost half an hour and waiting for over an hour at the restaurant to get called, someone from our party told the waitress to follow the wait list since they've been sitting people who aren't even on the list.  She rudely told our group to eat somewhere else if we can't wait. Wow!  How can you expect people to spend their hard-earned money in your restaurant with that kind of service!  Someone needs to take anger management and etiquette class!
author: Lyn B.

description:
Why would you even want to go to the 1st one if all you're trying to get is the dry fried chicken? Why wait even longer for the same delicious, crispier than real fried chicken, chicken? 

Tried the curry noodles, will not try again. Tried the other spicy wings they offer, and wished it was another order of the original one instead. 

You really can't go wrong with the original wings, green beans and steamed rice.
author: Amy P.

description:
Great books that endure the test of time are always worth a second (and third) read.

Sometimes I feel like Yelping has created an incentive to the the opposite -- to scatter our time amongst the growing body of stimuli demanding our attention, each promising the experience of newness and discovery without us having to engage in any of the risks real discovery would entail. As Robert Pirsig once wrote:

"Perhaps because of these changes the stream of national consciousness moves faster now, and is broader, but it seems to run less deep."

He was referring to "radios, movies and TV" but this applies a great magnitude more to the Internet -- and maybe Yelp.

...

Santung 2 is next door to Santung the original, but the food is the same. The food here is good for a second or third read, even if the lines can be prohibitively long. Five stars.
author: Christophe C.

description: I went to this restaurant on Sunday night. I was waiting for 25 mins. After 25 mins I got a chance to sit. Ambience was ok and staff was too busy with other customers. Only thing which makes me write about this restaurant is food.. Too good!! Specially pork dumplings and chicken wings. For me one of the best restaurant for Chinese food in SFO.
author: Roshan P.

description:
After hearing so many rave reviews from friends to come here and try their chicken wings, we finally had a chance to come and give it a try.

The og San Tung is right next door, but there were graduation parties going on so the wait was quite long. We opted to dine at San Tung #2 since the wait was 20 mins for a party of 2. I think I spent more time to find parking then waiting for a table.

Food came out relatively quick as we ordered the chicken wings and dumplings.

Service was good and we were always attended to.

Overall a great experience. Will definitely be back for those chicken wings!
author: Andrew T.

description:
Like many before us, my group and I excitedly arrived to San Tung #1 only to find the line spill out of the restaurant onto the sidewalk , so off to San Tung #2 (next door) we go!

Everyone knows that San Tung Numero Uno is better. However, for as much space and lazy susans that San Tung Numero Dos lacks, it makes up for in quick and speedy service. On a late Sunday evening, we were first on the wait list on the dry erase board. Score! 

Good cuz we were stAaaAarrvin' after a long hike in Marin. Anywho, after a quick peruse of the menu, we proceeded to order way too much food for 4 people. But as HONGRY as we were, we finished it all. 

If you come here, you MUST get the Dry Fried Chicken (12 pieces) to share or, you know, by yourself if you roll like that. You can choose for it to come dry or glazed but I prefer glazed myself. I like my wings to be smackin' with sauce!

It's not just about the chicken though (the reason most people come here). San Tung knows how to cook traditional Chinese food, despite its trendy and young clientele. Their sauteed and stir-fry vegetable dishes are to DIE FOR. Served fresh and not stir fried too oily or greasy. Any of their veggie dishes will do. 

I also like their Honey Walnut Prawns and Noodles in Peanut Sauce. Their other dishes like fried rice and beef broccoli are alright, nothing special. 

This Chinese restaurant is of the rare breed where you can take both your embarrassing clan of visiting relatives or group of friends on a Saturday night. Both work. 

Not much else to say except that I appreciate any restaurant that's reasonably priced and serves hearty, traditional Chinese food to the people. I mean, what's not to love?

San Tung (numero dos) gets FOUR STARS from me. Still waiting on that numero uno experience though
author: Chival N.

description:
Plan to wait in line at least 40 minutes! It's worth it! Two restaurants are side by side San Tung and San Tung #2. One was closed for 'vacation' so #2 was EXTRA PACKED. 

We waited 40 minutes to be seated. When you get there you sign your name in order of the last arrived on a white board. I was nervous that someone would cut but the board is well managed. They were out of pot stickers so I didn't get to try them but I did get to try their glazed chicken wings and believe me it was worth the WAIT! They were so delicious! We ordered chicken wings, chicken fried rice, chicken chow mein and egg drop soup. 

NOTE: the egg drop soup comes with shrimp, so if you're allergice (like my brother) make sure you ask for the tofu one. 

I will definitely be back again!
author: Xo L.

description:
This place is just like the original San Tung (in terms of chicken wings)! 

Pro:
+ much shorter lines, practically no wait for me
+ clean, easy to order, spacious
+ bomb dry fried chicken (both available in wings/drumstick or diced (boneless)
+ greenbeans are sweet and crunchy

Con:
- no kim chi like the original San Tung
- the diced fry chicken was super fried, like there would be pieces of just fried stuff w/o chicken inside
- all the food sorta came out one dish at a time, but whatevs, it was friggin delicious

Tips:
+ order the dry fry chicken (SOOO GOOD)
+ order a bowl of rice with it, the sauce and the chicken is very flavorful and its nice to balance it with something
author: Carmen C.

description: 5 stars is for the wings. The wings are FIRE . Black bean noodles was whatever's though. It was bland, so we straight ignored it, but we killed those wings! Coming again and best believe I'm getting wings. Black bean can stay in the kitchen.
author: Oscar E.

description: Food is not Chinese food! And auto charge 18% tip for so bad server. They just pass food on your table, it's done.then nothing!!
author: Mo L.

description: Original Fried Chicken, String Beans, Fried Rice, Potstickers. Is the one to go for. Best Chinese food I've ever had. Definitely recommend this place to anyone. There always busy with a long wait. But it's totally worth the wait.
author: Kaika K.

description:
Amazing food! I love coming here for the dry chicken wings. I always recommend this place to friends who moved out to the sunset or is looking for a delicious place to eat. 

One thing I always recommend is order to go. 1) lines are ridiculously long 2) waiters are rude. 3) they're pretty quick. So that means you get to have goodness sooner.
author: Christina L.

description:
Soo, after reading reviews from this place, I was quite hesitant of how it would be. 

Dry Fried Chicken Wings: these were totally awesome as usual, but I did enjoy the wings not being lathered with the sauce. They were crispy and still saturated with flavor!

Chicken with String Beans: This dish appeared quite garlic-y. However, it was good! The ratio of chicken to string beans seemed heavy on the chicken side, but that could be because we ate all the string beans. 

If you're craving the chicken wings, San Tung #2 doesn't disappoint. They do have a limited menu, so prepare for that too.
author: Hamilton C.

description: Get your hot and sour on at this place! This place is like it as far as Chinese food goes. Prompt service. And did I mention the service was prompt? Little shrimps floating in my hot and sour soup, definitely a highlight and shrimpy surprise. Both of which I am a fan of. Winning.
author: Nathan B.

description:
I stopped in today to grab some wings to bring to the office. Friday surprise! 

My team DEVOURED them and proceeded to request more (which I was not prepared for). Historically, San Tung has been a favorite and I've enjoyed it from my home (because I can walk there), however, bringing it to the Financial District and seeing peoples overtly excited reaction to their food was a really great feeling.

If only they delivered....
author: Liz W.

description:
It's a pretty good Chinese restaurant, but honestly not that special. Coming from the San Gabriel Valley, there are way more, better Asian restaurants in the LA area. But San Tung is good, don't get me wrong.

San Tung 1 is the original location on the left, and it's got that busy Chinese restaurant feel with a lot of loud voices talking, spoons clanging on plates, etc. San Tung #2 right next door is a lot more modern looking, quieter, and cleaner. The food is supposed to be the same.

So the dry fried chicken wings are what everyone gets. They are good, not amazing. The chicken is fine, but nothing to rave about. The sauce is okay. I think Korean fried chicken wings are tastier, but it was still good.

The potstickers were terrible! They were huge, the skin was so dry, and the meat inside was really flavorless. Also, points off to them for only have soy sauce and not vinegar! How is that authentic?

The black bean sauce noodles (zha jiang mian) is pretty good. I liked how it had shrimp and octopus inside. The sauce itself was not as salty as other places. The noodles were yummy and not soggy despite being drenched in sauce. I liked spooning the sauce over my chicken fried rice, it made for a tasty combo!

The stir fried string beans are a good vegetable dish. They are salty, flavorful, and tasty.

Overall, a good choice for Chinese food in NorCal, but doesn't compare to Chinese food in SoCal.
author: Nancy X.

description:
If you are coming to San Tung for their famous wings, skip the line at the original San Tung and visit San Tung #2. The Original Dry Fried Chicken wings continue to be a hit, even though I've noticed that their recipe and the size of the wings seems to vary every time I go there (this has been the case with the original San Tung though, so I don't think it's an issue with the offshoot restaurant). 

We also ordered the Pork dumplings, which were so delicious! Full of flavor, nice and juicy. 

Skip the salt and pepper shrimp; it is not like the traditional salt and pepper shrimp that you normally find at Chinese restaurants. This one was heavily battered and had big pieces of grilled onion and jalapeno, but none of the crispy little fried bites that I've come to know and love as true Chinese "salt and pepper." 

Service was fine and very friendly, although we did have to ask for water.
author: Emily W.

description: I found it hard to give this place anything higher than 2 stars.  After hearing about how FABULOUS their dry fried wings are we decided to give it a try and ordered some of their wings.  After reading and seeing all these reviews THIS was the ONLY REASON we decided to visit this place.  Their other restaurant right next door was closed as they were on VACATIOn?.  I will not be coming back her or next door on any of my future San Fran visits as there are much much better options for CHINESE food in this city,  Now for the BAD parking is ALWAYS ALWAYS tough in this location no matter the time of day.  The dry fried chicken wings are JUST not THAT good they are OK but not worth the trip  so do yourself a favor and go to a different Chinese place to try, really wish we would have tried Mama Ji;s as some in our group suggested or Shanghai Dumpling King(at this location CASH only for dumpling king as we had no cash we had to go elsewhere) unfortunately.  We came to San Tung 2 on thursday 11/10/16 and really wished we had CASH to stay at Shanghai Dumpling King,  oNLY ITEM AVAILABLE for take out is their chicken wings but don't bother.
author: Tim R.

description:
Saturday night and the waiting list for San Tung was long so off to do a marathon that is San Tung 2 right next door.  I was the only table of two in the list and I could see two open tables, 3 if you count the window counter.  It took about five minutes before someone got to me.  Ordered an order of Dry Fried Chicken Wings and so did my friend.  They might have added more sauce than my last visit to San Tung 1 which I don't mind at all.  Tastes about the same as I remember it which was obviously good.  

The gist of it is its a lot less hectic here than San Tung 1 and the wings are relatively the same.
author: Rob C.

description: I miss the jjajjangmyeon from Korea, the legit stuff that gets delivered wrapped in plastic (bowl and all). The jjajjangmyeon (black bean noodles) at San Tung (both locations) comes close - it always hits the spot. The chicken wings are awesome too but I come here for the jjajjangmyeon - best in the city. Menu at San Tung 2 has their popular items only and is not as extensive as San Tung. I found the quality of food to be the same at both places.
author: Emily L.

description:
Came here on a Monday night at around 830 and the wait for the first San Tung was pretty long so we decided to eat here. There was no wait. It was our first time so we got the Hot and Sour Soup, two order of their dry wings, string beans and black bean noodles.

Hot and sour soup - It was really good ! Hit the spot since it was so windy and cold

Dry wings - Sooo goooood ! But two orders was too much for 4 people. I wonder how good it would be at the first location since i heard i was better.

String Beans - I realllyyyyy liked it ! Should try if you want a side of veggies

Black bean noodles - Wasn't really a big fan of it. Our server told us it was one of the most popular menu items but we weren't really digging it.

All this food for four was way too much. But leftover wings for lunch ! Yazzz
author: Elaine V.

description: I can't say anything bad about this place but the wait. If you want to dine in be prepared to stand in line. If you can't wait to devour their amazing chicken wings then order ahead, pick it up and be messy at home without anybody judging you for finishing the entire box of it.
author: Kathy P.

description:
Neutral for 3 reasons. 

1. Their menu does not feature favorites example:lemon chicken... it is only two pages with no back 
2. Haven't tasted their actual food due to lack of options
3. Looks more modern and the service was nice for the few second we spent at the table examining the shallow menu. Granted it is probably fine if everything you do want is on this menu, but this was not the case for us.
author: Anna B.

description:
What a HUGE disappointment. I was visiting SF and my friend said I had to check this place out. I was told that San Tung #2 had less options, but served all the same popular dishes, which was all I wanted. 

Lets start with the food. My party ordered 2 orders of the dry chicken, sauteed green beans, black bean noodles, combination fried rice, and mongolian beef. For some reason, all the food tasted quite similar. Sticky with a very strong flavor.... The dry chicken was pretty good, not going to lie. It had a nice blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy. Only thing I didn't like about it was that it was super sticky. 

Then it all went downhill from there. The next thing that came out was the green beans, which came out to be sub par. In fact, it tasted pretty similar to the chicken...which isn't what green beans should taste like. It also seemed like they used the same sauce. Next the black bean noodles came out...I don't even know how to describe this. It had this weird flavor that made most of us cringe. After that, the combination fried rice came out. When the waitress put the plate on the table, I noticed this disturbing strong smell. I took a bite of the rice and it was okay....but then I ate the shrimp. Not only was the texture terrible, but it was spoiled. Spat it out immediately. At this point, everyone was feeling pretty sick. The food just sat in your stomach and it was uncomfortable. The mongolian beef came last. In my first bite, I noticed that they chefs but WAYYY too much baking soda in the meat. For those of you that don't know, many Chinese restaurants put baking soda in the beef to make it more tender. 

By this point we've had enough. What made it worse was the service. Our waitress was extremely rude....there was really only one way to describe her.... We told the manager about our experience and she was able to discount our meal. 

I suggest going to the original San Tung. Everyone seemed to be happy there. This was definitely the worst meal I've had in San Francisco. Had an uncomfortable stomach the whole night.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I've heard about this place from friends and family but never had the chance to try it until last weekend. My boyfriend, his family and I wanted to go to the original san tung but it was way too crowded. San tung #2 was less of a wait. 

The food was delicious! The sweet and spicy chicken wings were amazing. I couldn't stop eating them. Their black bean noodles and shrimp fried rice were just as yummy. 

Reason why this place is 4 stars instead of 5, the wait and the lack of employees. When walking into the restaurant, there is a wipeboard on the wall. The employees don't cross names off of it, they just erase it once they call a party to their table. I was so confused on where to write my name that I put it above someone else that's probably waited longer than me. Also, this place needs to hire a couple more waiters. For a busy restaurant, there was only 2-3 waiters at a time. 

Over all, I was satisfied with the food and service from san tung #2 but I would like to try the original to compare. I can't wait to go back for chicken wings! :)
author: joanne c.

description: We were visiting SF from Washington, DC, and were attracted by all the positive reviews for San Tung and San Tung 2.  Alas, we were very disappointed.  The dry wings are indeed meaty and well cooked.  But they are served in a gooey sweet sauce that could best be described as generic General Tso sauce.  They should properly be served dry with perhaps some chopped green chiles and a bit of salt, not lost in this gooey sweet mess.  And the sautéed spinach was a great disappointment as it had little or no taste, having been cooked in prepared minced garlic, rather than fresh garlic, and without a hint of sesame oil.  We can do far better, and far cheaper, in the DC suburbs hosting Asian communities.
author: Stephen R.

description: I don't know where to start. You walk in the door and sign in on a board with your name and how many people are in your party. Even when there busy they still get people in and out quickly. Place is very noisy and people that are waiting are seriously at your table if your seated next to the entrance. They serve canned soda which I hate when restaurants do and almost  impossible to get severs attention people place is very busy. Their famous wings are very good same goes for the string beans.
author: Alfonso A.

description:
Just as delicious but a shorter wait! 
You don't have to get on a wait list behind chinese tables of 10+. 
Beef and Broccoli! Yummmmm.
author: Dee N.

description: We didn't want to wait too long next door, so we settled for San Tung #2. Bad choice! No Kim chee, no dumplings (just today I guess)... the hot and sour soup had a different texture (too many egg mixture), the mu shu chicken had shredded pieces of carrot and cucumber (not next door), and the sautéed string beans had too much ginger aroma. The only dish that tasted the same was the chicken wings. Still, we will definitely go back to the original store next time, even if the wait would be twice as long!
author: Jeff N.

description:
Wait time: 1 hour on a late Sunday afternoon

Ordered: chicken wings, dumplings, pot stickers, some sort of veggie thing, black bean noodles, cherry pork.

The best way I can put it is- "REALLY WELL DONE generic Chinese food". 

Service: food came out quickly, yet not all at the same time, so that was nice. Place was busy so the somewhat inattentive service was expected. On par with most places like this.

Short of extraordinary but I left very much satisfied and hurting- and that's always a sign of a good meal. Can't help but wonder if we missed out on anything by passing on the og San tung.
author: chris m.

description: Long wait (approximately 45 minutes) but the dry fried chicken wings are just so worth it.
author: Jason D.

description: San Tung 2 is located right next to the original San Tung location. The menu consists of the most popular items that the original location offers, so it is much smaller but still offers a lot. The wait was a lot shorter too which is a plus. If you're just in the mood for some wings, string beans and the black bean noodles then this location is a great option.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Right next door to the original. Definitely less crowded. Smaller menu. Water or tea. Asked for refill on tea then the waitress gave us a teapot. A rice eater... Definitely wont like that there isn't a refillable rice container like the original San Tung. They charge you $1.50 per bowl. So that was a bummer. The broccoli beef was saucy and tasty. The dried fried chicken wings had a thinner/runnier sauce. The plate we got was a little more on the spicy side. But still good. Overall okay. 3.5 stars. I would still like to go to the original restaurant more.
Note: one unisex bathroom.
author: Helena C.

description: Ordered take out. Several items were missing. The place was heavy on sauce and artificial ingredients. The noodles smelled. Chicken wings weren't that good. I'm Chinese and know what good Chinese food tastes like. This is not it. Will not be returning.
author: Catherine W.

description: Honestly, not bad. If you hate waiting i honestly don't see why you can't just go to this one. If you're craving asian wet wangssss i say dewwit. If you like southern dry chicken wangssss popeye's SPICY fried chicken is the way to gooo
author: Thankie S.

description: Probably one of the best I've had yet. The chicken are super crispy and I love the noodles. I think they were called black bean noodles? I don't remember since my friend ordered it and I was starving. But it was soo good. We ordered ones with bones, and ones without. Either way, they definitely got them a new fan. I live too far away to come often, but if I get the chance, I definitely would!
author: Sharon T.

description: I ordered 2 orders of the chicken wings, black bean noodles, and some other dishes. However, the chicken wings were very salty. The black bean noodles were very bland. As a tourist here, I don't like the food. I've had better chinese food in my area, and I don't think I'll be returning.
author: Diamond L.

description: LOVE the sweet/spicy/crispy wings and the dry fried green beans (which are not really dry at all)- actually the only thing I've ever gotten here but worth crossing the whole city to get. I understand there can be a long wait at the SanTung next door, so I come here for a to-go order. Can be a bit of a wait. Young Asian folk from the neighborhood watching sports TV gave it an almost sports-bar like feel.
author: Sue W.

description: I saw previous reviews, and had to the chicken wings... And boy am I glad I did! Best wings I've ever had, and I used to work for a company specifically know for their wings. They were perfectly crispy, and the sauce was simply amazing! The Mu Shu was also very delicious. And the scallops in the spicy seafood noodles were cooked perfectly. I'll be back very soon, and quite often!
author: Dylan W.

description: It tock 10 minute to get me water 10 minutes just for water there like snails go faster I do not want to wait 10 minutes just for water
author: Jacob S.

description:
Everything was just as I remembered.... San Tung #2 definitely has a shorter line for all the same deliciousness.

Spicy black bean noodles - bomb.com (cha jjang myun, but better!)
Peanut noodles - unexpectedbomb.com (even comes with scallop and shrimp for less than $10?!)
Original dry chicken wings - never fails to deliver

A ton of food for 4 of us to share, and it only came out to $10 each!
author: Jeanne C.

description: This place was amazing at first I was skeptical about how good it was but the beef broccoli, the honey walnut shrimp, the fried rice and the DRY--Fried chicken was amazing. It was all relatively cheap and we ate a lot of food but I have to give them the props for the dry-fried chicken wings they are second to none top of the line
author: Allen R.

description: I ate the dried fried chicken for the first time yesterday.  For the past 24 hours, I HAVE CRAVED THIS CHICKEN.  From what I understand, the chicken is just as good as San Tung 2's older brother, San Tung.  Go as soon as you can!
author: Nick A.

description:
Me, my boyfriend, and 2 of our friends decided to come here for dinner on Memorial Day. My boyfriend wrote his name at the original San Tung and San Tung #2 and waited to see where we would be called into first. After waiting for almost an hour, our friends went inside #2 and noticed someone had erased my boyfriends name on the board (okay WTF?!) We went in and complained about it to the waitress who looked so confused and lost about the situation. She then sat us down at an empty round table away from other patrons. She came back in the next 10 minutes to take our order and as we all finished she repeated everything to make sure things were correct. Our friend reiterated his and his girlfriends order, then the Asian, blond-haired waitress who looked as though she was dressed in gym clothes had the nerve to read back exactly what she had written on her paper again with a NASTY attitude. She gave us the ugliest stare and had the audacity to *ROLL HER FUCKIN EYES* as she turned away to head back in the kitchen. We all looked at each other and said 

"You want a tip...or nah? NAAAAHHH" 

It's one thing to give your customers attitude but if you plan to roll your eyes and give us a nasty stare-- then make sure it's NOT visible for us to see. After probably 10 minutes or so she came back with our order and luckily we didn't have to interact with her poor customer service attitude and manners.

Our food was good- they offer dry fried chicken wings which is $.50 more than the original San Tung restaurant. I don't get why though if it's the "same owner" as stated on their menu. The menu is a lot shorter and they don't offer as much. If all you want is the dry fried wings and you don't want to wait in line at the original restaurant, then #2 is just as good cause the wings taste the same. They do have fried rice, noodles, soup, and vegetables, but choices are limited. Food wise everything was good as well as the portion. Customer service was really where things were bad. The blond-haired Asian waitress has to fix her attitude and the way she approaches her customers. Better yet, she should be trained how to respectfully deal with people.  

P.S. they only accept one paying card to pay for the bill.
author: Katelyn F.

description: This is right next door to San Tung and it's the same exact thing but with a shorter line.  The dry rub fried chicken was super wet and tasty with a sweet and spicy tang and came with 12 large wings.  Family style is the way to go at any chinese restaurant and we also got mushu tofu, eggplant and pork dumplings.  We ate it all between and it was glorious!
author: Phil D.

description:
Food is just as great as San Tung #1 but with a nicer staff and a less chaotic atmosphere.

Get the dry fried wings of course.
author: Daniel C.

description: Those wings...bomb.com. Fried rice...yum! Had to wait an hour but it was worth it. Some of the best Chinese food I've had in a while.
author: Ashley B.

description: uhhh, what's not to like about #2?  the shorter line or the faster service?  I can't decide.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Haven't really tried the whole menu but my favorite would be the wings that everyone raves about. It is the perfect sweet and spciy combo. It's a dollar a wing roughly so it's not too bad. Another item I like is the hot and sour soup with extra pepper. It's a really good appetizer because it comes out pretty quickly. The price is about 10$ a dish and decent portions. The service is usually slow due to the amount of people, so it requires some flagging down. If you come during dinner time, you could easily wait over an hour. Overall, still my favorite wings in sf. Glad they opened San Tung #2 to lighten the line.
author: Ricky C.

description: For the food: the original chicken is great crunchy and the combination of sweet and spicy is just perfect we got the wings and diced.. I guess wings is the perfect order than the diced coz its more of just breading.. And we got combination fried rice very disappointed its really wet not good for the chicken id rather get a steamed rice oh well..
author: Gladys D.

description: Last night I had dinner with a few friends here. I've always heard about how amazing the fried chicken is here and was excited to finally try it. We arrived at 9pm and there was still a wait for a table on a Thursday night! So we decided to go next door to this place. We ordered a few dishes including their famous fried chicken. It was definitely some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Sweet crispy and well seasoned. The other dishes were also great.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
San Tung original was one of my favorite places when I first moved in to the neighborhood years ago. The quality of food and service has gotten quiet worse since then. We liked San Tung 2 for takeout because it was a shorter line and wait with much friendlier staff! What is hilarious is how they operate separately and we only had San Tung original's number for a long time, and San Tung original would always just hangup on us when we asked for San Tung 2! San Tung original was never helpful or friendly. I guess we are lucky to be blessed by their food.

Review on San Tung 2 food. Chicken wings: we never order these here anymore. They don't taste like fresh wings, but rather many times have tasted like about to spoil old frozen wings. While frozen wings are fine, they should still taste fresh. Special Beef: too much sauce and the meat is not fresh tasting also. when someone orders takeout, you do not need to put all the sauce in the to go container, the sauce just completely covers the fried meat in excess and it's gross. Same for all of your dishes when ordered for takeout, string beans, eggplant, and etc... you don't need to include all the sauce and oil that usually goes on the plate because you are putting all of this in a compact container, just think about it! In a nutshell, all the stir-fried dishes are kind of a let down because they really do not care about freshness when we order out from here and we might have gotten sick from here once or twice also. the dumplings are still good, and the noodle soups are meh, oily broths with not much flavor.
author: Chen Z.

description: The wait in number 2 is always shorter than San tung number 1. I think the menu is basically the same. This place has less of the Chinese restaurant feel. If anything I like it here more. The food always comes out faster as well and service is good.
author: Celia Y.

description: San Tung #2, I feel, confuses those who wait in line for San Tung. You can eat those famous chicken wings here and wait in line less time to get seated. Well, who cares anyways you filthy tourists. I am lucky to know the owner and the family to runs this  establishment. I tell everyone about their friendly and generous service. All the reviews are true about this place. My only thing is that they need to lease additional parking over at the school nearby so that we can park after hours "hint, hint!"
author: Patrick W.

description: Come on people. Don't be so harsh. The food is awesome, the girls are way nicer and cuter than the waiters next door! I tip well. I think they deserve it. They give more noodles than #1 for sure. I don't have to get bitched at about asking for wings only and extra sauce when it's busy. Bomb baby! Who care about no kim chee when I got chicken wings and home made noodles!!
author: Gessa C.

description:
what i ordered.... braised bean curd.

braised bean curd was good...  for those who's not in the know,  it was basically sauteed fried tofu and vegetables with semi thick asian white sauce.

ambiance... good (clean and quite new)
service... good (drop and go with a smile and accomodating)
cost...$ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description: My friend and I decided to come here for dinner. We noticed menu here does not have as much as the original but the only reason I go to San Tung is for the chicken wings. San Tung two provides the same delicious chicken! So to me this place is awesome! The atmosphere and decor is a lot nicer and so is the service.
author: Johnnie L.

description: Along with Great China, one of my favorite Chinese places in the Bay Area.
author: Orien W.

description: Don't know if its a good thing or a bad thing! the fact that they recognize us here! But definitely on a good note been next door at the original San tung plenty of times to know that not having to wait 3500 hrs (exaggerated) for the famous dry chicken is awesome!
author: Chrispy P.

description: I put my name down for a table at the original San Tung, but we were hungry so we went next door. Also, I completely forgot to take my name off the wait list so I hope that didn't mess things up for those working there trying to find us. San Tung #2's menu selection was smaller, but still had enough choices. We ordered the chicken wings, and shrimp & leek and pork dumplings. The food was good, the service was better. They filled up my water 4 times without me having to ask once, so that's a plus. Tables good for parties of 1, 2, 3 or 4, and I think there was one big table. This place serves Chinese food.
author: Benny L.

description:
This place is not like the one next door, they don serve you the kim Chee.  If you are more than 5 it is a long wait.  We waited for about 1 hour and 25 minutes.  The one next door has RSVP for 27 at 7:00 and we had 5 large parties ahead if us.  I waited at this one but one girl just wrote her name on the list but she cheated she wrote the bottom of the first list.  Ofcourse we were on the other side so she got in first.  I know I don't have a solution but it would be nice if they had a better system. But I guess they are too too busy to deal with this part if people comin in and checking in. 
Well when we finally got in it was so hot in there. We were all sweating and that was not from any kind if heat from the food.  The wings didn't taste the same as I expected but they were are still good.  The sauce was thicker than I remember them.  
The strong beans and the fried dumplings were delicious but we came for the wings.  The fried founder was yummy I actually liked it more than the wings this time.  Oh.we got the hot and sour soup it was lighter color than usually but it still taste like hot and sour. 
The service was good once you sit and order but the food came out pipping hot just the way I like it.  
I couldn't give it 5 stars because the food was not as tasty, service was was meh the sign says cash only yet they take credit cards, they don't serve the kim Chee.
author: Toma C.

description: Went while in SF to try the "Dry Fried Wings" and wasn't disappointed.  There was no waiting at #2 vs. an hour + at San Tung #1.  #2 had all the popular dishes we wanted and everything was delish!  Easy on the wallet too!
author: Marla G.

description: I just didn't like it.. Chicken wings r too sweet like I was eating sweets or something.. They dnt hv some menu dat the one nxt door has.. I don't think I'm coming bck
author: Ryoji T.

description:
I was so excited when San Tung opened that I was one of their 1st customers. But tonight, I changed my mind. 
I stood in line patiently for my turn and when 1 of the waitresses acknowledged me, I told them I wanted to order take out. She looked at me and said, " we're not doing take out orders." I was in shock since I've never had a restaurant refuse a take out order. I looked around and it was almost a full house. How can you run a restaurant and not be able to handle orders? SMH
I will wait for the owner's mother and brother to return from vacation and reopen the original San Tung. They wouldn't refuse take out orders and I've been going there for years.
author: Jacqueline H.

description: San Tung #2 has less people but the same food, if you plan to eat the fried chicken. Again, the original dry fried chicken wings hit the spot. $10 for a dozen wings is good but the way it's made is out of this world! Makes BWW looks bad. It's the only thing you should eat and white rice. Also, first time ordering the combination spicy soup noodle wasn't good. The fried shrimp is ok but the chicken is still the best. The spinach garlic veggie dish is below par because the spinach is mature so you have to take a few more chew than expected.  Keep it simple and order the fried chicken and white rice.
author: Nicole N.

description: Best chicken wings in town! If you are in the mood for dry fried chicken wings this is the place to go! I have been coming here for a few years and this is the right place to come to for chicken. Although this place is always busy and you might have to wait to be seated it can sometimes take an hour, it Is worth the wait. I give it 4 stars because the food itself is alright but my all time favorite is only the chicken. Also, the waiters take your order as soon as you are seated but it's hard to get their attention after they serve you and do not really check up on you unless you call for them. Best chicken in town but they need to work on their service!
author: Stacy G.

description:
DELICIOUS! :p

So i yelped "chinese food" in SF and came across San Tung. We thought we'd check it out, and as we arrive we notice a lot of people outside waiting and realize there are actually 2 of them right next to each other. San Tung, & SanTung #2. Since there is a wait, what you do is go inside and write down your name and # of people on a white board and they call you as the tables clear up. We did this for both San Tungs and got called in fist by San Tung #2. A small place and the waitress was very sweet and kept checking up on our table. Here's the good part, the FOOD! Can i say, AMAZING! We ordered the fried chicken wings because we've heard those are the best, and people were right! These wings are to die for and im not exaggerating. Nice, big, crispy and flavorful! We also ordered the pot stickers and those were tasty as well. Try this place, you wont go wrong! I have yet to try the "original san tung" but id honestly go back to this one anytime! 5 stars for the great tasting food, and the service!
author: Marlon M.

description: Long wait!!! Service was ok!!! Need to hire more people!!! But food was great specially the fried chicken!!! I would recommend this place but make sure you come earlier..,
author: Patrick D.

description: So funny how they made another San Tung right next to the original and called it San Tung #2 lmao. I think that is so funny. We were waitlisted for both locations. 51 for #1 and 25 for #2. Cray cray. Long ass lines. Long ass waitlist. But seemed like a lot of people didn't want to wait on a Saturday night and left. So the wait wasn't TOO TOO bad so we eventually got seated at #2. This location has a smaller menu and does not serve the lunch special. I am not picky when it comes to food so I was fine with a smaller menu. We ordered the egg flower soup that my daughter really liked. We also ordered the pork dumplings (which she liked too), string beans, combo fried rice, black bean noodle, and of course the bomb ass chicken wings. I don't know how to describe it, its like sweet glazed caramelized. Everything was good. The service was good too when we went. Not much to say except the food was pretty good and the service was good when we went. The only con would be the long wait but what can ya do about it, everyone wants to eat here! Parking was kinda hard too, good luck with that!
author: Jan E.

description: My overall experience with Santung #2's food  was good. This one star I've given is the complaint about their customer service. Only two waiters in the entire restaurant. They did not refill water nor asked if we were doing okay. I even saw one of the waiter's expression when one table gave them a small tip. One advice, please hire waiters that can really improve your restaurant's customer service.
author: Kim C.

description: Everyone told me I had to check out San Tung while in San Fran. So I went with some seasoned San tung experts a few days ago to check it out! It did not disappoint! When we arrived the line for San tung (the original) was out the door. My friends told me San tung #2 was just as good with all the staples found at the original. So we decided to go there. We only had to wait about 5 mins before we were seated! We ordered the chicken, string beans, black bean noodles, dumplings, and vegetable moo shu. All the food was excellent and fast service. This place is definitely as good as all the hype!
author: Nicole L.

description: I'm not usually a fan of fusion, but this is pretty yummy! A mix of Korean and Chinese Food, I got the hot and sour soup, Ja Jerng mein, as its pronounced in Cantonese, better known as black bean noodles, and of course their famous chicken wings. It was very tasty! Be sure to order their dry cooked wings! Oh and be ready to wait for a bit, we were actually trying to go to the original San Tung, but this place next door ended up calling us first, and I'm pretty sure its just as good but their menu is reduced.
author: Samantha C.

description: Our meal was good though not exactly exciting.  The wings are still good.  The black bean noodles were kinda boring and not at all spicy.  BUT we only waited 5 min.  Fantastic.
author: Courtney C.

description: OK...no biggie, over rated, pricey, typical dive, bad lighting, tacky decor...so over these No Frills bad SF Chinese restaurants call 911 LOL!!! Sticky Wings almost $12 REALLY??? I prefer Alice's, New Tsing Tao, or Dumpling Kitchen for Chinese YUM!
author: Ron M.

description: Delicious "crack chicken"!! We went to San Tung 2 because there was hardly any wait there. We went to 2 because we only really wanted the chicken. I think if you want more options though, it's probably worth it to wait for the original San Tung.
author: Jasmin I.

description: The way they cook and coat the wings are delicious. A bit pricey but you get a good amount of wings and they are huge. I love shrimp. Get it in the shrimp version. Yum I've been here four times so far. Service wasn't bad but it wasn't amazing.
author: Lea B.

description: Restaurant is being dishonest. We put our name down for 3 and waited 45 minutes. A party of 3 walked right in front of us without any waiting just because they know the host. If the restaurant is lack of integrity on this, who know what they put in the food? I will not come back here again.
author: Raymond Q.

description: Came by to San Tung 2 because San Tung 1 was closed, they were on vacation. All good. Being that this was my first time next door, I didn't know there's a white board you sign your name on as you wait. I looked really stupid just standing there, thinking the girls would help me out or say something so I don't look stupid, but they didn't. So I went up and asked them saying no body bothered helping me out do you write names down and what not. And she told me to write it on the board. Okay. So I did and waited about half an hour for a table for 2. Waiting my boyfriend and I have already decided what to get so our food would come out. Our food came out but where's our drinks? I had to wait for the girl to come by to remind her about our drinks. I can see it in their eyes how they utterly hated their jobs. Reminded me of me and my former co worker of when I worked at a Chinese restaurant and how bad it sucked.. But being a bit attentive could've been nice. Service wasn't that great, but I tipped them because I know how bad it sucks to be a server let alone work at a Chinese restaurant. Food was good, too bad they were out of all beef products, but didn't really care because we only came for the chicken wings.
author: Diane T.

description: I don't know I think it's the same kitchen in both restaurants. The only difference was service. It was awful - Idk maybe those girls had a bad day or whatever but it was horrible.( I went there twice)
author: Yulya M.

description: I crave their chicken all the time and it's always worth the wait! I appreciate that no matter how busy they get, they are never rude.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Chicken Wings are good, but not GREAT.  I still favor Capital in Chinatown!
author: Daphnie A.

description: the menu list here is smaller than the original spot but all the good stuff is available.  Dumplings, dried fried wings & shrimp, and the noodle dishes.  I dont know what all these other Yelpers are crying about but the food was good and the service was very good as well.
author: sam k.

description: BEWARE DODGY HOURS!!!  I've been by a few times in the last week or two and they were not open during their posted hours and there was no sign indicating why.  So, not sure this part of San Tung is still in operation.
author: j d.

description:
No lines when we came in Sat lunch time.  Still a little long wait for the food to come out ; looking around, all the customers are eating considering there's not a ton of order tickets in the kitchen.  20 mins waits for 2 items.  The Deluxe noodles suppose to have seafood, shrimps, squid,scallops  and vegi.  I found 3 small shrimps, 3 squids and crumbs/fragments of scallops about 1 mm thick and weight about 0.00000002 gram.  Its testament of  the chief's great knifes skill.  Some zucchini, onion.   The hand-made noodles were soggy/over cooked and blend.  The pro is- there is a great quantity of noodle like a big wash basin;  the con is- do you really want a big bowl of soggy blend noodles?
I over heard next table complains about their noodle dish which they send back to the kitchen to put a sauce on.
Second dish is Kung Pao chicken which is OK  lacking 1 key ingredient : celery.
Peanuts kind of not fresh.  I've had better, nothing to write home about.  I can easily get this dish 50% off at any cheap joint.
My taste bud is already trained by eating at" So" the son of San Tung's owner so they actually have similar menu except with more flavor and spice.  If you like #2, you should try "So."
author: Lantz G.

description: Tried to go to the original one next door but the line was out the door.  Went here and asked the difference.  The guy said just a smaller menu. So my gf and I decided to stay and it was amazing.  The drive fried chicken and green beans were mouth watering.  It was our first time there and the food was amazing.  Highly recommended!
author: Rashid C.

description: Not as good as the original. I went in because the originals line was insane, as usual, and I'm sad I did. It just was not as good, can't really pinpoint why. I say just wait the extra time for a seat next door, it is definitely well worth it!
author: Amanda E.

description: this place posin lol aint better than the og san tung #1. if u wanna get schemed than com here
author: Kevin F.

description:
the food is pretty good but make sure you go there 
 around 4:30 to 5 pm otherwsise you will 
 be like a sitting duck and the  food is pretty good and 
price is reasonable ,good with friend and family
author: Hendra S.

description: went to The original San tung and it was super busy. we were 34 on the list, luckily we asked the worker how long it was going to take and he told us to check next door. we were 3 in line at this one. We got the chicken wings, black bean noodle and shrimp & leek dumpling. man oh man was this meal delicious. The chicken was crispy, not too dry not too saucy. The sauce had a touch of spicy and just overall was the best fried chicken I've ever had, and it was cheap. Their homemade noodles were amazing, it was soft and tasty. There was like potato and squid in it i think. the potato kind of threw me off but overall they were good. The dumplings were good, not too much leek so that it wasn't overpowering the shrimp but enough to go really well together and the skin was good. My meal turned out to be $33.15 and it lasted me and my bf for the dinner the next day as well. The quality for this food especially at a Chinese restaurant was on par and this is a must try if you ever visit SF looking for some great Chinese food and fried chicken.
author: Amanda B.

description: Wayyy more organized then the other san tung. Wait goes by quick! And if you're not present for your name they swipe it off the list! THANK GOD! Not like the other San Tung lol you gotta play like the maze game on the board to figure out where to sign your name.  (For those who go back and forth to the other San Tung and then get all butt hurt when they cross your name off. You people are annoying lol!) This place gets 3 stars for their customer service, and their food but sucks they don't have sweet and sour shrimp like the other San Tung, but other than that this place is pretty damn good (:
author: Gerline R.

description: My boyfriend and I was craving for San Tung's delicious chicken.  We drove up to San Francisco just for San Tung, like always.  Was taken by surprise to find that San Tung #2 has just opened up right next door (same owner).  #1 had a wait, #2 had availability... was wondering why people would wait when they can go right next door for the same thing.  So we decided to skip the wait and give #2 a try.  #2 location is smaller than the original but it is definitely a lot nicer.  Skeptical walking in but as we saw a familiar face in the kitchen, we were relieved.  We ordered the Dry Original Fried Chicken and were both VERY DISAPPOINTED!  It was very good but not San Tung! We could tell the difference immediately and felt that the drive to SF was not worth it.  Thanks for ruining our day.  Also got the Honey Walnut Shrimp which did not wow us at all either.  We will be sticking to San Tung #1 from now on...
author: Tran T.

description: Wings are solid. Service however is lacking. The past several times I have come here, there has been a line despite there being many empty tables. Appears understaffed. When I have managed to get a table, staff members have been rude, particularly the younger individuals. Will not bother with sit down in the future.
author: Consumer F.

description: Hands down the best fried chicken wings in SF!  I've been next door to San Tungs a few times but this was my first time at San Tung 2.  We had a group of 8 people and put our name on both waiting lists and we were called at the same time for both places.  We arrived at 5:30pm and waited about 30 min. on a Sunday night.  San Tung 2 has a calmer vibe than it's sister restaurant next door.  It has nice updated decor and has more space.  We ordered the wet dry fried chicken wings, chicken fried rice, sizzling rice soup, string beans, and noodles with peanut sauce.  The chicken, string beans, and fried rice were the best thing we ordered.  The noodle with peanut sauce was tasty but was a little to much for me.  The food came out quick.  All the servers were really nice and were quick to clear away used dishes at our table.  One of the servers was extremely nice to my young niece and the two quickly became friends.  Thanks for the sweet treat for my niece!  =)
author: Leen B.

description: I came here for lunch on a weekend visit to SF with my sorority sisters. The original San Tung right next door was packed and we were hungry and didn't want to wait, so we opted for this place because there was a shorter wait time and because we heard the food wasn't any different. We ordered four entrees for five people, which honestly was a lot and we probably should have ordered less. We had the hot & sour soup, string beans, black bean noodles, and of course the chicken wings. Honestly, I don't know what the hype for the chicken wings is all about. I thought they were decent, but I've had better. They kind of reminded me of mango habanero wings from buffalo wild wings, but not as good.. Or maybe I'm just biased because I love BWW. Anyways, the food was decent but my whole group thought everything tasted so sweet, and not in a good way.. We expected our food to have more flavor, but everything seemed to taste so sugary. Decent food though, and if I came back here I'd probably be coming back for the black bean noodles, not the wings. Mmm carbs..
author: Mae F.

description: Man I heard good reviews I'm pretty sure it's good food but FUCK YOU y'all rude as fuck not only that ima give u guys a negative y'all make me mad y'all suck dick whoever the owner is bad fukn customer service ima keep goin matter fact I was the first person to wait n got skipped wtf is that man I ain't tippin for shit I ain't never comin back I don't give a fuck what y'all say this place weak as fuck period
author: Mario M.

description: I Love San Tung but somehow opening up a second location right next door doesn't yield the same results. My family and I came here because the main restaurant was on vacation or something. The wait was a bit longer because of the smaller store and since we had 6 people, there was only one table that could fit us and these old timers just wouldn't leave for the longest time! Not the restaurant's fault at all, I was just frustrated. Anyways, we ordered 2 plates of wings, 2 black bean noodles, green beans, mongo beef, and twice cooked pork. Out of everything we ate, I have to say that the noodles were just a huge miss. It seems like they didn't strain the water enough so whatever sauce that was thrown just became soup. as such, the sauce got watered down and the noodles were just not enjoyable. Everything else minus the chicken and green beans were just decent. Wings were good but  I swear not as good as the original. If you're asking 'how can that be?!' well my hunch is that the chef for #2 is not the same chef as #1.
author: edward k.

description: Got in here before San Tung 1.  It's the same restaurant but just a condensed menu.  Which doesn't mean much because all the good items are indeed on this menu. San Tung cooks Northern Chinese food which is generally spicier, robust and oily.  Yes! Like being in the mood for American fried chicken, we had the beautiful chicken wings in honey glaze.  Oh the spice and the sweetness coming together with perfectly fried wings.  We saw a nearby table where all the dudes were eating their own plate of chicken wings!  The steamed dumplings were alright, they didn't quite come together between the filling and the dough.  The potstickers were done right in a larger size than what I usually expect.  We had beef and broccoli for the kid, which was decently done, extremely tender meat, though the sauce was too salty.  The final dish was the noodles in fried bean sauce, a very typical Northern dish.  It's a mild tasting sauce that is blended with thick homemade noodles with squid and zucchini.  Very filling and satisfying meal as usual for this cuisine.
author: Eric J.
